original: @231b ` // chos kyi rnam grangs kyi brjed byang bzhugs /
analyzed: @231b ` // chos kyi rnam grangs kyi brjed byang bzhugs /
translated: Notes on the Classification of Phenomena

original: * // chos kyi rnam grangs kyi brjed byang zhes bya ba /
analyzed: * // chos kyi rnam grangs kyi brjed byang zhes bya ba /
translated: Notes on the Classification of Phenomena

original: 'phags pa'i tshogs ma lus pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tshogs ma lus pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the entire assembly of noble ones.

original: de la chos kyi rnam grangs kyi brjed byang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang bstan bcos dang / shes rab 'bum dang / yo ga ts'arya la sogs pa gzhung tha dad pa mang po'i nang nas don 'dus pa'i tshig 'jebs 'jebs mdo tsam btus te /üîΩchos mang po nyan @232a * //
analyzed: de la chos kyi rnam grangs kyi brjed byang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang bstan bcos dang / shes rab 'bum dang / yo ga ts'arya la sogs pa gzhung tha dad pa mang po'i nang nas don 'dus pa'i tshig 'jebs 'jebs mdo tsam btus te / chos mang po nyan @232a * //
translated: Here, Notes on the Classification of Phenomena means that from among the many different texts such as sutras, treatises, the Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Lines, the Yoga of Action, and so forth, the essential meaning is extracted in a few pleasing words.

original: mi nus pa'i gang zag rnams kyis tshegs chung ngus gsung rab kyi don rtogs par bya ba dang / rang gi lus gzhig pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi nus pa'i gang zag rnams kyis tshegs chung ngus gsung rab kyi don rtogs par bya ba dang / rang gi lus gzhig pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught for the sake of those individuals who are unable to listen to many teachings, so that they may realize the meaning of the scriptures with little difficulty, and so that they may become skilled in the characteristics of destroying their own bodies.

original: de yang gzugs kyi phung po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang gzugs kyi phung po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, it begins with What is the aggregate of form? and so on.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid yo ga ts'arya las 'byung ba de ston to //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid yo ga ts'arya las 'byung ba de ston to //
translated: The characteristics of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are taught in the Yoga Carya.

original: de yang phung po lnga'i nang nas gzungs kyi phung po gang yin zhes bya ba'i don ston to //
analyzed: de yang phung po lnga'i nang nas gzungs kyi phung po gang yin zhes bya ba'i don ston to //
translated: And that also teaches the meaning of Which is the aggregate of form among the five aggregates?

original: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever form there is,

original: de dag thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: all of that is the four great elements and the four great elements as the cause.

original: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste /üîΩde dag thams cad ces bya ba ni gzugs ring po dang thung ngu dang zlum po dang zlum po dang gru bzhi dang / sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi gzugs dang / nye ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs gang yin pa ci yang rung ste / de dag thams cad ces bya ba ni gzugs ring po dang thung ngu dang zlum po dang zlum po dang gru bzhi dang / sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi gzugs dang / nye ba dang /
translated: Whatever form there is,

original: ring ba dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa la sogs pa ji tsam du gzugs su gdags pa thams cad do //
analyzed: ring ba dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa la sogs pa ji tsam du gzugs su gdags pa thams cad do //
translated: all of that means all forms, long and short, round and square, blue, yellow, and so on, past, future, and present forms, near and far, good and bad, and so on, as much as form is designated.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni me dang chu dang sa dang rlung bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni me dang chu dang sa dang rlung bzhi'o //
translated: The four great elements are the four: earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ni 'byung ba de las skyes pa'am /üîΩde las gyur zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ni 'byung ba de las skyes pa'am / de las gyur zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Form derived from the great elements is form that arises from the elements or is transformed by the elements.

original: rgyu de las byung ba'i gzugs rnams te /
analyzed: rgyu de las byung ba'i gzugs rnams te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúarisen from that‚Äù or ‚Äútransformed by that‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúderived from that.‚ÄùüîΩForm derived from the great elements is the eleven types of form:

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang / dbang po de rnams kyi yul gzugs nas reg bya'i bar du lnga ste bcu dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs te bcu gcig dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang / dbang po de rnams kyi yul gzugs nas reg bya'i bar du lnga ste bcu dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs te bcu gcig dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi ste /
translated: the five sense faculties such as the eyes, the five objects such as form, nonindicative form, and the four great elements.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la phye na spyir bco lnga yod do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la phye na spyir bco lnga yod do //
translated: When the form aggregate is divided, there are fifteen types in all.

original: gzugs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Form is of three types:

original: bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa dang gsum mo //
translated: indicative and impeded, nonindicative and impeded, and neither indicative nor impeded.

original: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa ni bstan du yang yod cing thogs pa dang yang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i mtshan nyid kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa ni bstan du yang yod cing thogs pa dang yang bcas pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of the four great elements, such as color and shape, are demonstrable and resistant.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya ba ni bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya ba ni bstan du med la thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The five sense faculties, such as the eye, and the five sense objects, such as sound, are not demonstrable but are resistant.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa ste /üîΩde ni rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs dang bsam gtan @232b bzhi la /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni bstan du yang med la thogs pa yang med pa ste / de ni rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs dang bsam gtan @232b bzhi la /
translated: Non-informative form is neither demonstrable nor resistant.

original: rgyu gzugs can las skyes pa'i phyir gzugs su gzhag ste /
analyzed: rgyu gzugs can las skyes pa'i phyir gzugs su gzhag ste /
translated: It is established as form because it arises from the cause of informative form and the four absorptions.

original: gzugs kyi phung po ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po ni de lta bu'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the form aggregate.

original: tshor ba'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the feeling aggregate?

original: myong ba rnam pa gsum ste zhes smos te /
analyzed: myong ba rnam pa gsum ste zhes smos te /
translated: It is said to be the three kinds of experience.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gsum nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa gsum nyams su myong ba ni tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The three kinds of experience are pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de la bde ba ni gang 'gags na phrad par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems las dben zhing bde ba byung na de dang bral bar mi 'dod la bral na yang slar phrad par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la bde ba ni gang 'gags na phrad par 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems las dben zhing bde ba byung na de dang bral bar mi 'dod la bral na yang slar phrad par 'dod pa'o //
translated: When the body and mind are isolated and pleasure arises, one does not wish to be separated from it, and when separated, one wishes to meet with it again.

original: sdug bsngal ni gang byung na bral bar 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems la gnod pa zhig byung na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni gang byung na bral bar 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba ni lus dang sems la gnod pa zhig byung na /
translated: Pain is that which, when it arises, one wishes to be separated from.

original: de dang 'grogs par mi 'dod pas na bral bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'grogs par mi 'dod pas na bral bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: When the body and mind are harmed, one does not wish to be accompanied by it, and thus wishes to be separated from it.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni gang byung na gnyi gar 'dod par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni gang byung na gnyi gar 'dod par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Neither pain nor pleasure is that which, when it arises, one does not wish to be accompanied by or separated from.

original: lus dang sems la gnod par byed pa med pas bral bar 'dod pa yang med /
analyzed: lus dang sems la gnod par byed pa med pas bral bar 'dod pa yang med /
translated: Since there is no harm to the body and mind, one does not wish to be separated from it.

original: lus dang sems la lhag par bde zhing phan par byed pa yang med pas na 'grogs pa'am phrad par 'dod pa yang med de /üîΩgnyi gar 'dod pa med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems la lhag par bde zhing phan par byed pa yang med pas na 'grogs pa'am phrad par 'dod pa yang med de /üîΩgnyi gar 'dod pa med ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since there is no special benefit or pleasure for the body and mind, one does not wish to be accompanied by or meet with it.üîΩThus, one does not wish to be accompanied by or separated from it.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of perception?

original: yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is the apprehension of the signs of the object in its three aspects:

original: chung ngu dang / chen po dang / tshad med pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: chung ngu dang / chen po dang / tshad med pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: small, large, and immense.

original: yul ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa dmigs par bya ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: yul ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa dmigs par bya ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The object is the phenomena that are to be perceived, such as form, sound, etc.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bye brag tha dad pa mang po la bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bye brag tha dad pa mang po la bya'o //
translated: The apprehension of the signs refers to the many different kinds of color and shape.

original: chung ngu ni 'dod pa'i khams ngan pa la dmigs pa'o //üîΩchen po ni bsam gtan dang po nas /
analyzed: chung ngu ni 'dod pa'i khams ngan pa la dmigs pa'o // chen po ni bsam gtan dang po nas /
translated: The small is that which is based on the inferior realm of desire.

original: bzhi pa man chad de gzugs kyi khams la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa man chad de gzugs kyi khams la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The large is that which is based on the realm of form, from the first meditative state up to the fourth.

original: tshad med pa ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min man chad de /
analyzed: tshad med pa ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min man chad de /
translated: The immense is that which is based on the formless realm, from the station of endless space up to the station of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa dang gsum mo //
translated: These are the three kinds of perception.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of motivation?

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams te zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen mang po tshogs pa las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos rnams te zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen mang po tshogs pa las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: They are called formations because they arise from the assembly of many causes and conditions.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por bsdus pa kun la yang 'du byed ces bya mod kyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung por bsdus pa kun la yang 'du byed ces bya mod kyi /
translated: They are included in the aggregates of form and so on.

original: 'di ni sems las byung ba'i 'du byed @233a * //üîΩrnams la bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sems las byung ba'i 'du byed @233a * // rnams la bya ste /
translated: However, here they refer to mental formations that are mental factors.üîΩThey are taught in the Abhidharma as the five omnipresent mental factors, the five object-determining mental factors, the eleven virtuous mental factors, the six root afflictions, the twenty secondary afflictions, and the four changeable mental factors.üîΩThe five omnipresent mental factors are contact, intention, discernment, feeling, and attention.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis gong du phung po'i nang du bstan pas de bkol ba'i phyi ma reg pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes gnyis gong du phung po'i nang du bstan pas de bkol ba'i phyi ma reg pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The five object-determining mental factors are aspiration, resolution, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.üîΩThe eleven virtuous mental factors are faith, conscience, shame, absence of desire, absence of hatred, absence of ignorance, effort, pliancy, equanimity, nonviolence, and nonhatred.üîΩThe six root afflictions are desire, anger, pride, ignorance, view, and doubt.üîΩThe twenty secondary afflictions are anger, malice, hypocrisy, spite, envy, avarice, deceit, dissimulation, haughtiness, violence, lack of conscience, shamelessness, lethargy, excitedness, lack of faith, laziness, heedlessness, lack of recognition, forgetfulness, and distraction.

original: dpyod pa la thug pa'i bar de dag la bya'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa la thug pa'i bar de dag la bya'o //
translated: The four changeable mental factors are sleep, investigation, analysis, and remorse.

original: de dag las lnga kun du 'gro ba gang zhe na zhes smos te /üîΩ'du byed sems dang ldan pa lnga bcu rtsa gcig sems dang mi ldan pa bcu bzhi po de dag re re nas ston to //
analyzed: de dag las lnga kun du 'gro ba gang zhe na zhes smos te /üîΩ'du byed sems dang ldan pa lnga bcu rtsa gcig sems dang mi ldan pa bcu bzhi po de dag re re nas ston to //
translated: The five omnipresent mental factors are contact, intention, discernment, feeling, and attention.

original: kun du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa kun gyi nang du snang zhing 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa kun gyi nang du snang zhing 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Omnipresent means that it appears and engages in all virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral states.

original: reg pa ni gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcod pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: reg pa ni gsum 'dus nas yongs su gcod pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Contact is the complete discernment of the three coming together.

original: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa las /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa las /
translated: The three are the object, the sense faculty, and the consciousness.

original: yul bde ba la sogs pa ji lta ba de ltar dbang po yang 'gyur ba de rnam par shes pas gcod cing tshor ba skyed par byed pas na reg pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul bde ba la sogs pa ji lta ba de ltar dbang po yang 'gyur ba de rnam par shes pas gcod cing tshor ba skyed par byed pas na reg pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the three come together, the object is discerned in accordance with the object‚Äôs pleasantness, etc., and the sense faculty is also affected in the same way. Since the consciousness discerns the object and produces the feeling, it is called contact.üîΩAttention is the engagement of the mind.

original: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba'i yul la sems gtod cing mngon du phyogs par byed pas na sems kyi 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba'i yul la sems gtod cing mngon du phyogs par byed pas na sems kyi 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the engagement of the mind because it directs the mind to the object that is to be focused on and makes the mind face the object.

original: tshor ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshor ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Feeling is the experience of the maturation that is the result of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral actions.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gnyi ga ma yin pa gsum nyams su myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gnyi ga ma yin pa gsum nyams su myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: It causes the experience of the three results of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral karma: happiness, suffering, and neither of those two.üîΩDiscrimination is the differentiation of the objects of consciousness.

original: 'du shes ni rnam par shes pa'i don rnams la bye brag 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa tha dad pa'i bye brag so sor gsal bar byed cing gcod pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni rnam par shes pa'i don rnams la bye brag 'byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa tha dad pa'i bye brag so sor gsal bar byed cing gcod pa'o //
translated: It is the clear differentiation and division of the objects of the five sense consciousnesses.üîΩ Intention is the mental activity that directs the mind to virtue, nonvirtue, or the absence of both.üîΩIt is mental karma.

original: sems pa ni yon tan dang nyes pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa la sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las so zhes bya ba ni las dge ba ni yon tan zhes bya /üîΩlas mi dge ba ni nyes pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sems pa ni yon tan dang nyes pa dang gnyi ga ma yin pa la sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las so zhes bya ba ni las dge ba ni yon tan zhes bya / las mi dge ba ni nyes pa zhes bya /
translated: Virtuous karma is called virtue.üîΩNonvirtuous karma is called nonvirtue.

original: las lung du ma bstan pa ni gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las lung du ma bstan pa ni gnyi ga ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Neutral karma is called the absence of both.

original: las de gsum la sems pas sems slong zhing gtod pa ni /
analyzed: las de gsum la sems pas sems slong zhing gtod pa ni /
translated: Intention directs the mind to those three karmas and engages the mind in them.

original: dper na rdo khab len gyis khab g-yo bar byed pa bzhin dmigs pa'i yul la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na rdo khab len gyis khab g-yo bar byed pa bzhin dmigs pa'i yul la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, it is like a magnet that moves iron.

original: lnga yul so sor nges pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga yul so sor nges pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the determination of the object?

original: 'dun pa ni bsam pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni bsam pa'i dngos po la 'dod pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: It is the desire for the object of thought.

original: kun du 'gro ba ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas kun la mi 'jug gi @233b rang gi yul gang yin pa de nyi tshe la 'jug pas na /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas kun la mi 'jug gi @233b rang gi yul gang yin pa de nyi tshe la 'jug pas na /
translated: It is not like the universal mental factors that occur in all situations, whether virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral. It occurs only in relation to its own object.

original: yul so sor nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the determination of the object.

original: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i yul du gyur pa gang yang rung ba de dag ni bsam pa'i dngos po zhes bya /üîΩde la mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir don du gnyer zhing bsgrub pa ni 'dod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i yul du gyur pa gang yang rung ba de dag ni bsam pa'i dngos po zhes bya / de la mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir don du gnyer zhing bsgrub pa ni 'dod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The object of thought is any object that is the object of a faculty or consciousness.üîΩThe desire for it is the wish to experience it directly.

original: der 'dun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der 'dun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called desire because it is the desire for that object.

original: mos pa ni nges pa'i dngos po de bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la nges pa ni mos pa'i yul nyi tshe la bya ste /
analyzed: mos pa ni nges pa'i dngos po de bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la nges pa ni mos pa'i yul nyi tshe la bya ste /
translated: Interest is the holding of a definite object as definite.

original: ma mos pa'i yul gzhan la mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma mos pa'i yul gzhan la mi bya'o //
translated: The object of interest is a part of the definite object, not the other part which is not of interest.

original: de yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas dpyad de /
analyzed: de yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas dpyad de /
translated: Moreover, it is investigated by means of direct perception and inference.

original: mdo sde dang bstan bcos kyi lung la yid ches shing the tshom med pa ni nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde dang bstan bcos kyi lung la yid ches shing the tshom med pa ni nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Confidence and lack of doubt in the scriptures of the sutras and sastras is called definiteness.

original: yang na chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtag pa dang bde ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtag pa dang bde ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Or, the characteristics of phenomena, whether general or specific, are not held to be permanent or blissful,

original: mi rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa la nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs par 'dzin pa la nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: but are held to be impermanent and so forth. This is called definiteness.üîΩRecollection is the non-forgetting of a familiar object, the mental expression of it.

original: dran pa ni 'dris pa'i dngos po nyid ma brjed pa ste sems kyis mngon par brjod pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sngon 'phrad cing nyams su myong ste 'grogs 'grogs pa na /üîΩ'dris pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dran pa ni 'dris pa'i dngos po nyid ma brjed pa ste sems kyis mngon par brjod pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sngon 'phrad cing nyams su myong ste 'grogs 'grogs pa na / 'dris pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one has previously met with and experienced something, it is called familiar.

original: 'dris pa de lta bu'i dngos po ma brjed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dris pa de lta bu'i dngos po ma brjed pa ste /
translated: The non-forgetting of such a familiar object is recollection.

original: dper na tshig tu smra ba nang 'dra bar gsal bar dran pa ni sems kyis mngon par brjod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na tshig tu smra ba nang 'dra bar gsal bar dran pa ni sems kyis mngon par brjod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, the clear memory of a similar internal speech is called mental expression.üîΩConcentration is the one-pointedness of mind on a conceptually elaborated entity.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni brtag pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba la brtag pa'i dngos po ni ma byung ma skyes pa'i don nyid dam bden pa bzhi la gcig cing yang bzhi bzhi ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni brtag pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba la brtag pa'i dngos po ni ma byung ma skyes pa'i don nyid dam bden pa bzhi la gcig cing yang bzhi bzhi ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: A conceptually elaborated entity is an object that has not arisen or is not yet born, or it is the four truths, which should be understood as one and also as four.

original: sems rtse gcig pa ni dper na skud pa'i sna bsgrims te khab kyi mig tu gzhug pa dang 'dra bar bsgom pa'i yul sems gzhan du mi g-yeng bar gtod pa ni ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa ni dper na skud pa'i sna bsgrims te khab kyi mig tu gzhug pa dang 'dra bar bsgom pa'i yul sems gzhan du mi g-yeng bar gtod pa ni ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is like a thread that is drawn through the eye of a needle. It is the focusing of the mind on the object of meditation without distraction by other objects. This is called one-pointed concentration.

original: shes rab ni de dag nyid la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni de dag nyid la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Wisdom is the thorough differentiation of those very [three trainings].

original: rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa dang gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa dang gzhan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is produced by reasoning and non-reasoning, and is other than those [reasoning and non-reasoning].

original: shes rab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Wisdom is of three kinds:

original: mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: mnyan pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: The wisdom of hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: de yang sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la zhugs pa ni rigs pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la zhugs pa ni rigs pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, that which is generated by reasoning is the one who has entered the teaching of the Buddha.

original: mu stegs kyi bstan pa la zhugs pa ni rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs kyi bstan pa la zhugs pa ni rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is generated by non-reasoning is said to be the one who has entered the teaching of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: de gnyis kas ma bstan kyang rang bzhin gyis shes nyen che ba ni gzhan pa @234a * //
analyzed: de gnyis kas ma bstan kyang rang bzhin gyis shes nyen che ba ni gzhan pa @234a * //
translated: That which is not taught by either of those two, but is naturally very knowledgeable, is said to be the other.

original: zhes bya'o // de dag nyid la rab tu rnam par 'byed ces bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yul nyid la ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de dag nyid la rab tu rnam par 'byed ces bya ba ni gong du smos pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yul nyid la ste /
translated: The one who is very discerning in regard to those very objects of meditative concentration mentioned above is the one who is discerning.

original: rigs pa'i shes pas ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ces don dam par skye 'gag med pa dang / kun rdzob tu sa srab dang chu gsher ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar gtan la 'bebs so //
analyzed: rigs pa'i shes pas ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ces don dam par skye 'gag med pa dang / kun rdzob tu sa srab dang chu gsher ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar gtan la 'bebs so //
translated: The wisdom of reasoning unerringly determines the specific and general characteristics of phenomena, the ultimate absence of arising and cessation, and the conventional characteristics of earth being hard, water being wet, and so on.

original: rigs pa ma yin pa'i shes pas ni bdag med pa bdag yod par brtags shing bsgoms te rva skyes par mthong ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pa'i shes pas ni bdag med pa bdag yod par brtags shing bsgoms te rva skyes par mthong ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The cognition that is not a means of valid knowledge is the imagination of a self in selflessness, as when one imagines that a cairn is a man.

original: gzhan pa'i shes rab ni sus kyang ma bslabs par rang bzhin gyis blo rno zhing las su bya ba dang / tshig tu smra ba la sogs pa bya ba thams cad la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i shes rab ni sus kyang ma bslabs par rang bzhin gyis blo rno zhing las su bya ba dang / tshig tu smra ba la sogs pa bya ba thams cad la mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of another is the natural sharpness of the intellect of one who has not been instructed, because he is skilled in all actions, such as work and speech.

original: bcu gcig dge ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gcig dge ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the elevenfold good?

original: dad pa ni las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches pa dang / sems dang ba'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: dad pa ni las dang / 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches pa dang / sems dang ba'o zhes smos te /
translated: Faith is the clear comprehension and the serenity of mind with regard to action, result, the truths, and the Jewels.

original: las ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: las ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Action is good, bad, and neither.

original: 'bras bu ni las des bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni las des bskyed pa ste /
translated: Result is what is produced by that action.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gnyi ga ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gnyi ga ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is pleasant, unpleasant, and neither.

original: bden pa ni bzhi ste sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa ni bzhi ste sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa ste /
translated: The truths are four: the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the cessation of suffering, and the truth of the path.

original: de dag yod par yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: de dag yod par yid ches pa'o //
translated: It is the belief in their existence.

original: dkon mchog ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog ni gsum ste /
translated: The Jewels are three in number.

original: sangs rgyas ni mkhyen pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni mkhyen pa dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha is the one who is endowed with the knowledge and abandonment.

original: chos ni sdug bsngal thams cad las thar bar byed pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: chos ni sdug bsngal thams cad las thar bar byed pa'i lam yin no //
translated: The Dharma is the path which leads to the cessation of all suffering.üîΩThe Sa·πÖgha is the field of merit which is engaged in the abandonment of the defilements.

original: dge 'dun ni nyon mongs pa spong ba la zhugs pa bsod nams kyi zhing yin no zhes de dag gi yon tan rig nas sems dang ba ni dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni nyon mongs pa spong ba la zhugs pa bsod nams kyi zhing yin no zhes de dag gi yon tan rig nas sems dang ba ni dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having understood their qualities, the clarity of mind is called faith.

original: ngo tsha shes pa ni bdag gam chos kyi dbang du byas te kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa ni bdag gam chos kyi dbang du byas te kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: It is said that shame is the avoidance of what is objectionable, taking oneself or the Dharma as the standard.

original: bdag ni dge sbyong ngam bram ze lta bu rigs btsun pa'i tshul 'dzin pa yin gyi las ngan pa bya bar mi 'os pa 'di dag ni bdag gis bya ba'i cha ma yin no snyam nas mi byed pa ni bdag gi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni dge sbyong ngam bram ze lta bu rigs btsun pa'i tshul 'dzin pa yin gyi las ngan pa bya bar mi 'os pa 'di dag ni bdag gis bya ba'i cha ma yin no snyam nas mi byed pa ni bdag gi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: One does not do it, thinking, ‚ÄúIt is not proper for me to do such bad actions, since I am a ≈õrama·πáa, a brahmin, or one who holds the rules of a noble family.‚Äù This is taking oneself as the standard.

original: chos kyi dbang du byas pa ni las ngan pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas na de'i 'bras bu ngan song rgyud gsum du ltung zhing sdug bsngal sna tshogs su gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbang du byas pa ni las ngan pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i las byas na de'i 'bras bu ngan song rgyud gsum du ltung zhing sdug bsngal sna tshogs su gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas mi byed pa'o //
translated: With regard to Dharma, one thinks, If I do evil actions, bad actions, I will fall into the three continuums of the lower realms and experience various sufferings. It is not right to do that, and so one does not do it.

original: kha na ma tho ba ni tshig tu gleng zhing brjod du mi bzod @234b de smra bar yang mi 'os shing smad pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ni tshig tu gleng zhing brjod du mi bzod @234b de smra bar yang mi 'os shing smad pa'i gnas te /
translated: Shame is that which cannot bear to be spoken or expressed in words, and is not fit to be spoken, and is a basis of contempt.

original: de lta bus 'jigs pa ni 'dzem pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bus 'jigs pa ni 'dzem pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Fear of that is called embarrassment.üîΩEmbarrassment with regard to the world is shame with regard to wrongdoing.

original: khrel yod pa ni 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas te kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdag gis srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las bya ba'i cha ma yin pa 'di dag byas na gzhan gyis smad cing dpyas te skyon du grags na
analyzed: khrel yod pa ni 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas te kha na ma tho bas 'dzem pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdag gis srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i las bya ba'i cha ma yin pa 'di dag byas na gzhan gyis smad cing dpyas te skyon du grags na
translated: If I do these things that are not to be done, such as killing, others will despise me, reproach me, and my faults will be known.

original: ma legs so snyam du de 'jigs shing mi byed pa ni 'dzem pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma legs so snyam du de 'jigs shing mi byed pa ni 'dzem pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Fearing that, one does not do it, and that is called embarrassment.

original: ma chags pa ni chags pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: ma chags pa ni chags pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: Nonattachment is the antidote to attachment.

original: yid 'byung zhing mi len pa'o zhes bya ba la chags par bya ba'i yul ni lus dang longs spyod do /
analyzed: yid 'byung zhing mi len pa'o zhes bya ba la chags par bya ba'i yul ni lus dang longs spyod do /
translated: One is disgusted and does not grasp means that the body and possessions are the objects of attachment.

original: de dag gi gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum gyi gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang byams pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ste rim bzhin du re rer sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gsum gyi gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang byams pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ste rim bzhin du re rer sbyar ro //
translated: Their antidotes are the antidotes to the three: desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: yid 'byung zhing mi len pa ni lus dang longs spyod de dag la spyod cing gnas pa'i mtha' skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs 'byung zhing 'phel bar rig nas spong zhing de la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yid 'byung zhing mi len pa ni lus dang longs spyod de dag la spyod cing gnas pa'i mtha' skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs 'byung zhing 'phel bar rig nas spong zhing de la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: One is disgusted and does not grasp means that one abandons and does not engage in the body and possessions, knowing that various sufferings such as birth, aging, sickness, and death arise and increase for one who engages in and abides in them.

original: zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang gi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa ni zhe sdang gi gnyen po ste /
translated: Non-hatred is the antidote to hatred.

original: byams pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: byams pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: It is said to be loving-kindness.

original: zhe sdang gi yul ni dgra dang dug dang mtshon cha dag ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi yul ni dgra dang dug dang mtshon cha dag ste /
translated: The objects of hatred are enemies, poison, and weapons.

original: de dag gzhig pa dang phung pa dang brlag par bya'o snyam pa ni zhe sdang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gzhig pa dang phung pa dang brlag par bya'o snyam pa ni zhe sdang zhes bya ste /
translated: The thought I will destroy, crush, and annihilate them is called hatred.

original: de lta bu'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba mi byed pa nyid la yang gnyen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba mi byed pa nyid la yang gnyen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The very fact that one does not act with such thoughts and deeds is called the antidote.

original: 'dir ni sems can thams cad la bu gces pa dang 'dra bar byams pa'i sems yod pa de la zhe sdang mi 'byung bas na gnyen po ste byams pa la zhe sdang med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni sems can thams cad la bu gces pa dang 'dra bar byams pa'i sems yod pa de la zhe sdang mi 'byung bas na gnyen po ste byams pa la zhe sdang med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, since hatred does not arise in one who has a loving mind toward all sentient beings, as if they were his cherished only child, it is called the antidote of loving kindness, which is the absence of hatred.

original: gti mug med pa ni gti mug gi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: gti mug med pa ni gti mug gi gnyen po ste /
translated: The absence of delusion is the antidote to delusion.

original: yang dag pa la yang dag par rtog pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: yang dag pa la yang dag par rtog pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: It is said to be the correct conception of what is true.

original: chos rnams la chos dang gang zag dngos po yod par lta zhing /
analyzed: chos rnams la chos dang gang zag dngos po yod par lta zhing /
translated: It is called conception when one views phenomena as real entities, as persons, and as existent things,

analyzed: stong pa dang bdag med pa la sogs par shes pa ni yang dag pa la yang dag par rtog pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: brtson 'grus ni le lo'i gnyen po ste / dge ba la sems @235a * //
translated: Effort is the antidote to laziness.üîΩIt is the mental

original: mngon par spro ba'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: mngon par spro ba'o zhes smos te /

original: le lo ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: le lo ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: dman pa la sbyor ba dang / snyom las so //
analyzed: dman pa la sbyor ba dang / snyom las so //

analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni lus ngal shing snyom pa dang skyo zhing dub pa med par yang zhing bde ba dang zhum rgod dang bying rgod med de gsal zhing rtse gcig tu 'dug pa ste /

original: lus dang sems de ltar gyur pa ni las su rung ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems de ltar gyur pa ni las su rung ba dang shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Such a state of body and mind is called ‚Äúserviceability‚Äù and ‚Äúpliancy.‚Äù

original: bag yod pa ni bag med pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: bag yod pa ni bag med pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: Conscientiousness is the antidote to carelessness.

original: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar de dag la gnas nas mi dge ba'i chos spong zhing de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams kyang bsgom pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: ma chags pa nas brtson 'grus kyi bar de dag la gnas nas mi dge ba'i chos spong zhing de'i gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams kyang bsgom pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: It is said that, based on nonattachment, etc., up to diligence, one abandons nonvirtuous dharmas and cultivates their antidotes, the virtuous dharmas.

original: bag yod pa ni 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa gsum gyis rgyu byas shing brtson 'grus la gnas bcas nas mi dge ba'i chos rnams la sems yan du mi gtong zhing phyir zlog pa ni mi dge ba spong ba'o //
analyzed: bag yod pa ni 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa gsum gyis rgyu byas shing brtson 'grus la gnas bcas nas mi dge ba'i chos rnams la sems yan du mi gtong zhing phyir zlog pa ni mi dge ba spong ba'o //
translated: Conscientiousness is the cause of nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion, and based on diligence, one does not allow the mind to be distracted by nonvirtuous dharmas and turns it back. This is the abandonment of nonvirtue.

original: dge ba'i chos bsgom pa ni mos pas spyod pa dang sa dang po la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi dge ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba de dag ni gnyen po ste de la sems kyis yang yang du 'dris par byed pa ni bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos bsgom pa ni mos pas spyod pa dang sa dang po la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi dge ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba de dag ni gnyen po ste de la sems kyis yang yang du 'dris par byed pa ni bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The repeated familiarization with that antidote by the mind is called cultivation.

original: btang snyoms ni ma chags pa nas brtson @235b 'grus kyi bar de dag nyid la gnas shing sems mnyam pa nyid dang / sems rnal du 'dug pa nyid dang / sems lhun gyis grub pa yang thob pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni ma chags pa nas brtson @235b 'grus kyi bar de dag nyid la gnas shing sems mnyam pa nyid dang / sems rnal du 'dug pa nyid dang / sems lhun gyis grub pa yang thob pa ste /
translated: Equanimity is the stability of those very factors beginning with nonattachment and ending with effort, the state of mental balance, the state of mental composure, and the state of mental spontaneity.

original: gang gi nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams bsal zhing nyon mongs pa can med par gnas pa'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: gang gi nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnams bsal zhing nyon mongs pa can med par gnas pa'o zhes smos te /
translated: It is the state of being free from the afflictions, having eliminated the defiled factors.

original: btang snyoms rnam pa gsum las 'dir ni 'du byed kyi btang snyoms te /
analyzed: btang snyoms rnam pa gsum las 'dir ni 'du byed kyi btang snyoms te /
translated: Of the three types of equanimity, here it is the equanimity of formative influence.

original: de yang gong ma bzhin du ma chags pa la sogs pa gsum ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de yang gong ma bzhin du ma chags pa la sogs pa gsum ni btang snyoms kyi rgyu'o //
translated: Moreover, as above, the three beginning with nonattachment are the causes of equanimity.

original: brtson 'grus ni btang snyoms kyi gnas te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni btang snyoms kyi gnas te /
translated: Effort is the basis of equanimity.

original: de la gnas nas btang snyoms kyi thog ma dang bar ma dang / tha ma gsum 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la gnas nas btang snyoms kyi thog ma dang bar ma dang / tha ma gsum 'byung ngo //
translated: And, abiding in that, the three stages of equanimity arise: initial, middle, and final.

original: de la thog mar zhum rgod med pa rnyed ma thag pa ni sems mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la thog mar zhum rgod med pa rnyed ma thag pa ni sems mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Among them, the first, which is the state of mind that has just attained the absence of laxity and excitement, is called ‚Äúmental balance.‚Äù

original: de nas zhum rgod de phyir 'byung du dogs bzhin du gnas pa ni sems rnal du 'dug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhum rgod de phyir 'byung du dogs bzhin du gnas pa ni sems rnal du 'dug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Then, abiding in the state of mind that is apprehensive about the return of laxity and excitement, is called ‚Äúmental rest.‚Äù

original: de nas yun ring du bsgoms te goms nas zhum rgod mi 'byung zhing dogs pa med par gnas pa ni lhun gyis grub pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nas yun ring du bsgoms te goms nas zhum rgod mi 'byung zhing dogs pa med par gnas pa ni lhun gyis grub pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Then, after a long time of meditation and familiarity, abiding in the absence of laxity and excitement and without apprehension, is called ‚Äúspontaneous.‚Äù

original: btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin de lta bu thob pa'i gang zag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems skye mi srid de /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin de lta bu thob pa'i gang zag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems skye mi srid de /
translated: The person who has attained such a nature of equanimity is not subject to the arising of a mind of attachment and so forth.

original: de mi 'byung ba ni nyon mongs pa bsal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de mi 'byung ba ni nyon mongs pa bsal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The non-arising of that is called ‚Äúthe removal of afflictions.‚Äù

original: de ltar sems dag par bsam gtan la gnas na nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sems dag par bsam gtan la gnas na nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa yang de nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, if one abides in concentration with a pure mind, that is also abiding without afflictions.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste snying rje ba'o zhes smos te /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni rnam par 'tshe ba'i gnyen po ste snying rje ba'o zhes smos te /
translated: Non-violence is the antidote to violence, i.e., compassion.

original: gsod spyugs dang rdeg 'tshog la sogs pa gnod pa sna tshogs byed pa rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: gsod spyugs dang rdeg 'tshog la sogs pa gnod pa sna tshogs byed pa rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Violence is the various kinds of harm, such as killing, banishing, beating, striking, etc.

original: de'i gnyen po ni snying rje ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni snying rje ste /
translated: Its antidote is compassion.

original: de yod na bdag gi srog lus kyang 'phangs pa med par sems can gyi phyir gtong na /
analyzed: de yod na bdag gi srog lus kyang 'phangs pa med par sems can gyi phyir gtong na /
translated: If, when one has compassion, one gives up one‚Äôs own life and body without reservation for the sake of sentient beings,

original: gnod pa mi bya ba lta ci zhig smos te sems can la tho mi 'tshams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa mi bya ba lta ci zhig smos te sems can la tho mi 'tshams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: what need is there to mention not doing harm? Because one does not mistreat sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa drug gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drug gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang / the tshom mo //
translated: What are the six defilements? They are: attachment, hostility, pride, ignorance, views, and doubt.

original: 'dod chags ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la zhen pa dang lhag par chags pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la zhen pa dang lhag par chags pa'o zhes bya ba la /

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi phung po nas /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs kyi phung po nas /
translated: The defiled form aggregate...

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po zag pa dang bcas pa'i bar du lnga ni rgyu 'dod pa dang lta ba dang / tshul khrims @236a * //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po zag pa dang bcas pa'i bar du lnga ni rgyu 'dod pa dang lta ba dang / tshul khrims @236a * //
translated: The five aggregates from form to contaminated consciousness are the cause of desire, view,üîΩand discipline.üîΩ

analyzed: dang ; / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa bzhi las byung bas nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes btags te /

original: dper na rtsva las byung ba'i me la rtsva'i me zhes bya ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na rtsva las byung ba'i me la rtsva'i me zhes bya ba dang 'dra'o //

original: phung po de la da ltar gyi dus na de dang 'bral mi phod pa ni zhen pa'o //
analyzed: phung po de la da ltar gyi dus na de dang 'bral mi phod pa ni zhen pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the inability to separate from those aggregates in the present.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du phung po lnga len par 'dod pa ni lhag par chags pa ste /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du phung po lnga len par 'dod pa ni lhag par chags pa ste /
translated: Excessive attachment is the desire to appropriate the five aggregates in other lives.

original: dper na gos la snum zhen na dbyung dka' ba bzhin du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang rang gi phung po la chags pa de yang nyen pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa 'bad pa chen pos kyang bral zhing spang bar dka' ba'i phyir ro
analyzed: dper na gos la snum zhen na dbyung dka' ba bzhin du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang rang gi phung po la chags pa de yang nyen pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa 'bad pa chen pos kyang bral zhing spang bar dka' ba'i phyir ro
translated: Just as it is difficult to remove oil that has soaked into a garment, so it is difficult to separate from and abandon attachment to the five sense pleasures and one's own aggregates, even with great effort in striving, thinking, and meditation.üîΩAversion is the complete affliction of sentient beings.

original: // khong khro ba ni sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa'o zhes bya ba ni dgra la sogs pa pha rol po rnams la rdeg cing gsad pa la sogs pa gnod pa sna tshogs bya bar sems pa ste /

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sems rtsub cing mnar sems dang ldan pas rtag tu sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i phyir bde ba la mi reg pa'o //

analyzed: nga rgyal gang zhe na / rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba la /

original: nga rgyal rnam pa bdun ni /
analyzed: nga rgyal rnam pa bdun ni /

analyzed: bdun char yang rang gi lus kyi phung po la bdag dang bdag gir bltas nas gzhan dag pas bdag khyad zhugs so snyam nas gus pa med cing kun la 'gying ba'i mtshan nyid do //

translated: Pride is the inflation of the mind that occurs when one considers oneself superior to others on the basis of such things as one's physical appearance, family lineage, or wealth.üîΩGreater pride is the thought that one is superior to others who are one's equals in terms of such things as wealth.

original: de nyid la bdag ni tha gis che'o snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la bdag ni tha gis che'o snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: Extreme pride is the thought that one is superior to those who are superior.

original: che ba'i nga rgyal ni bdag dang pha rol nor la sogs pa kun mtshungs shing 'dra bar yin na de las tshul khrims la sogs pa sna 'ga' zhig gis ni bdag che'o snyam du sems pa'o //

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal ni //
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal ni //

analyzed: bdag rus rigs la sogs pa gzhan pas chung ba yin yang gzhan pas bdag che'o snyam du sems pa'o //

translated: Pride of I am is the inflation of the mind with the thought, I am, with regard to the aggregates which are appropriated, which are not a self, and which are not an I.üîΩ Pride of superiority is the thought, I have attained the noble stages, when one has not attained them, or the thought, I have attained the special meditative concentrations, when one has not attained them, because one has a slight facility of mind.üîΩ Pride of thinking I am is the thought, I am, which is the inflation of the mind with the thought, I am, with regard to the aggregates which are appropriated, which are not a self, and which are not an I.

original: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni /
analyzed: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni /
translated: Pride of thinking I am is the thought, I am, which is the inflation of the mind with the thought, I am, with regard to the aggregates which are appropriated, which are not a self, and which are not an I.üîΩ Pride of thinking I am is the thought, I am, which is the inflation of the mind with the thought, I am, with regard to the aggregates which are appropriated, which are not a self, and which are not an I.üîΩ Pride of thinking I am is the thought, I am, which is the inflation of the mind with the thought, I am, with regard to the aggregates which are appropriated, which are not a self, and which are not an I.

original: yon tan cung zad kyang med pa yin na /

translated: Pride of

original: lus kyi phung po rnams la 'di kho na bzang ngo zhes dam pa dang gtso bor 'dzin te 'di las lhag pa gzhan med do snyam du sems pa'o //üîΩtshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni nyes pa lus dang ngag las byung ba bdun spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / khyi dang ba lang gi brtul zhugs sam /
analyzed: lus kyi phung po rnams la 'di kho na bzang ngo zhes dam pa dang gtso bor 'dzin te 'di las lhag pa gzhan med do snyam du sems pa'o // tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni nyes pa lus dang ngag las byung ba bdun spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / khyi dang ba lang gi brtul zhugs sam /
translated: aggregates that are the basis of those views, thinking, ‚ÄúThis alone is good,‚Äù and thinking that there is nothing higher than that.üîΩClinging to rules and ritual as supreme is to think that one will be liberated and attain liberation by abandoning the seven faults that arise from body and speech, by adopting the rules of training, and by practicing the ritual of a dog or an ox,

original: skra 'bal zhing 'dreg pa la sogs pa rnams byas bas grol ba dang thar par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'o //

original: the tshom ni bden pa la sogs pa la gang yid gnyis za ba'o zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams yod pa yin nam ma yin /
analyzed: the tshom ni bden pa la sogs pa la gang yid gnyis za ba'o zhes bya ba ni las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa dang / dkon mchog rnams yod pa yin nam ma yin /
translated: It is the indecisive state of mind that is uncertain about the existence of karma and its results, the four truths, and the three jewels.

original: yod na yang yon tan can yin nam ma yin snyam du blo gnyis su 'gyur zhing nges pa ma rnyed de dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yod na yang yon tan can yin nam ma yin snyam du blo gnyis su 'gyur zhing nges pa ma rnyed de dge ba'i phyogs la mi 'jug pa'o //

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyi shu gang zhe na /

analyzed: khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / rgyags pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang /
translated: They are anger, enmity, concealment, spite, jealousy, stinginess, deceit, fraud, arrogance, violence, shamelessness, lack of embarrassment,

analyzed: rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / bag med pa dang / brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa dang nyi shu'o zhes smos te /
translated: 1. lethargy, 2. excitedness, 3. lack of faith, 4. laziness, 5. carelessness, 6. forgetfulness, 7. distraction, 8. lack of awareness.

original: 'og nas rim bzhin bshad do //
analyzed: 'og nas rim bzhin bshad do //

analyzed: de la khro ba ni 'phral tu gnod pa byed pa la gnas te /

original: gang sems kyis kun nas mnar sems pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang sems kyis kun nas mnar sems pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the mental state of complete malice.

original: dgra la sogs pa khro ba'i yul 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa lkog tu gyur pa rnams la mi bya'i /
analyzed: dgra la sogs pa khro ba'i yul 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa lkog tu gyur pa rnams la mi bya'i /
