original: da ltar mngon sum du gyur pa rnams la ma rung ba dang / gnod par bya'o snyam du sems pa ni khro ba dang mnar sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar mngon sum du gyur pa rnams la ma rung ba dang / gnod par bya'o snyam du sems pa ni khro ba dang mnar sems zhes bya'o //
translated: But the thought, ‚ÄúI will make them unfit and harm them,‚Äù is called anger and malice.

original: khon du 'dzin pa ni mdud par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi gnyen la sogs pa rang gi 'khor rnams la gnod pa byed pa'i dgra la sogs pa la nam zhig na gnod pa ma byas par mi btang ngo snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa ni mdud par 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi gnyen la sogs pa rang gi 'khor rnams la gnod pa byed pa'i dgra la sogs pa la nam zhig na gnod pa ma byas par mi btang ngo snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: This means that one thinks, ‚ÄúWhen will I not let go of my enemy who harms me, my friends, and my relatives, without his doing me any harm?‚ÄùüîΩConcealment is the hiding of one‚Äôs own faults.

original: 'chab pa ni bdag gi kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i las bya bar mi 'os pa rnams byas pa ni kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'chab pa ni bdag gi kha na ma tho ba mkhyud pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i las bya bar mi 'os pa rnams byas pa ni kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This means that one has done what should not be done, and has committed evil, unwholesome actions.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bya ba ma yin pa'i las 'di dag byas pas nyes kyis nyes dmigs 'di dag shogs @237b shig ces byas nang la nyes pa med do zhes 'chags su mi btub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bya ba ma yin pa'i las 'di dag byas pas nyes kyis nyes dmigs 'di dag shogs @237b shig ces byas nang la nyes pa med do zhes 'chags su mi btub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When a spiritual teacher says, ‚ÄúYou have done these improper actions. Confess these faults and downfalls!‚Äù one does not admit one‚Äôs faults.

original: 'tshig pa ni tshig brlang pos zher 'debs pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'tshig pa ni tshig brlang pos zher 'debs pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Spite is the stubborn insistence on being right.

original: gzhan gyi skyon dang mtshang 'dru zhing gtum tshig tu smra ba ni tshig brlang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi skyon dang mtshang 'dru zhing gtum tshig tu smra ba ni tshig brlang po zhes bya ste /
translated: Harsh speech is speech that is abusive and insulting.

original: des gzhan gyi zhe gcod pas na zher 'debs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des gzhan gyi zhe gcod pas na zher 'debs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called abusive because it is harsh speech that cuts into the quick of others.

original: phrag dog ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phrag dog ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Jealousy is an internal heat of the mind that is caused by another's well-being.

original: gzhan gyi rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / thos pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan dag mthong nas de dag la chags pa'i dbang gis zhe sdang skye zhing sems mi bzod pa dang phrag dog ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / thos pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan dag mthong nas de dag la chags pa'i dbang gis zhe sdang skye zhing sems mi bzod pa dang phrag dog ces bya'o //
translated: When one sees another's gain, honor, learning, morality, and so on, which are the qualities of spiritual life, then, by the power of attachment to those, one gives rise to aversion and the mind becomes intolerant. This is called jealousy.üîΩAvarice is the opposite of generosity and is the mind's tightfistedness.

original: ser sna ni sbyin pa dang mi mthun pa ste sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi shas che bas 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams la chags shing gtong mi phod pa ste /
analyzed: ser sna ni sbyin pa dang mi mthun pa ste sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi shas che bas 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams la chags shing gtong mi phod pa ste /
translated: It is the mind's attachment to the necessities of life and its inability to give them up, because of the predominance of attachment.

original: dkon mchog dang phongs pa rnams la mchod pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa byed mi nus pa ni sbyin pa dang mi mthun pa zhes bya /
analyzed: dkon mchog dang phongs pa rnams la mchod pa dang sbyin pa la sogs pa byed mi nus pa ni sbyin pa dang mi mthun pa zhes bya /
translated: The inability to make offerings to the Three Jewels and to give to the poor, and so on, is called the lack of generosity.

original: yo byad mi mkho ba ngan don kun kyang bsdus te sogs pa ni sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yo byad mi mkho ba ngan don kun kyang bsdus te sogs pa ni sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The hoarding of useless things, such as worthless trinkets, is called the lack of complete acceptance.üîΩDeceit is the display of an unreal object in order to deceive others.

original: sgyu ni gzhan slu ba yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni khe dang / bkur sti dang / rnyed pa 'dod pa'i phyir yon tan med par yang yon tan can ltar tshul 'chos shing mig sgyu byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ni gzhan slu ba yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni khe dang / bkur sti dang / rnyed pa 'dod pa'i phyir yon tan med par yang yon tan can ltar tshul 'chos shing mig sgyu byed pa'o //
translated: It is the hypocrisy and pretense of the virtuous in order to obtain gain, honor, and honors, as if one were virtuous when one is not.

original: g-yo ni bdag gis nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs bzung ste sems gya gyu ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yo ni bdag gis nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs bzung ste sems gya gyu ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Guile is the crookedness of mind that is the means of concealing one's faults.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti 'dod pa'i phyir tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa'i nyes skyon de gzhan gyis ngos zin du dogs nas gtam rlung la bskur zhing tshig dang don gnyi ga brgyud pa ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti 'dod pa'i phyir tshul 'chos pa la sogs pa'i nyes skyon de gzhan gyis ngos zin du dogs nas gtam rlung la bskur zhing tshig dang don gnyi ga brgyud pa ste /
translated: It is the crookedness of mind that is the means of concealing one's faults, fearing that others will recognize one's faults of hypocrisy, and so on, in order to obtain gain and honor.

original: de ni nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs gya gyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nyes pa bcab pa'i thabs gya gyu zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called ‚Äúcunning‚Äù which is a means of concealing a fault.

original: rgyags pa ni bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa la chags pa'i rab tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: rgyags pa ni bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa la chags pa'i rab tu dga' ba ste /
translated: Arrogance is a delight in one‚Äôs own excellence, a mental holding.

original: sems kyi yongs su 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la phun sum tshogs pa ni rus rigs dang / shes nyen dang / longs spyod dang / nyams dang rtsal dang / byad bzhin la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: sems kyi yongs su 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba la phun sum tshogs pa ni rus rigs dang / shes nyen dang / longs spyod dang / nyams dang rtsal dang / byad bzhin la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Excellence is a family of good birth, learning, wealth, figure, beauty, etc.

original: de la chags pa'i rab tu dga' ba ni phun sum tshogs pa de ba dog pa'i rgyus nyams bde zhing sems dga' ba'o //üîΩyongs su 'dzin pa ni bdag gi longs spyod la sogs pa la sems yeng yeng por gyur nas 'di @238a * //
analyzed: de la chags pa'i rab tu dga' ba ni phun sum tshogs pa de ba dog pa'i rgyus nyams bde zhing sems dga' ba'o // yongs su 'dzin pa ni bdag gi longs spyod la sogs pa la sems yeng yeng por gyur nas 'di @238a * //
translated: Delight in that is a mental pleasure caused by the desire for that excellence.

original: dag kho nas chog go snyam du sems shing dge ba'i phyogs gzhan mi byed pa ste rgyags pa yang de nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: dag kho nas chog go snyam du sems shing dge ba'i phyogs gzhan mi byed pa ste rgyags pa yang de nyid la bya'o //
translated: Holding is a mental state which, having become attached to one‚Äôs own wealth, etc., thinks, ‚ÄúI am satisfied with just this,‚Äù and does not perform any other virtuous action. Arrogance is also that.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang snying brtsa ba med pa'i rgyus thal lcag dang khu tshur la sogs pas brdeg cing 'ching ba dang / nan dbang la sogs pa nan tur sna tshogs byed pa ni tho 'tshams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni sems can rnams la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o zhes bya ba ni snying rje dang snying brtsa ba med pa'i rgyus thal lcag dang khu tshur la sogs pas brdeg cing 'ching ba dang / nan dbang la sogs pa nan tur sna tshogs byed pa ni tho 'tshams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: which are done through the cause of lack of compassion and lack of sympathy.üîΩShamelessness is the lack of self-respect.

original: ngo tsha med pa ni kha na ma tho bas bdag la mi mdzem pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas che bas de'i dbang du song ba ni ngo tsha med pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa ni kha na ma tho bas bdag la mi mdzem pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas che bas de'i dbang du song ba ni ngo tsha med pa'o //
translated: The lack of self-respect is the lack of fear of sin, due to the predominance of passion, hatred, and folly.

original: kha na ma tho ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i las so //üîΩbdag la mi mdzes pa ni bdag rigs kyi bu'am rab tu byung ba'i dge sbyong yin pas /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i las so // bdag la mi mdzes pa ni bdag rigs kyi bu'am rab tu byung ba'i dge sbyong yin pas /
translated: Sin is the unwholesome action.üîΩLack of self-respect is the lack of fear of sin.üîΩIt is the lack of fear of sin, the lack of fear of the unwholesome, the lack of fear of the unwholesome action.

original: 'di lta bu'i las byed pa ni bdag gi cha ma yin no snyam du sems pa med par sdig pa'i las la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i las byed pa ni bdag gi cha ma yin no snyam du sems pa med par sdig pa'i las la 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the lack of fear of the unwholesome action.

original: khrel med pa ni kha na ma tho bas gzhan la mi 'dzem pa'o zhes bya ba la /üîΩgzhan la mi mjem pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i las bya ba'i cha ma yin pa rnams byed pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: khrel med pa ni kha na ma tho bas gzhan la mi 'dzem pa'o zhes bya ba la / gzhan la mi mjem pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i las bya ba'i cha ma yin pa rnams byed pa'i tshe na /
translated: Shamelessness is lack of abashment before others with regard to vile actions.üîΩLack of abashment before others means that when one does things that are not to be done, vile actions, one is not afraid of the punishment, etc.,

original: gzhan gyi chad pa gtugs la sogs te dpya zhing smod pa dang khrel bas dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chad pa gtugs la sogs te dpya zhing smod pa dang khrel bas dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: of others, because one is not ashamed or embarrassed.

original: rmugs pa ni sems las su mi rung ba ste /üîΩslong ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi shas che bas nyan pa dang sems pa'i dus na sems las su mi rung ste /
analyzed: rmugs pa ni sems las su mi rung ba ste / slong ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi shas che bas nyan pa dang sems pa'i dus na sems las su mi rung ste /
translated: Dullness is unserviceability of mind.üîΩIt is the cause of unserviceability of mind, because one is dull and obtuse.

original: shes rab kyi khyad par gsal ba'i sems med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi khyad par gsal ba'i sems med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of unserviceability of mind, because one is dull and obtuse.

original: rgod pa ni sems ma zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi shas che bas sngon rtse rtse dgod dgod pa la sogs pa sdug pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brangs te g-yengs nas bsgom pa'i dus na zhi gnas kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgod pa ni sems ma zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi shas che bas sngon rtse rtse dgod dgod pa la sogs pa sdug pa'i mtshan ma'i rjes su 'brangs te g-yengs nas bsgom pa'i dus na zhi gnas kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Excitement is an unpeaceful state of mind. This is because, due to the predominance of attachment, one is distracted by pursuing pleasant images, such as those of former amusements, laughter, and so on. At the time of cultivating meditative serenity, excitement is an obstruction to mental stability.

original: ma dad pa ni las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog rnams la yid mi ches pa dang sems ma dang ba ste /
analyzed: ma dad pa ni las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog rnams la yid mi ches pa dang sems ma dang ba ste /
translated: Lack of faith is a lack of conviction and clarity of mind with regard to actions and their effects, the truths, and the Three Jewels.

original: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the opposite of faith.

original: las ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: las ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Actions are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.

original: 'bras bu ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'o //
translated: Effects are pleasant, unpleasant, and neither.

original: bden pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa ste bzhi'o //
analyzed: bden pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa ste bzhi'o //
translated: The truths are the four: the truth of suffering, the truth of origin, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path.

original: dkon mchog ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge @238b 'dun gsum mo //
analyzed: dkon mchog ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge @238b 'dun gsum mo //
translated: The Three Jewels are the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sa·πÖgha.

original: de dag yod par ni yid mi ches la yon tan yin pa ni sems ma dang ba ste /
analyzed: de dag yod par ni yid mi ches la yon tan yin pa ni sems ma dang ba ste /
translated: One does not have confidence in their existence, and one's mind is not clear about them.

original: dad pa med na dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa med na dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one lacks faith, one does not apply oneself to the wholesome side.

original: le lo ni dge ba la sems mngon par mi spro ba ste /
analyzed: le lo ni dge ba la sems mngon par mi spro ba ste /
translated: Laziness is the non-exertion of the mind with regard to the wholesome.üîΩIt is the adversary of vigor.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs rnams la mi 'jug par nyal ba dang snyes shing 'phres pa'i bsod nyams kyi dbang du byed cing /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs rnams la mi 'jug par nyal ba dang snyes shing 'phres pa'i bsod nyams kyi dbang du byed cing /
translated: It is called the adversary of vigor because it is the cause of the non-engagement in the wholesome side, such as listening, reflection, and meditation, etc.

original: gti mug gi shas che bas dge ba la mi rtsol ba'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa dang mi spro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gti mug gi shas che bas dge ba la mi rtsol ba'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa dang mi spro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called non-exertion because one does not strive for the wholesome due to the predominance of delusion.

original: bag med pa ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang le lo gang yin pa dag gis nyon mongs pa las sems mi bsrung ba dang / dge ba mi bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bag med pa ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang le lo gang yin pa dag gis nyon mongs pa las sems mi bsrung ba dang / dge ba mi bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Carelessness is the non-guarding of the mind against the defilements by means of the antidotes to attachment, hostility, and laziness, and the non-cultivation of the wholesome.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum gyis rgyu byas nas le lo la gnas bcas te de bzhi'i dbang du gyur pa ni bag med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum gyis rgyu byas nas le lo la gnas bcas te de bzhi'i dbang du gyur pa ni bag med pa'o //
translated: The four errors are:üîΩnon-restraint of the mind,üîΩnon-cultivation,üîΩand forgetfulness.

original: bag med pa ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang de bzhi'i rjes su sems yan du btang ste phyir mi zlog pa ni sems mi bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: bag med pa ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang de bzhi'i rjes su sems yan du btang ste phyir mi zlog pa ni sems mi bsrung ba'o //
translated: Non-restraint of the mind is the non-restraint of the mind which is carried away by the four errors and does not return.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs la yang dang yang du 'dris par mi byed pas na mi bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs la yang dang yang du 'dris par mi byed pas na mi bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Non-cultivation is the non-cultivation of the wholesome side, such as non-greed, etc.

original: brjed ngas pa ni dran pa nyon mongs pa can te /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa ni dran pa nyon mongs pa can te /
translated: Forgetfulness is defiled mindfulness.

original: dge ba la mi gsal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba la mi gsal ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the non-clarity of the wholesome.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'dres pa'i dran pa ni nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'dres pa'i dran pa ni nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: Defiled mindfulness is mindfulness mixed with greed, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i man ngag brjed de /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i man ngag brjed de /
translated: It is forgetfulness of the right instruction.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la dran pa med pas na mi gsal ba dang brjed ngas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la dran pa med pas na mi gsal ba dang brjed ngas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the non-clarity and forgetfulness of the wholesome side due to the absence of mindfulness.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas kyis 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la gang sems rnam par 'phro ba'o zhes bya ba la g-yeng ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi shas kyis 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la gang sems rnam par 'phro ba'o zhes bya ba la g-yeng ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Distraction is of six kinds:

original: rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du g-yeng ba dang / nang gi g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol du g-yeng ba dang / nang gi g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba'o //
translated: natural distraction, external distraction, internal distraction, the distraction of signs, the distraction of addiction, and the distraction of mental orientation.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis g-yeng ba ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa rnams te /
translated: Natural distraction refers to the five sensory consciousnesses,

original: de dag rang bzhin gyis kha phyir bltas pas nang du mnyam par 'jog mi nus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩphyi rol du g-yeng ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa na ting nge 'dzin gyi yul bor te /üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dod pa'i yon @239a * //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin gyis kha phyir bltas pas nang du mnyam par 'jog mi nus pa'i phyir ro // phyi rol du g-yeng ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa na ting nge 'dzin gyi yul bor te / yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dod pa'i yon @239a * //
translated: because they are naturally turned outward and cannot remain inwardly fixed.

original: tan lnga la 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: tan lnga la 'gro ba'o //
translated: External distraction refers to the mind that, while in meditative concentration, abandons the object of concentration and goes out to the five sense pleasures.üîΩInternal distraction refers to the mind that, while in meditative concentration, is attracted to the experience of meditative concentration.

original: nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa na bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / ro myong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa na bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / ro myong bar byed pa ste /
translated: Internal distraction is sinking, excitedness, and enjoyment while in meditative equipoise.

original: skyon de gsum gyis ting nge 'dzin med par byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmtshan ma'i g-yeng ba ni thar pa 'dod pa'i bsam pa ni med kyi /üîΩkhe dang grags pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon de gsum gyis ting nge 'dzin med par byed pa'i phyir ro // mtshan ma'i g-yeng ba ni thar pa 'dod pa'i bsam pa ni med kyi / khe dang grags pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These three faults make the concentration non-existent.

original: gzhan dag gis 'di ni bsam gtan pa btsun pa zhig yin no zhes brjod pa'i mtshan ma tsam zhig 'dod pa'i phyir brtson pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis 'di ni bsam gtan pa btsun pa zhig yin no zhes brjod pa'i mtshan ma tsam zhig 'dod pa'i phyir brtson pa ste /
translated: The distraction of signs is the striving for the mere sign of being called a venerable who is in meditative concentration by others, because of desiring gain and fame, although one does not have the thought of desiring liberation.

original: de ni dge ba la brtson du zin kyang don gyi 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dge ba la brtson du zin kyang don gyi 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although one is striving for virtue, the result is not the point.

original: gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba ni ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa dang bcas pa yid la byed pa ni gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba ni ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa dang / nga'o snyam du 'dzin pa dang bcas pa yid la byed pa ni gnas ngan len gyi g-yeng ba ste /
translated: The distraction of negative reflex actions is the attention that is accompanied by the grasping of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù the grasping of ‚Äúmine,‚Äù and the grasping of ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: de ni snying nas ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan 'dod kyang bdag gi bsam gtan pa'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi dbang gis bdag la bstod cing gzhan la khyad du gsod pa ste /
analyzed: de ni snying nas ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan 'dod kyang bdag gi bsam gtan pa'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi dbang gis bdag la bstod cing gzhan la khyad du gsod pa ste /
translated: Although one desires the virtues of meditative concentration from the heart, one praises oneself and despises others through the power of pride, thinking, ‚ÄúI am a meditator.‚Äù

original: dngos su na nga rgyal gyi bag chags ma spangs shing brtas pa dang / de las nga rgyal mngon du byung ba de gnyis la gnas ngan len ces bya ste /
analyzed: dngos su na nga rgyal gyi bag chags ma spangs shing brtas pa dang / de las nga rgyal mngon du byung ba de gnyis la gnas ngan len ces bya ste /
translated: In fact, the ‚Äúnegative reflex‚Äù is the non-abandonment and increase of the instinct for pride, and the manifestation of pride from that.

original: de dge ba dri ma can du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dge ba dri ma can du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a virtuous root that is defiled.

original: yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba ni theg pa chen po'i rigs can dag 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis skyo zhing mi bzod de /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i g-yeng ba ni theg pa chen po'i rigs can dag 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis skyo zhing mi bzod de /
translated: Mental distraction is the mental attention of those who belong to the lineage of the universal vehicle, who are disgusted with and cannot bear the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa yid la byed na theg pa chen po las nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa yid la byed na theg pa chen po las nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: If they attend to the vehicle of the disciples, they fall from the universal vehicle.

original: de'i phyir sems rnam par 'phro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems rnam par 'phro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúthe scattering of the mind.‚Äù

original: shes bzhin ma yin pa ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin ma yin pa ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: Lack of vigilance is the wisdom that is associated with the moral defilements.

original: de lus dang dag dang yid kyi spyod pa la mi shes bzhin du 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lus dang dag dang yid kyi spyod pa la mi shes bzhin du 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the engagement of body, speech, and mind without knowledge.

original: shes rab yod mod kyi 'dod chags dang ma rig pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'dres pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ste /üîΩdes 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang / smra ba dang bsam pa la sogs pa thog tu mi phebs bzhin du dbu thom du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab yod mod kyi 'dod chags dang ma rig pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'dres pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ste / des 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang / smra ba dang bsam pa la sogs pa thog tu mi phebs bzhin du dbu thom du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called concomitant with afflictions because, although it exists, it is mixed with the afflictions of attachment, ignorance, and so on.üîΩIt is like a person who is blind from birth and does not know the color of milk.

original: bzhi gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pa gnyis dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa ste de ni gang du dge ba dang mi dge ba ltar phyogs gcig tu nges pa med de dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa kun gyi nang du 'gro bas dge ba'i nang du song na mi dge ba
analyzed: bzhi gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pa gnyis dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa ste de ni gang du dge ba dang mi dge ba ltar phyogs gcig tu nges pa med de dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa kun gyi nang du 'gro bas dge ba'i nang du song na mi dge ba
translated: The four are also different. Regret, sleep, investigation, and analysis are not ascertained in one direction, like virtue and nonvirtue. They are included in all virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral states. If they are virtuous, they are not nonvirtuous.

original: las gzhan mi dge ba'i nang @239b du song na dge ba las gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir gzhan du zhes bya'o //üîΩ'gyod pa ni yid la gcags pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pa mang ste dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams las su byas te nyes so zhes 'gyod pa dang / las su ma byas pa nyes so zhes 'gyod pa ste /
analyzed: las gzhan mi dge ba'i nang @239b du song na dge ba las gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir gzhan du zhes bya'o // 'gyod pa ni yid la gcags pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pa mang ste dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams las su byas te nyes so zhes 'gyod pa dang / las su ma byas pa nyes so zhes 'gyod pa ste /
translated: If it is included among nonvirtuous actions, it is called other because it is other than virtuous.üîΩRegret is mental remorse.üîΩRegret is mental remorse that thinks, ‚ÄúIt is wrong that I have done this,‚Äù with regard to virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral actions.

original: de yang dge ba byas pa nyes so zhes yid la gcags pa ni 'gyod pa mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dge ba byas pa nyes so zhes yid la gcags pa ni 'gyod pa mi dge ba'o //
translated: Mental remorse that thinks, ‚ÄúIt is wrong that I have done virtue‚Äù is nonvirtuous regret.

original: dge ba ma byas so zhes yid la gcags pa ni 'gyod pa dge ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba ma byas so zhes yid la gcags pa ni 'gyod pa dge ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Mental remorse that thinks, ‚ÄúIt is wrong that I have not done virtue‚Äù is virtuous regret.

original: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la yang de bzhin du mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la yang de bzhin du mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: Nonvirtue and neutral states should be applied in a similar way.

original: gnyid ni 'jug pa la rang dbang med par sems sdud pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyid ni 'jug pa la rang dbang med par sems sdud pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Sleep is the contraction of the mind that lacks full awareness.

original: sgo drug gi rnam par shes pa phyi'i yul la dmigs pa ni 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgo drug gi rnam par shes pa phyi'i yul la dmigs pa ni 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The consciousnesses of the six active sense doors that focus on external objects are called engagement.

original: gnyid kyi rgyu nyam chung zhing du ba dang lus lci zhing mun pa yid la byed de /üîΩrmugs rmugs por 'dug pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa yul la 'jug mi nus shing /
analyzed: gnyid kyi rgyu nyam chung zhing du ba dang lus lci zhing mun pa yid la byed de / rmugs rmugs por 'dug pa'i dbang gis rnam par shes pa yul la 'jug mi nus shing /
translated: The cause of sleep is weakness, smoke, heaviness of the body, and mental attention to darkness.üîΩSleep is the inability of consciousness to engage objects and the inability of the body to support itself due to the power of the mind's contraction and withdrawal.

original: lus kyang 'dzin mi nus par nang du 'dus nas bya ba kun shor ba'i mtshan nyid de /üîΩde yang dge ba byed byed pa las nyal te bar chad na mi dge ba'i gnyid do //
analyzed: lus kyang 'dzin mi nus par nang du 'dus nas bya ba kun shor ba'i mtshan nyid de / de yang dge ba byed byed pa las nyal te bar chad na mi dge ba'i gnyid do //
translated: Its characteristic is the loss of all activity.üîΩIf one goes to sleep while engaged in virtue, it is nonvirtuous sleep.

original: sdig pa byed byed pa las nyal te rgyun chad na dge ba'i gnyid do //
analyzed: sdig pa byed byed pa las nyal te rgyun chad na dge ba'i gnyid do //
translated: If one goes to sleep while engaged in nonvirtue, it is virtuous sleep.

original: ri mo dang tshem drub byed byed pa las bar chad de log na lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ri mo dang tshem drub byed byed pa las bar chad de log na lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: If one stops while engaged in drawing or sewing, it is neutral sleep.

original: yang na rmi lam na dge sdig ci byed pa rnam pa gsum dang yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na rmi lam na dge sdig ci byed pa rnam pa gsum dang yang sbyar ro //
translated: Or it is applied to the three types of whatever virtue or nonvirtue is done in dreams.

original: rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is discursive thought?

original: rtog pa ni kun du tshol ba'i yid kyis brjod pa ste sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag gang sems rtsing ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtog pa ni kun du tshol ba'i yid kyis brjod pa ste sems pa dang shes rab kyi bye brag gang sems rtsing ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Discursive thought is the expression of the mind that searches everywhere. It is a specific type of intention and wisdom that is a coarse state of mind.

original: brtsal ba'i don yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sems la dran pa ni rtog pa dang yid kyi brjod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtsal ba'i don yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sems la dran pa ni rtog pa dang yid kyi brjod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mental attention of the mental consciousness to the object that is sought is called discursive thought and mental expression.

original: rtog pa de yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa de yang 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: Discursive thought is mundane and supramundane.

original: 'jig rten gyi rtog pa ni sems de sems pa dang 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rtog pa ni sems de sems pa dang 'grogs pa'o //
translated: Mundane discursive thought is associated with the mind that is accompanied by mental activities.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni shes rab dang 'grogs pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni shes rab dang 'grogs pa las 'byung ste /
translated: Supramundane discursive thought is associated with the mind that is accompanied by wisdom.

original: 'di ci yin zhes btsal nas 'di ni bum pa'o snam bu'o zhes rags rim spyi tsam zhig 'ol phyogs su shes pa ni sems rtsing ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ci yin zhes btsal nas 'di ni bum pa'o snam bu'o zhes rags rim spyi tsam zhig 'ol phyogs su shes pa ni sems rtsing ba zhes bya'o //
translated: When one seeks to determine what something is and then understands it in a general way, as for example, ‚ÄúThis is a pot,‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is a cloth,‚Äù this is called gross mind.

original: dpyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dpyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is investigation?

original: so sor rtog pa'i yid kyi brjod pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i yid kyi brjod pa ste /
translated: It is mental expression that examines individually.

original: de bzhin du gang sems zhib pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang sems zhib pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Similarly, what is subtle mind?

original: gzhan ni gong ma dang 'dra la /
analyzed: gzhan ni gong ma dang 'dra la /
translated: The other terms are as above.

original: sems zhib pa zhes bya ba ni sngar @240a * //
analyzed: sems zhib pa zhes bya ba ni sngar @240a * //
translated: What is subtle mind?

original: bum pa'o tsam du rtsing bar brtags pa de nyid la dpyod do //
analyzed: bum pa'o tsam du rtsing bar brtags pa de nyid la dpyod do //
translated: It is the investigation of that very gross examination of a pot, for example, that was previously made.

original: bum pa'i bzang ngan dang tshos ma tshos kyi kha dog dang dbyibs zhib tu gtan la 'bebs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bum pa'i bzang ngan dang tshos ma tshos kyi kha dog dang dbyibs zhib tu gtan la 'bebs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the detailed determination of the good and bad qualities of a pot, and the color and shape of the dyed and undyed cloth.

original: sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed bcu bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed bcu bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What are the fourteen non-concurrent formations?

original: mi ldan pa'i sgras ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa dang / brgyal ba dang gnyid stug po la sogs pa'i dus na sems mi rgyu ba la bya'o //
analyzed: mi ldan pa'i sgras ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa dang / brgyal ba dang gnyid stug po la sogs pa'i dus na sems mi rgyu ba la bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúnon-concurrent‚Äù refers to the non-occurrence of mind during the states of non-perception, cessation, fainting, deep sleep, and so forth.

original: gzhan yang dge ba byed pa'i dus na mi dge ba'i sems mi 'byung ba dang / ri mo dang tshem drub lta bu lung du ma bstan pa byed pa'i dus na gcig tu dge ba dang / sdig pa bya ba'i sems mi 'byung ba lta bu yang mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba byed pa'i dus na mi dge ba'i sems mi 'byung ba dang / ri mo dang tshem drub lta bu lung du ma bstan pa byed pa'i dus na gcig tu dge ba dang / sdig pa bya ba'i sems mi 'byung ba lta bu yang mi ldan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, when one is performing a virtuous action, a non-virtuous mind does not occur; when one is performing a neutral action such as painting or sewing, a virtuous mind does not occur; and when one is thinking of committing a negative action, a virtuous mind does not occur. These are also called ‚Äúnon-concurrent.‚Äù

original: gzhan la yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
translated: The same principle applies to other cases.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: thob pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / srog gi dbang po dang / ris mthun pa dang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang /
analyzed: thob pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / srog gi dbang po dang / ris mthun pa dang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / gnas pa dang /
translated: attainment, the meditative attainment of nonperception, the meditative attainment of cessation, nonperception, the faculty of life force, homogeneity, birth, aging, duration,

original: mi rtag pa nyid dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs dang / so so'i skye bo nyid dang / de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs dang / so so'i skye bo nyid dang / de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa dag go //
translated: impermanence, the collection of names, the collection of phrases, the collection of syllables, the state of being an ordinary being, and other such factors.

original: thob pa ni rnyed pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thob pa ni rnyed pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Attainment is acquisition and possession.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i las gang yang rung ba zhig byas na /
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i las gang yang rung ba zhig byas na /
translated: When any virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral karma is performed,

original: las gang byas pa de'i bag chags sngon med pa las dang po yod par byas pa ni rnyed pa zhes bya /
analyzed: las gang byas pa de'i bag chags sngon med pa las dang po yod par byas pa ni rnyed pa zhes bya /
translated: the existence of a latent impression of that karma that did not exist previously is called acquisition.

original: de phan chad de dang mi 'bral pas 'grogs pa ni ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de phan chad de dang mi 'bral pas 'grogs pa ni ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subsequently, not being separated from that is called possession.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni /üîΩdge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni / dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: The meditative attainment of nonperception isüîΩthe cessation of the mind and mental factors of those free from attachment to the Brhatphala godsüîΩwho are not higher and who are preceded by the attention of the perception of the occurrence of the upper realms.

original: gong ma ma yin pa 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos bstan pa ma yin pa rnams gang 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba la bstan gtan bzhi pa'i gnas gsum po'i ya thog 'bras bu che ba'i gnas
analyzed: gong ma ma yin pa 'byung ba'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos bstan pa ma yin pa rnams gang 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba la bstan gtan bzhi pa'i gnas gsum po'i ya thog 'bras bu che ba'i gnas
translated: The first of the three abodes of the fourth absorption is the abode of MahƒÅbrahma.

original: de thob par bya ba'i phyir sgo drug gi rnam par shes pa dang / de dang 'grogs pa'i 'du shes rnams bkag ste /
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i phyir sgo drug gi rnam par shes pa dang / de dang 'grogs pa'i 'du shes rnams bkag ste /
translated: In order to attain that, the six sense consciousnesses and the perceptions that accompany them are stopped.

original: gnas pa ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Abiding in that is called the meditative attainment of nonperception.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i skyon ma lus par spangs pa ni dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i skyon ma lus par spangs pa ni dge rgyas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Being free from attachment to the Brhatphala gods is called being free from attachment to the gods of the extensive lineage.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i skyon spangs pa mthar @240b ma phyin pas na gong ma ma yin pa zhes bya /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i skyon spangs pa mthar @240b ma phyin pas na gong ma ma yin pa zhes bya /
translated: Not being higher means not having reached the end of eliminating the faults of the fourth absorption.

original: gnas de ni thar pa gtan du mya ngan las 'das pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni 'byung ba'i 'du shes so //

original: sems ni rnam par shes pa drug go //

original: sems las byung ba ni 'du shes la sogs pa ste /üîΩde dag par 'ga' 'byung /
analyzed: sems las byung ba ni 'du shes la sogs pa ste / de dag par 'ga' 'byung /

original: de dag 'gog pa la bya'o //

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba srid pa'i rtse mo las gyen du bskyod pa zhi bang gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos brtan pa

translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is the cessation of unstable minds and mental factors and some stable ones through the mental attention that precedes the notion of peaceful abiding that is free of attachment to the base of nothingness and that is directed upward to the summit of existence.

original: ma yin pa rnams dang / brtan pa rnams las kyang kha cig 'gog pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /

translated: The meditative attainment of nondiscernment is the meditative attainment of nondiscernment that is the result of the meditative attainment of nondiscernment.üîΩThe meditative attainment of nondiscernment is the meditative attainment of nondiscernment that is the result of the meditative attainment of nondiscernment.üîΩThe meditative attainment of nondiscernment is the meditative attainment of nondiscernment that is the result of the meditative attainment of nondiscernment.üîΩThe meditative attainment of nondiscernment is the meditative attainment of nondiscernment that is the result of the meditative attainment of nondiscernment.

analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug 'gag pa'o //

original: srog gi dbang po ni ris mthun pa rnams su sngon gyi las kyis 'phags pas gang 'du byed rnams kyi gnas pa'i dus nges pa'o zhes bya ba la tshe ring thung ji srid du mi 'chi ba ni srog gi dbang po zhes bya'o //üîΩlha ni lha nang 'dra ba nas /

analyzed: grog sbur la sogs pa tha dad pa nang 'dra ba ni ris mthun pa ste /

original: de dag sngon gyi las dge sdig gi dbang gis skyes nas tshe'i bye brag lo brgya stong man chad skad cig skad cig yan chad lo zla dang zhag grangs so so'i skal bas ci thub pa ni 'du byed gnas pa'i dus nges pa zhes bya'o //

translated: Through the power of former virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, they are born and their life force is definite for a specific period, such as a hundred or a thousand years, or for a moment, a day, a month or a year, according to their individual fortune. This is called the definite duration of the life of compounded phenomena.

original: ris mthun pa ni gang sems can rnams kyi lus 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba ni mi dang lha dang dud 'gro la sogs pa lam rgyud lngar skyes pa rnams so sor nang 'dra ba la bya'o //
analyzed: ris mthun pa ni gang sems can rnams kyi lus 'dra ba'o zhes bya ba ni mi dang lha dang dud 'gro la sogs pa lam rgyud lngar skyes pa rnams so sor nang 'dra ba la bya'o //
translated: Those of similar type are those who have similar bodies. Those born in the five reincarnating beings such as humans, gods and animals are similar in their own class.

original: skye ba ni ris mthun par gang 'du byed rnams ma byung ba las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa sems can gang yang rung ba'i nang du sngon med pa las gzod bya ba ni skye ba'o //

original: rga ba ni de ltar de dag gis rgyun gzhan du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga bo de dag dang po mer mer po la sogs pa'i rgyun gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba nas tha ma skra dkar dang gnyer ma can la sogs pa'i barüîΩdu 'gyur ba la bya'o //

translated: The five aggregates are transformed from one state to another, from the first embryonic stage of kalala, and so on, until the final stage of white hair and wrinkles.üîΩEnduring is the continuity of those aggregates.

original: gnas pa ni de ltar de dag gi rgyun rgyud chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi phung po de dag byung nas de skad cig ma'i rgyun brgyud pa nam ma shi'i bar du 'dug pa ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni de ltar de dag gi rgyun rgyud chags pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi phung po de dag byung nas de skad cig ma'i rgyun brgyud pa nam ma shi'i bar du 'dug pa ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The five aggregates that have arisen endure as the continuity of moments until death.

original: mi rtag pa ni de dag gi rgyud rgyu na chad pa'o zhes bya ba ni phung po'i skad @241b cig ma'i rgyun chad nas tshe 'phos te phung po zhig pa'o //

translated: Impermanence is the cessation of their continuum.üîΩThe collection of names is the designation of the intrinsic reality of phenomena.

original: ming gi tshogs ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba ni chos gcig la skad brda tha dad pas ming du btags shing des don go bar byed pa ste /üîΩde yang me dang chu zhes bya ba dang / rgya gar gyi skad kyis aag ni dang / pa ni zhes brjod pa dang / me ni sreg par byed pa yin /

translated: The name of a single phenomenon is designated by different languages and it causes the meaning to be understood.üîΩFor example, in the language of India, it is called agni and pani, and in Tibetan it is called me and chu.

original: chu ni gsher bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chu ni gsher bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Fire is that which burns and water is that which wets.

original: bar don go ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bar don go ba lta bu'o //

original: yang na ming gcig btags pa la yi ger byas na yi ge 'bru mang po du ma tshogs pa de la ming gi tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ming gcig btags pa la yi ger byas na yi ge 'bru mang po du ma tshogs pa de la ming gi tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, if a single name is made into syllables, the collection of many syllables is called the collection of names.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi tshig bla dags zhes bya ba la /
translated: The designation of intrinsic reality is the designation of the intrinsic reality of phenomena.

original: tsha ba dang gsher ba la sogs pa rang rang gi bya ba byed nus pa ni ngo bo nyid ces bya /
analyzed: tsha ba dang gsher ba la sogs pa rang rang gi bya ba byed nus pa ni ngo bo nyid ces bya /
translated: That which is able to perform its own function, such as heat or wetness, is called the intrinsic reality of fire or water.

original: me dang chu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla dags su ming btags na tshig bla dags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: me dang chu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bla dags su ming btags na tshig bla dags zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is designated as a name such as fire or water is called the designation of a name.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: ming nyid don yin na ni me zhes brjod pas kha tshig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming nyid don yin na ni me zhes brjod pas kha tshig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then if the name itself were the object, then the mere utterance of the word fire would burn one‚Äôs mouth.üîΩThe collection of words is the designation of the name that is the specific intrinsic reality of phenomena.

original: tshig gi tshogs ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gi tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba la me dang chu zhes bya ba la sogs par ming du btags pa ni mang gi tshogs zhes bya /
analyzed: tshig gi tshogs ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bye brag gi tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba la me dang chu zhes bya ba la sogs par ming du btags pa ni mang gi tshogs zhes bya /
translated: The collection of words is the designation of the name that is the specific intrinsic reality of phenomena.

original: chu de yang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni tshig gi tshogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chu de yang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni tshig gi tshogs zhes bya ste /
translated: That water is impermanent, suffering, empty and devoid of self is called the collection of words.

analyzed: chos rnams kyi bye brag gi tshig bla dags kyang de nyid yin te chos thams cad la de bzhin du bsgre zhing sbyar ro //
translated: That is also the term that distinguishes phenomena, and it is applied to all phenomena in the same way.

original: yi ge'i tshogs ni yi ge rnams te /
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs ni yi ge rnams te /
translated: The collection of letters is the letters.

original: de gnyi ga gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gnyi ga gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because they both illuminate.

original: yi ge thams cad kyi phyi mo aa dang ka la sogs pa mang po 'dus pa ni yi ge'i tshogs so //
analyzed: yi ge thams cad kyi phyi mo aa dang ka la sogs pa mang po 'dus pa ni yi ge'i tshogs so //
translated: The collection of letters is the collection of letters, which is the combination of many letters, such as the letter A and the letter Ka, which are the basis of all letters.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / de'i khyad par dag yi ges ming dang tshig tu btags nas de'i don so sor go bar byed pa ni gsal bar byed pa zhes bya'o //

translated: Illumination is the illumination of the nature and distinctions of phenomena by means of letters, which are designated as names and phrases, and the understanding of their meanings.

original: so so'i skye bo ni 'phags pa'i chos ma thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma spangs shing rang rang gi las kyi dbang gis gnas tha dad par skyes pa ni so so'i skye bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni 'phags pa'i chos ma thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma spangs shing rang rang gi las kyi dbang gis gnas tha dad par skyes pa ni so so'i skye bo zhes bya'o //
translated: An ordinary being is one who has not attained the Dharma of the noble ones. One who has not abandoned the afflictions such as desire, and who is born in a different place due to one's own karma, is called an ordinary being.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang sa dang po thob pa yan chad ni 'phags pa zhes bya /üîΩ'phags pa de'i chos ni mthong bas spang ba dang / bsgom pas spang ba'i sgrib pa @242a * //

translated: Those who have attained the fruit of stream-enterer and the first stage are called ‚Äúnoble ones.‚Äù

original: rnams spangs pa ste /
analyzed: rnams spangs pa ste /
translated: The Dharma of the noble ones is the abandonment of the obscurations that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: de dag ma thob pa'i phyir skye bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ma thob pa'i phyir skye bo zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they have not attained that, they are called ‚Äúordinary beings.‚ÄùüîΩThe factors that contribute to enlightenment are similar to that.

original: de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa ni 'jug pa la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'du byed sems dang mi ldan pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the expression ‚Äúengagement and so on‚Äù refers to the factors that contribute to enlightenment that are not associated with the mind.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'jug pa nas tshogs pa'i bar du dgu po dag bsdu'o //üîΩde la 'jug pa ni mi la sogs pa sems can gang yang rung ba'i phung po blangs nas /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'jug pa nas tshogs pa'i bar du dgu po dag bsdu'o // de la 'jug pa ni mi la sogs pa sems can gang yang rung ba'i phung po blangs nas /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the expression ‚Äúengagement and so on‚Äù includes the nine factors that contribute to enlightenment, from engagement up to the foundation of mindfulness.

original: skad cig ma'i phreng rgyud dang 'bras bu'i tshul rgyun ma chad par 'jug pa la bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i phreng rgyud dang 'bras bu'i tshul rgyun ma chad par 'jug pa la bya ste /

original: skad cig ma gcig gam phung po'i rgyun chad pa la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gam phung po'i rgyun chad pa la ni mi bya'o //
translated: It is not the engagement in a single moment or in the stream of the heaps that has been interrupted.

original: so sor nges pa ni phyi nang gi chos rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa ste /
analyzed: so sor nges pa ni phyi nang gi chos rgyu dang 'bras bu so sor nges pa ste /
translated: Individuality refers to the individual certainty of outer and inner phenomena as cause and effect.

original: phyi'i chos ni rgyu nas 'bras kyi sa bon btab na 'bras bu yang nas 'bras nyid du nges par 'byung zhing /üîΩbra sran du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: phyi'i chos ni rgyu nas 'bras kyi sa bon btab na 'bras bu yang nas 'bras nyid du nges par 'byung zhing / bra sran du mi 'gyur /
translated: Outer phenomena are individually certain, for example, if you plant barley seeds, the result will definitely be barley and not peas.

original: rgyu bra sran gyi sa bon btab na 'bras bu yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu bra sran gyi sa bon btab na 'bras bu yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you plant pea seeds, the result will be peas.

original: nang gi chos kyang las dge ba las ni 'bras bu yang bde ba /
analyzed: nang gi chos kyang las dge ba las ni 'bras bu yang bde ba /
translated: Inner phenomena are also individually certain, for example, from virtuous karma comes a happy result.

original: las mi dge ba las ni 'bras bu yang sdug bsngal du nges te /
analyzed: las mi dge ba las ni 'bras bu yang sdug bsngal du nges te /
translated: From nonvirtuous karma comes a suffering result.

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It will not be otherwise.

original: 'byor pa ni yon tan gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu 'tsham pa ste /
analyzed: 'byor pa ni yon tan gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu 'tsham pa ste /
translated: Prosperity refers to the harmony of the cause and result of qualities.

original: sbyin pas ni longs spyod 'byor /
analyzed: sbyin pas ni longs spyod 'byor /
translated: Generosity brings prosperity in terms of wealth.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni mtho ris /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni mtho ris /
translated: Discipline brings prosperity in terms of high status.

original: bzod pas ni byad bzhin /
analyzed: bzod pas ni byad bzhin /
translated: Patience brings prosperity in terms of physical appearance.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni yon tan rnams 'phel zhing bar mi 'chad /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni yon tan rnams 'phel zhing bar mi 'chad /
translated: Diligence brings prosperity in terms of increasing qualities and not interrupting them.

original: bsam gtan gyis ni shes rab /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni shes rab /
translated: Concentration brings prosperity in terms of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis ni rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas pa la sogs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas pa la sogs te /
translated: And through wisdom, one becomes learned in the five sciences and so forth.üîΩ

original: phun sum tshogs pa kun 'byor to //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa kun 'byor to //
translated: By means of wisdom, one acquires all excellences, such as skill in the five sciences.

original: mgyogs pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu myur du 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mgyogs pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu myur du 'byung ba ste /
translated: Swiftness is the rapid occurrence of cause and effect.

original: gong ma'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnams dang / yang skad cig ma'i snga phyi'i rgyu dang 'bras bu myur du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong ma'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnams dang / yang skad cig ma'i snga phyi'i rgyu dang 'bras bu myur du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The causes and effects of generosity and so forth in the higher realms and the causes and effects of the earlier and later moments occur rapidly.

original: go rims ni rgyu sngar byung la 'bras bu phyis 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: go rims ni rgyu sngar byung la 'bras bu phyis 'byung ba ste /
translated: Sequence is the occurrence of the effect after the cause.

original: phyi nang gi chos thams cad kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu mgo mnyam du mi 'byung gi //
analyzed: phyi nang gi chos thams cad kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu mgo mnyam du mi 'byung gi //
translated: All outer and inner phenomena do not occur simultaneously as cause and effect.

original: re re nas rim bzhin 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: re re nas rim bzhin 'byung ba'o //
translated: They occur in a definite sequence.

original: dus ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun du 'byung ba'i dus te rgyu 'bras byung ste 'gags pa la ni 'das pa'i dus zhes gdags /
analyzed: dus ni rgyu dang 'bras bu rgyun du 'byung ba'i dus te rgyu 'bras byung ste 'gags pa la ni 'das pa'i dus zhes gdags /
translated: Time is the time of the continuous occurrence of cause and effect. The occurrence and cessation of cause and effect is designated as the past time.

original: rgyu 'bras ma byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus zhes gdags /
analyzed: rgyu 'bras ma byung ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus zhes gdags /
translated: The nonoccurrence of cause and effect is designated as the future time.

original: rgyu 'bras byung ste ma 'gags pa la ni da ltar gyi dus zhes gdags so //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras byung ste ma 'gags pa la ni da ltar gyi dus zhes gdags so //
translated: The present time is designated for the time when the cause has arisen and not yet ceased.

original: yul ni lho byang shar nub phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re kun nas yang /
analyzed: yul ni lho byang shar nub phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re kun nas yang /
translated: The place is the ten directions of the east, south, west, north, nadir, and zenith.

original: phyi nang gi chos rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por skye ba yod pa kun la yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gi chos rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por skye ba yod pa kun la yul zhes bya'o //
translated: All things that arise as causes and effects of internal and external phenomena are called the place.

original: grangs zhes bya ba ni dngos po gcig pu la grangs su bgrang du med kyi /
analyzed: grangs zhes bya ba ni dngos po gcig pu la grangs su bgrang du med kyi /
translated: Number means that a single thing cannot be counted as a number.

original: dngos po tha dad @242b ba mang po la gnyis dang gsum la sogs par grangs su ba grang bas na /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad @242b ba mang po la gnyis dang gsum la sogs par grangs su ba grang bas na /
translated: Many different things can be counted as two, three, and so on.

original: 'du byed rnams ni gcig pu ma yin zhing rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni gcig pu ma yin zhing rnam pa mang po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that formations are not one but many kinds.

original: tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi chos rnams skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen te /
analyzed: tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi chos rnams skye ba'i rgyu dang rkyen te /
translated: The collection is the causes and conditions for the arising of internal and external phenomena.

original: sa bon dang sa chu me rlung ni phyi'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang sa chu me rlung ni phyi'o //
translated: Seeds, earth, water, fire, and wind are external.

original: ma rig pa 'du byed gnyis dang khams drug nang gi rgyu dang rkyen te /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'du byed gnyis dang khams drug nang gi rgyu dang rkyen te /
translated: The two of ignorance and formation and the six elements are internal causes and conditions.

original: de dag 'dus pa ni phyi nang gi chos rnams skyed par byed pas tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa ni phyi nang gi chos rnams skyed par byed pas tshogs pa'o //
translated: The collection of these is the collection of causes, because they generate outer and inner phenomena.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of consciousness?

original: dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa brgyad po so so'i yul shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa brgyad po so so'i yul shes par byed pa'o //
translated: The awareness of objects is the awareness of the objects of the eight consciousnesses.

original: sems dang yid kyang de yin te /
analyzed: sems dang yid kyang de yin te /
translated: It is also mind and mentation.

original: sna tshogs dang yid rten byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sna tshogs dang yid rten byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is the support of the various and the mental.

original: sems ni sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: sems ni sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Mind means the various.

original: de yang mig dang rna ba la sogs pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du drug po de dag rang rang gi yul tha dad pa'i chos sna tshogs la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang mig dang rna ba la sogs pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du drug po de dag rang rang gi yul tha dad pa'i chos sna tshogs la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the six consciousnesses from eye consciousness to mind consciousness, because they engage the various phenomena that are the different objects of each.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags pa ni yid ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma 'gags pa ni yid ces bya ste /
translated: The previous moment of consciousness is called mentation,

original: rnam par shes pa phyi ma skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir yid rten byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phyi ma skyed pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir yid rten byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because it is the cause that generates the subsequent moment of consciousness. It is called the support of the mental, because it is the support of mental consciousness.

original: dngos su na sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos su na sems ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: In reality, mind is called the store consciousness.üîΩIt is the accumulation of the seeds of all conditioned entities.

original: de ni 'du byed thams cad kyi sa bon bsags pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang gi rnam par shes pa drug po la yang sems zhes bya mod kyi gtan la dbab par na sems ni kun gzhi la bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed thams cad kyi sa bon bsags pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang gi rnam par shes pa drug po la yang sems zhes bya mod kyi gtan la dbab par na sems ni kun gzhi la bya'o //
translated: Although the six consciousnesses are also called mind, in the final analysis, mind is the store consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems kyi sgra ni bsags par 'dren la /
analyzed: sems kyi sgra ni bsags par 'dren la /
translated: The word mind is used to indicate an accumulation.

original: kun gzhi yang skad cig ma re re la las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i 'du byed thams cad kyi bag chags bsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi yang skad cig ma re re la las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i 'du byed thams cad kyi bag chags bsags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the store consciousness is an accumulation of the habitual tendencies of all conditioned entities, whether virtuous, nonvirtuous, or undefined, in each moment.

original: de yang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa dang / rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, it is not a specific form of consciousness that has a specific object and a specific aspect.üîΩThe store consciousness is not such that it sometimes has an object and sometimes does not.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de'i yul la la la dmigs la la la mi dmigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de'i yul la la la dmigs la la la mi dmigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that it sometimes has a specific object and sometimes does not.

original: snod dang bcud kyi 'jig rten ma lus pa thams cad la dmigs pa ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: snod dang bcud kyi 'jig rten ma lus pa thams cad la dmigs pa ma chad pa'o //
translated: It has as its object the entire world of sentient beings and their physical environment, without any distinction.

original: kha dog sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i bye brag gsal bar mi 'byed pas rnam pa ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i bye brag gsal bar mi 'byed pas rnam pa ma chad pa'o //
translated: Since it does not clearly distinguish the particulars of color, such as blue, yellow, and so on, it is undifferentiated.

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te /
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de yin te /
translated: It is also the appropriating consciousness.

original: lus len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshe phyi mar lus len pa ni bdag rtag pa ma yin gyi sems kyis lus len te /
analyzed: lus len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tshe phyi mar lus len pa ni bdag rtag pa ma yin gyi sems kyis lus len te /
translated: Because it appropriates the body. The appropriation of the body in a future life is not due to a permanent self, but due to the mind.

original: de yang mngal du khrag dang khu ba 'dzin pa nas de nam ma shi ba'i bar du lus 'dzin pas na len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de nyid yin zhes smos te /
analyzed: de yang mngal du khrag dang khu ba 'dzin pa nas de nam ma shi ba'i bar du lus 'dzin pas na len pa'i rnam par shes pa yang de nyid yin zhes smos te /
translated: Since it appropriates the body from the moment of conception in the womb, when the semen and blood are held, until death, it is also the appropriating consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa drug po dang bdag rtag pa dag ni lus len pa ma yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa drug po dang bdag rtag pa dag ni lus len pa ma yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The six consciousnesses of the eye and so on and a permanent self do not appropriate the body.

original: dngos su @243a * //
analyzed: dngos su @243a * //
translated: In reality,

original: yid kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs te rtag tu 'khor bzhi dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni gong du sgo drug gi rnam par shes pa la sems zhes btags mod kyi dngos su na sems ni kun gzhi yin no zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar
analyzed: yid kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la dmigs te rtag tu 'khor bzhi dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba ni gong du sgo drug gi rnam par shes pa la sems zhes btags mod kyi dngos su na sems ni kun gzhi yin no zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar
translated: This is similar to the statement above that although the consciousnesses of the six sense doors are designated as the mind, the actual mind is the foundation consciousness.

original: 'dir yang gong du rnam par shes pa drug po 'gags ma thag pa de la yid ces btags mod kyi dngos su de la mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang gong du rnam par shes pa drug po 'gags ma thag pa de la yid ces btags mod kyi dngos su de la mi bya ste /
translated: Here, although the immediately past six consciousnesses are designated as the mind, they are not actually the mind.

original: 'dir ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la yid ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la yid ces bya ste /
translated: Here the afflicted mind is called the mind.

original: de rnam par shes pa yin na /
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa yin na /
translated: If that is consciousness,

original: dmigs pa med du mi rung bas dmigs pa'i yul kun gzhi'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med du mi rung bas dmigs pa'i yul kun gzhi'o //
translated: it cannot be without an object, so the object it focuses on is the foundation consciousness.

original: de sems yin na sems las byung ba med du mi rung bas sems las byung ba ni bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag la chags pa bzhi dang kun du 'gro ba lnga ste /
analyzed: de sems yin na sems las byung ba med du mi rung bas sems las byung ba ni bdag tu rmongs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag tu nga rgyal ba dang / bdag la chags pa bzhi dang kun du 'gro ba lnga ste /
translated: If that is the mind, it cannot be without mental factors, so the mental factors are the four afflictions of delusion about a self, view of a self, pride in a self, and attachment to a self, and the five omnipresent mental factors.

original: sems las byung ba'i 'khor dgu dang ldan no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i 'khor dgu dang ldan no zhes bya'o //
translated: It is associated with nine mental factors.üîΩThe six active consciousnesses should be understood as appropriate in accordance with what appears in other s≈´tras.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug kyang mdo gzhan las 'byung ba bzhin du ci rigs par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar drug ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug kyang mdo gzhan las 'byung ba bzhin du ci rigs par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar drug ste /
translated: The six are from eye consciousness to mind consciousness.

original: de yang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig la brten gzugs la dmigs nas gzugs yongs su shes par byed pas na /
analyzed: de yang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig la brten gzugs la dmigs nas gzugs yongs su shes par byed pas na /
translated: Eye consciousness is based on the eye, focuses on form, and causes the recognition of form.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa kun la yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa kun la yang de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The same should be applied to ear consciousness and so on.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi dbang po la brten nas chos la dmigs shing chos yongs su shes par byed pa'i bar du de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi dbang po la brten nas chos la dmigs shing chos yongs su shes par byed pa'i bar du de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: Mind consciousness should be understood as based on the mental faculty, focusing on phenomena, and causing the recognition of phenomena.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug 'byung zhing skye ba'i rgyu 'am sgo lta bur gyur pas skye mched ces bya ste /
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug 'byung zhing skye ba'i rgyu 'am sgo lta bur gyur pas skye mched ces bya ste /
translated: The six sense faculties such as the eyes are called sense bases because they are the doors or causes for the arising and generation of the six consciousnesses.

original: dngos su na mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang / lce'i skye mched dang / ro'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang /
analyzed: dngos su na mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched dang / rna ba'i skye mched dang / sgra'i skye mched dang / sna'i skye mched dang / dri'i skye mched dang / lce'i skye mched dang / ro'i skye mched dang / lus kyi skye mched dang /
translated: In actuality, they are the eye sense base, form sense base, ear sense base, sound sense base, nose sense base, smell sense base, tongue sense base, taste sense base, body sense base,

original: reg bya'i skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched dang chos kyi skye mched do zhes smos te /üîΩmig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams la brten nas yul rnams la dmigs te /
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched dang / yid kyi skye mched dang chos kyi skye mched do zhes smos te / mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams la brten nas yul rnams la dmigs te /
translated: tangible object sense base, mind sense base and entity sense base.

original: rnam par shes pa drug skye bas na dbang po drug dang / yul drug la ni skye mched bcu gnyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug skye bas na dbang po drug dang / yul drug la ni skye mched bcu gnyis zhes bya'o //
translated: The six sense faculties such as the eyes are called the twelve sense bases because the six consciousnesses arise in dependence on the sense faculties and objective referents.

original: de la rnam par shes pa'i phung por gtogs pa rnam par shes pa @243b brgyad ni yid kyi skye mched du bsdu'o //üîΩso sor brtags te 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang nam mkha' dang de bzhin nyid dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa'i phung por gtogs pa rnam par shes pa @243b brgyad ni yid kyi skye mched du bsdu'o // so sor brtags te 'gog pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang nam mkha' dang de bzhin nyid dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste /
translated: The eight consciousnesses included in the aggregate of consciousness are included in the mental faculty.üîΩThe eight dharmas‚Äîcessation through deliberation, cessation not through deliberation, space, suchness, feeling, conception, formations, and non-informative matter‚Äî

original: chos de brgyad ni chos kyi skye mched du bsdu'o //
analyzed: chos de brgyad ni chos kyi skye mched du bsdu'o //
translated: are included in the sense-sphere of mental objects.

original: gzhan ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest are easy to understand.

original: khams bco brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni rten gyi khams drug dang / dmigs pa'i khams drug dang brten pa'i khams drug ste bco brgyad do //
analyzed: khams bco brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni rten gyi khams drug dang / dmigs pa'i khams drug dang brten pa'i khams drug ste bco brgyad do //
translated: What are the eighteen elements? The six faculties as elements, the six objects as elements, and the six consciousnesses as elements.

original: de la dbang po drug rten zhes bya /üîΩyul drug ni dmigs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: de la dbang po drug rten zhes bya / yul drug ni dmigs pa zhes bya /
translated: The six faculties are called the ‚Äúbases of the elements.‚ÄùüîΩThe six objects are called the ‚Äúobjects of the elements.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa drug ni brten pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug ni brten pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The six consciousnesses are called the ‚Äúelements that are based on the elements.‚Äù

original: dngos su na /
analyzed: dngos su na /
translated: In reality,

original: mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang /
translated: The eye element, form element, and eye consciousness element,üîΩthe ear element, sound element, and ear consciousness element, the nose element, smell element, and nose consciousness element,

original: lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so zhes smos te /
analyzed: lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so zhes smos te /
translated: the tongue element, taste element, and tongue consciousness element, the body element, tactile element, and body consciousness element, the mind element, phenomena element, and mind consciousness element.

original: gong du bshad pa ltar rim bzhin sbyar ro //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa ltar rim bzhin sbyar ro //
translated: As explained above, they should be applied in order.üîΩWhat are the six elements?

original: khams drug gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni ming du khams drug ces brjod pa'i rnam grangs gzhan dag kyang 'dir bstan te /
analyzed: khams drug gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni ming du khams drug ces brjod pa'i rnam grangs gzhan dag kyang 'dir bstan te /
translated: This teaches other synonyms for the six elements that are named above.

original: de yang sa'i khams ni sa bon brten pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de yang sa'i khams ni sa bon brten pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The earth element functions as the support for seeds.

original: chu'i khams ni sa bon brlan pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni sa bon brlan pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The water element acts as the moistening of the seed.

original: me'i khams ni sa bon dro ba'i bya ba byed do //üîΩrlung gi khams ni sa bon 'bu ba'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: me'i khams ni sa bon dro ba'i bya ba byed do // rlung gi khams ni sa bon 'bu ba'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The fire element acts as the ripening of the seed.üîΩThe wind element acts as the inflation of the seed.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni sa bon mi sgrib pa'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni sa bon mi sgrib pa'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The space element acts as the non-obstruction of the seed.

original: dus ni sa bon 'gyur ba'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: dus ni sa bon 'gyur ba'i bya ba byed do //
translated: Time acts as the transformation of the seed.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes kyang btags te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams zhes kyang btags te /
translated: The consciousness element is also designated.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs skye ba'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni ming dang gzugs skye ba'i bya ba byed do //
translated: The consciousness element is the store-consciousness, which acts as the origination of name-and-form.

original: nang gi chos skye ba'i sa bon yin no //
analyzed: nang gi chos skye ba'i sa bon yin no //
translated: It is the seed of the origination of internal dharmas.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni nang gi chos rnams ji ltar skye ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnams ston te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni nang gi chos rnams ji ltar skye ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnams ston te /
translated: What are the twelve members of dependent origination? This shows the causes and results of the origination of internal dharmas.

original: de la mun pa chen po'i phyir ma rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni dper na mun pas bsgribs na rdzas kyi dngos po rags pa yang mi mthong ba dang 'dra bar ma rig pas kyang las dang las kyi 'bras bu yod pa dang / bden pa dang /
