analyzed: de la mun pa chen po'i phyir ma rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni dper na mun pas bsgribs na rdzas kyi dngos po rags pa yang mi mthong ba dang 'dra bar ma rig pas kyang las dang las kyi 'bras bu yod pa dang / bden pa dang /
translated: It is called ignorance because it is a great darkness. Just as one cannot see gross material things when they are obscured by darkness, so also ignorance obscures the existence of karma and the results of karma, the truths,

original: dkon mchog yon tan @244a * //
analyzed: dkon mchog yon tan @244a * //
translated: the qualities of the Jewels,

original: can dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du mthong bar bya ba la bsgribs te mi mthong bas na mun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: can dang / chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid du mthong bar bya ba la bsgribs te mi mthong bas na mun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and the emptiness that is the characteristic of all phenomena.

original: mngon par 'du byed ba'i phyir 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa sna tshogs byed pas na 'du byed do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed ba'i phyir 'du byed rnams so zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa sna tshogs byed pas na 'du byed do //
translated: It is called formation because it forms. It is called formation because it forms various kinds of karma, virtuous, nonvirtuous, and unobscured, in the three realms.

original: rnam par rig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi chos rnams la gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yul tha dad pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas so sor rig cing shes pas na rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gi chos rnams la gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa yul tha dad pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas so sor rig cing shes pas na rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Consciousness is so called because it cognizes, since the eye consciousness, etc., cognize and perceive the different objects such as form and sound that are internal and external phenomena.

original: brten pa'i phyir ming dang gzugs so zhes bya ba ni dper na shing gsum rtse sprad na mdung khyim du rung ba dang 'dra bar ming gi phung po dang gzugs kyi phung po gnyis kyang gcig la gcig brten pas na ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brten pa'i phyir ming dang gzugs so zhes bya ba ni dper na shing gsum rtse sprad na mdung khyim du rung ba dang 'dra bar ming gi phung po dang gzugs kyi phung po gnyis kyang gcig la gcig brten pas na ming dang gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: Name-and-form is so called because they support each other, like a bundle of reeds, since the aggregate of name and the aggregate of form support each other.

original: skye ba'i sgo'i phyir skye mched drug go zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye zhing 'byung ba'i rgyu byed pas na sgo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i sgo'i phyir skye mched drug go zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye zhing 'byung ba'i rgyu byed pas na sgo zhes bya ste /
translated: The six sense bases are so called because they are the doors of entry, since they function as the cause for the arising and entry of mind and mental factors.

original: dngos su na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug ni skye mched ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos su na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug ni skye mched ces bya'o //
translated: In fact, the six sense faculties such as the eyes are called sense bases.

original: reg pa'i phyir reg pa'o zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa la reg pa zhas bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i phyir reg pa'o zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa la reg pa zhas bya'o //
translated: Contact is so called because of contact.

original: myong ba'i phyir tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: myong ba'i phyir tshor ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Feeling is so called because of experience.üîΩWhen the three, the object, the sense faculty, and the consciousness, come together, there is contact.

original: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa na yul yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa gang dang gang la reg pa'i rgyus tshor ba yang bde sdug rnam pa gsum myong ba ni tshor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa na yul yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa gang dang gang la reg pa'i rgyus tshor ba yang bde sdug rnam pa gsum myong ba ni tshor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause of contact is any pleasant, unpleasant, or neutral object that is experienced through the coming together of the object, the sense faculty, and the consciousness.

original: skom pa'i phyir sred pa'o zhes bya ba ni /üîΩskom gyis gdungs pa dang 'dra bar tshor ba sdug bsngal dang ni 'bral bar 'dod la /
analyzed: skom pa'i phyir sred pa'o zhes bya ba ni / skom gyis gdungs pa dang 'dra bar tshor ba sdug bsngal dang ni 'bral bar 'dod la /
translated: Craving is so called because of thirst.

original: tshor ba bde ba dang ni phrad cing /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba dang ni phrad cing /
translated: Like someone tormented by thirst, one desires to be separated from painful feelings and to meet with and be united with pleasant feelings.

original: 'grogs par 'dod pas sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'grogs par 'dod pas sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Craving is so called because of this thirst.üîΩClinging is so called because of grasping.

original: len pa'i phyir len pa'o zhes bya ba ni len pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: len pa'i phyir len pa'o zhes bya ba ni len pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of grasping:

original: 'dod pa len pa dang / lta ba len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs snyems pa len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba len pa'i phyir len pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa len pa dang / lta ba len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs snyems pa len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba len pa'i phyir len pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called grasping because of grasping desire, grasping at views, grasping at morality and vows, and grasping at a doctrine of self.

original: yang srid par skye ba'i phyir srid pa'o zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang srid par skye ba'i phyir srid pa'o zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is called existence because of being born in a new existence. It is the cause of birth in the three realms.

original: de yang skye ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags brtas nas tshe phyi mar skye ba ni srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang skye ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags brtas nas tshe phyi mar skye ba ni srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, existence is called the cause of birth, because it is the development of the latent impressions of karma and the afflictions, and the birth in a future life.

original: phung po 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni lam rgyud lngar lha dang mi la sogs pa'i lus kyi phung po sngon med pa las gzod byung ba ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung po 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni lam rgyud lngar lha dang mi la sogs pa'i lus kyi phung po sngon med pa las gzod byung ba ni skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called birth because of the arising of the aggregates. It is called birth because of the first appearance of the aggregates of a body of a god, human, and so on, in the five realms of existence.

original: phung @244b po smin pa'i phyir rga ba'o zhes bya ba ni shing thog smin nas rnyings pa dang 'dra bar skra dkar dang gnyer ma can du 'gyur ba ni rga ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phung @244b po smin pa'i phyir rga ba'o zhes bya ba ni shing thog smin nas rnyings pa dang 'dra bar skra dkar dang gnyer ma can du 'gyur ba ni rga ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called aging because of the maturation of the aggregates. It is called aging because of the transformation of the body, such as the hair turning white and wrinkles appearing, like a fruit ripening and becoming rotten.

original: 'jig pa'i phyir 'chi ba'o zhes bya ba ni lus kyi phung po gnas pa'i dus zad de drod dang rnam par shes pas btang nas zhig pa'i phyir 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i phyir 'chi ba'o zhes bya ba ni lus kyi phung po gnas pa'i dus zad de drod dang rnam par shes pas btang nas zhig pa'i phyir 'chi ba'o //
translated: Death is the destruction of the body, because the body is destroyed when the time of its existence is exhausted, and heat and consciousness are lost.

original: skabs yin pas na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skabs yin pas na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is used in the sense of ‚Äúat the time of.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal 'di dag kyang skye ba dang / rga shi'i yan lag tu gtogs shing 'brel ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di dag kyang skye ba dang / rga shi'i yan lag tu gtogs shing 'brel ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These sufferings are also included in the members of birth and old age and death, and are related to them.

original: mya ngan ni gnyen bshes dang longs spyod kyi yo byad rnams dang bral du dogs pa'i sems gdung ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan ni gnyen bshes dang longs spyod kyi yo byad rnams dang bral du dogs pa'i sems gdung ba'o //
translated: Sorrow is the burning of the mind, which is produced by the fear of separation from relatives, friends, and possessions.

original: smre sngags 'don pa ni rgyu gang las mya ngan du gyur ba'i lo rgyus tshig tu smra zhing mkhang ba'o //
analyzed: smre sngags 'don pa ni rgyu gang las mya ngan du gyur ba'i lo rgyus tshig tu smra zhing mkhang ba'o //
translated: Lamentation is the expression of the cause of sorrow in words, and the utterance of cries of grief.

original: sdug bsngal ni lus nyams shing mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni lus nyams shing mi bde ba'o //
translated: Suffering is the affliction of the body.

original: yid mi bde ba ni sems nyams shing mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni sems nyams shing mi bde ba'o //
translated: Mental suffering is the affliction of the mind.

original: 'khrugs pa ni sngon nyes pa sna tshogs pa byas pa kun dran nas sems dang ngas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa ni sngon nyes pa sna tshogs pa byas pa kun dran nas sems dang ngas pa'o //
translated: Despair is the agitation of the mind, which is produced by the recollection of various former misfortunes.

original: brjod do zhes bya ba ni rten 'brel gyi mjug la btags te bshad do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brjod do zhes bya ba ni rten 'brel gyi mjug la btags te bshad do zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase is explained is added at the end of the verse on dependent origination and means is explained.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten perfections?

original: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba 'das nas sa bcu rim gyis thob par byed pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa bcu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba 'das nas sa bcu rim gyis thob par byed pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa bcu zhes bya ste /
translated: The ten perfections are so called because they cause one to cross over the ocean of suffering in the three realms and to attain the ten stages in sequence.

original: de yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos dang / zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa gsum sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos dang / zang zing dang / mi 'jigs pa gsum sbyin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the perfection of generosity is the giving of the three: the Dharma, material things, and fearlessness.

original: de la dam pa'i chos dang 'jig rten gyi snyan ngag dang / bzo dang mthu rtsal rnams kyis gtong zhing phan 'dogs pa ni chos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dam pa'i chos dang 'jig rten gyi snyan ngag dang / bzo dang mthu rtsal rnams kyis gtong zhing phan 'dogs pa ni chos sbyin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the giving of the Dharma is the giving of the true Dharma, worldly poetry, crafts, and power.

original: zas skom nor rdzas la sogs te /
analyzed: zas skom nor rdzas la sogs te /
translated: The giving of material things is the giving of food, drink, wealth, goods, and so on.

original: mkhar yul rgyal srid man chad dang / bran zhing phyugs nor bu smad rnams dang / rang gi sha khrag dang mgo lus la sogs pa phyi nang gi dngos po rnam pa gsum gyis gtong zhing phan 'dogs pa ni zang zing sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mkhar yul rgyal srid man chad dang / bran zhing phyugs nor bu smad rnams dang / rang gi sha khrag dang mgo lus la sogs pa phyi nang gi dngos po rnam pa gsum gyis gtong zhing phan 'dogs pa ni zang zing sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity of material things is to give away and benefit others with the three kinds of things: the kingdom and so on below the castle, the slaves, fields, cattle, wealth, wives and children, and one's own flesh, blood, head, body, and so on, the outer and inner things.

original: rgyal po dang blon po la sogs pa'i chad pa dang / dgra dang gcan gzan la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa rnams las skyob cing phan 'dogs pa ni mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal po dang blon po la sogs pa'i chad pa dang / dgra dang gcan gzan la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa rnams las skyob cing phan 'dogs pa ni mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ste /
translated: The generosity of fearlessness is to protect and benefit others from the dangers of the king's punishment, ministers and so on, enemies, wild animals and so on.

original: de dag 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //üîΩtshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: de dag 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The practice of these three spheres of giving is called the perfection.

original: dge ba sdud pa dang / mi dge ba sdom pa dang sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: dge ba sdud pa dang / mi dge ba sdom pa dang sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The perfection of morality is the three kinds of morality: gathering virtue, restraining non-virtue, and working for the welfare of living beings.

original: de la dge ba sdud pa ni dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa nas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs te /
analyzed: de la dge ba sdud pa ni dam pa'i chos nyan cing sems pa nas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs te /
translated: Gathering virtue is listening to the holy Dharma, reflecting on it, and meditating on it, from the levels and perfections up to the ten transcendent perfections.

original: byang chub kyi chos rnams bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi chos rnams bsgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the practice of the elements leading to enlightenment.

original: @245a * // mi dge ba sdom pa ni nyan thos kyi khrims sde bdun te /üîΩdge slong pha ma dag /
analyzed: @245a * // mi dge ba sdom pa ni nyan thos kyi khrims sde bdun te / dge slong pha ma dag /
translated: Restraint from what is unwholesome is the seven sets of vows of the disciples.üîΩIt is the protection of the vows of fully ordained monks and nuns,

original: dge sbyong pha ma dang / dge bsnyen pha ma dan bar khrims ma rnams kyis srung ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong pha ma dang / dge bsnyen pha ma dan bar khrims ma rnams kyis srung ba'o //
translated: of male and female novices, and of the male and female lay disciples.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa ni bu gcig pa gces pa dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad la dbye bkol med par don byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa ni bu gcig pa gces pa dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad la dbye bkol med par don byed pa ste /
translated: Benefiting sentient beings is acting for the sake of all sentient beings without discrimination, as if one were cherishing a beloved only child.

original: 'khor gsum dag par spyod pa ni 'og man chad kun la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'khor gsum dag par spyod pa ni 'og man chad kun la yang sbyar ro //
translated: Pure performance with regard to the three spheres is to be applied to all the following perfections.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa dang / gnod pa la mi mjed pa dang / chos la rtogs pa'i bzod pa dang gsum mo //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa dang / gnod pa la mi mjed pa dang / chos la rtogs pa'i bzod pa dang gsum mo //
translated: The perfection of patience has three aspects: patience in withstanding suffering, patience in enduring harmful persons, and patience in resolving that phenomena do not exist.

original: de la sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa ni dge ba byed pa'i dus na bkres shing skom pa dang / grang zhing tsha ba la sogs pa gnod pa'i rkyen gang ci byung yang mi gtong ste dge ba'i rgyun mi gcod pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa ni dge ba byed pa'i dus na bkres shing skom pa dang / grang zhing tsha ba la sogs pa gnod pa'i rkyen gang ci byung yang mi gtong ste dge ba'i rgyun mi gcod pa'o //
translated: With regard to that, the patience of not regarding suffering is that when one is practicing virtue, whatever conditions of harm arise, such as hunger and thirst, cold and heat, one does not give up, and one does not interrupt the continuity of virtue.

original: gnod pa la mi mjed pa ni phan btags pa'i sems can la sogs pa gzhan gyis brdeg pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa sna tshogs byed kyang de la mi khro zhing ngan sems mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa la mi mjed pa ni phan btags pa'i sems can la sogs pa gzhan gyis brdeg pa dang / bcing ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa sna tshogs byed kyang de la mi khro zhing ngan sems mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: The patience of not retaliating for harm is that when other sentient beings, such as those who are helped, beat, bind, and so forth, and do various harms, one does not get angry, and one does not give rise to a bad mind.

original: chos la rtogs pa'i bzod pa ni /
analyzed: chos la rtogs pa'i bzod pa ni /
translated: The patience of realizing the Dharma is

original: stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa'am /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / bdag med pa'am /
translated: the profound meaning of emptiness, selflessness,

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i don zab mo dag bstan na sems mi dngang zhing de la dad pa dang dga' ba skye ba'i phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i don zab mo dag bstan na sems mi dngang zhing de la dad pa dang dga' ba skye ba'i phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: or the absence of arising and cessation. When those are taught, since one's mind is not frightened, and one gives rise to faith and joy in that, it is called the perfection of patience.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of effort is

original: go cha dang / dge ba sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa ste gsum mo //
analyzed: go cha dang / dge ba sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa ste gsum mo //
translated: armor, gathering virtue, and working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de la dang por sems can thams cad kyi don dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub bskal ba'i mtha'i bar du bsgrub po zhes dam bca' ba ni go cha'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: de la dang por sems can thams cad kyi don dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub bskal ba'i mtha'i bar du bsgrub po zhes dam bca' ba ni go cha'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: Armor striving is the vow to work for the welfare of all sentient beings and to accomplish unsurpassable enlightenment for the duration of samsara.

original: chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang sgom par byed pa rgyun mi gcod pa ni dge ba sdud pa'i brtson 'grus so /
analyzed: chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang sgom par byed pa rgyun mi gcod pa ni dge ba sdud pa'i brtson 'grus so /
translated: Gathering virtue striving is the uninterrupted practice of listening to the teachings, reflecting on them, and meditating on them.

original: bsdu ba rnam pa bzhis sems can rnams thabs kyis bsdus te dge ba la 'god pa ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba rnam pa bzhis sems can rnams thabs kyis bsdus te dge ba la 'god pa ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: Working for the welfare of sentient beings striving is the skillful means of gathering sentient beings through the four means of gathering and then establishing them in virtue.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang / yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa ste gsum mo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang / yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa ste gsum mo //
translated: The perfection of meditative stabilization has three functions: abiding in bliss in this life, accomplishing excellent qualities, and working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: @245b da la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan yin no //
analyzed: @245b da la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan yin no //
translated: The concentration of non-discrimination and the meditative attainment of cessation are the meditative stabilization of ease in this life.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sangs rgyas kyi che ba'i yon tan thams cad thob par byed pa ni yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sangs rgyas kyi che ba'i yon tan thams cad thob par byed pa ni yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The meditative stabilization of the hero's progress and so forth, which causes one to attain all the great qualities of the Buddha, is the meditative stabilization of the accomplishment of good qualities.

original: bsam gtan bsgrub pa'i sgo nas mngon par shes pa drug po dag thob nas lus kyi rdzu 'phrul byas pa'i rgyus sems dga' bar byas shing /
analyzed: bsam gtan bsgrub pa'i sgo nas mngon par shes pa drug po dag thob nas lus kyi rdzu 'phrul byas pa'i rgyus sems dga' bar byas shing /
translated: Having attained the six superknowledges through the practice of meditative stabilization, one delights the mind by performing physical miracles.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pas sems dang mthun par chos bshad nas mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la 'god pa ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pas sems dang mthun par chos bshad nas mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la 'god pa ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: Having explained the Dharma in accordance with the minds of others through knowledge of others' minds, one turns them away from non-virtue and establishes them in virtue. This is called the meditative stabilization of benefiting sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bdag gi don rtogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don rtogs pa dang / rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i shes rab ste gsum mo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bdag gi don rtogs pa dang / gzhan gyi don rtogs pa dang / rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i shes rab ste gsum mo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is threefold: the wisdom that is the realization of one's own aim, the wisdom that is the realization of others' aims and the wisdom that is the refutation of adversaries.

original: de yang rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas pa ste de la nang rig pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi don la mkhas pas bdag gi don rtogs pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: de yang rig pa'i gnas lnga la mkhas pa ste de la nang rig pa ni gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi don la mkhas pas bdag gi don rtogs pa'i shes rab po //
translated: Moreover, it is expertise in the five topics of knowledge. Expertise in the inner science is the wisdom that is the realization of one's own aim through expertise in the meaning of the twelve branches of excellent speech.

original: gso ba rig pa ni phyi'i nad bzhi brgyad rtsa bzhi'i sman dpyad la mkhas pa dang / nang gi nad 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gnyen po byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa ston pa ni gso ba rig pa'o //
analyzed: gso ba rig pa ni phyi'i nad bzhi brgyad rtsa bzhi'i sman dpyad la mkhas pa dang / nang gi nad 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gnyen po byams pa dang snying rje la sogs pa ston pa ni gso ba rig pa'o //
translated: The science of medicine is expertise in the treatment of the four hundred and four diseases of the body and in the antidotes to the inner diseases of attachment, aversion and so on, such as love and compassion.

original: las su bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad la mkhas pa ni bzo rig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las su bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad la mkhas pa ni bzo rig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Expertise in all aspects of action is called the science of arts and crafts.

original: des sems can blun po rnams kyi mthu rtsal bskyed cing bstangs te /
analyzed: des sems can blun po rnams kyi mthu rtsal bskyed cing bstangs te /
translated: It increases the strength and power of foolish sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi don byas pas gso ba dang bzo gnyis rig pas ni gzhan gyi don rtogs pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don byas pas gso ba dang bzo gnyis rig pas ni gzhan gyi don rtogs pa'i shes rab po //
translated: And by working for the welfare of sentient beings, the wisdom of realizing the welfare of others.

original: rgyu rig pa dang sgra rig pa gnyis ni ta ra ka dang by'a ka ra na'i skad la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu rig pa dang sgra rig pa gnyis ni ta ra ka dang by'a ka ra na'i skad la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The two sciences of grammar and logic are the expertise in the languages of the Taraka and the Vyakarana.

original: de gnyis kyis ni mu stegs la sogs pa sun 'byin pas rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ni mu stegs la sogs pa sun 'byin pas rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: And by means of these two, one refutes the heterodox and so on, so it is called the wisdom of defeating opponents.

original: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mang nyung ci bsags pa cung zad yan chad kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing bla na med pa'i byang chub chen @246a * //
analyzed: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mang nyung ci bsags pa cung zad yan chad kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing bla na med pa'i byang chub chen @246a * //
translated: The perfection of means is the dedication of whatever roots of virtue one has accumulated, whether many or few, to unsurpassed great enlightenment, sharing them with all sentient beings.

original: por bsngos pas de'i 'bras bu dpag tu med par che zhing zad mi shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: por bsngos pas de'i 'bras bu dpag tu med par che zhing zad mi shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, their result becomes immeasurable and inexhaustible.

original: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bdag tshe rabs gar skyes kyang byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral zhing sems can thams cad kyi don du phya rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa rgyun mi gcod par gyur cig ces smon lam du btab pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bdag tshe rabs gar skyes kyang byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'bral zhing sems can thams cad kyi don du phya rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa rgyun mi gcod par gyur cig ces smon lam du btab pa'o //
translated: The perfection of aspiration is the aspiration: ‚ÄúWherever I am born in all my lives, may I never be separated from the Thought of Enlightenment, and may I never interrupt the practice of the perfections for the sake of all sentient beings.‚Äù

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te kun brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te kun brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs so //
translated: The perfection of power is twofold: the power of imagination and the power of cultivation.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin dang 'grogs pa'i shes rab kyis phyi nang gi chos rnams stong pa dang bdag med par mthong bas de la chags pa mi skye ba ni kun brtags pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin dang 'grogs pa'i shes rab kyis phyi nang gi chos rnams stong pa dang bdag med par mthong bas de la chags pa mi skye ba ni kun brtags pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of imagination is the non-arising of attachment to that, by seeing external and internal phenomena as empty and selfless through the wisdom which accompanies samadhi.

original: brtson 'grus kyi shas che bas shes rab chung yang goms pa'i shugs kyis dge ba'i phyogs 'bad mi dgos par bsgrub pa ni bsgoms pa'i stobs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi shas che bas shes rab chung yang goms pa'i shugs kyis dge ba'i phyogs 'bad mi dgos par bsgrub pa ni bsgoms pa'i stobs zhes bya ste /
translated: The power of cultivation is the accomplishment of the side of virtue without effort by the force of habit, even though one has little wisdom because of the predominance of striving.

original: de dag la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pas mi tshugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pas mi tshugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not overcome by stinginess, etc., which are the counteragents to those perfections.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid stong par thugs su chud pas /
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid stong par thugs su chud pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the realization of the emptiness of the characteristics of phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i nang du chos kyi longs spyod chen pos longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i nang du chos kyi longs spyod chen pos longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the great enjoyment of the Dharma by the great bodhisattvas is due to that.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i skabs yin pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni /üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa ni rgyu yin la /üîΩsa bcu ni 'bras bu yin pas /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i skabs yin pa byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni / pha rol tu phyin pa ni rgyu yin la / sa bcu ni 'bras bu yin pas /
translated: The ten bodhisattva stages are the results of those perfections.

original: 'dab chags su bshad par rigs te 'brel to zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'dab chags su bshad par rigs te 'brel to zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is appropriate to explain them in sequence, as they are connected, that is, the ten perfections are the causes and the ten stages are the results.

original: sa bcu gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa bcu gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What are the ten stages?

original: mgo 'dren pa ste dngos su 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mgo 'dren pa ste dngos su 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is the introduction, which is directly connected with what follows below.

original: de la sa dang po ni rab tu dga' ba'o zhes bya ba ni dper na mi dbul po zhig gis nor bu rin po che zhig rnyed na sngon ma mthong ba'i nor bu mchog tu rin che ba 'di 'dra ba rnyed do zhes shin tu dga' ba dang
analyzed: de la sa dang po ni rab tu dga' ba'o zhes bya ba ni dper na mi dbul po zhig gis nor bu rin po che zhig rnyed na sngon ma mthong ba'i nor bu mchog tu rin che ba 'di 'dra ba rnyed do zhes shin tu dga' ba dang
translated: The first level is called the ‚ÄúVery Joyful One‚Äù because, for example, when a poor person finds a precious jewel, they are extremely joyful, thinking, ‚ÄúI have found such a precious jewel that I have never seen before.‚Äù

original: 'dra bar sngon nam yang ma mthong ba'i chos kyi dbyings mngon du mthong ba dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed nus te /
analyzed: 'dra bar sngon nam yang ma mthong ba'i chos kyi dbyings mngon du mthong ba dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed nus te /
translated: Similarly, one sees the expanse of reality, which has never been seen before, and one is able to accomplish the perfect benefit of self and other.

original: sbyin pa rdzogs nas dga' ba'i khyad par dpag tu med pa skyes pa'i phyir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa rdzogs nas dga' ba'i khyad par dpag tu med pa skyes pa'i phyir sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one has completed generosity and has given rise to an immeasurable special joy, the first level is called the ‚ÄúVery Joyful One.‚Äù

original: sa gnyis pa ni dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: sa gnyis pa ni dri ma med pa ste /
translated: The second level is called the ‚ÄúImmaculate One‚Äù because it is free of stains.

original: dri ma ni @246b 'khor ba'i chos la dga' ba dang theg pa chung du la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: dri ma ni @246b 'khor ba'i chos la dga' ba dang theg pa chung du la dga' ba ste /
translated: The stains are delight in the phenomena of samsara and delight in the Hinayana.

original: de yang mi dge ba byed pa dang snying rje med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mi dge ba byed pa dang snying rje med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, they are nonvirtuous actions and a lack of compassion.

original: dri ma de gnyis sa gnyis pa'i dus na med pas dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma de gnyis sa gnyis pa'i dus na med pas dri ma med pa'o //
translated: Since those two stains do not exist at the time of the second level, it is called the ‚ÄúImmaculate One.‚Äù

original: yang na tshul khrims rdzogs te rmi lam na yang tshul khrims ngan pa'i las mi byed pas dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims rdzogs te rmi lam na yang tshul khrims ngan pa'i las mi byed pas dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, morality is perfect, and even in dreams one does not commit any action of immorality. Thus it is called immaculate.

original: sa gsum pa 'od byed pa ni /
analyzed: sa gsum pa 'od byed pa ni /
translated: The third stage is the Radiant.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas lus dang srog la yang mi lta bar thos pa btsal te bdag dang gzhan gyi mi shes pa bsal zhing shes rab skyes pa ni 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas lus dang srog la yang mi lta bar thos pa btsal te bdag dang gzhan gyi mi shes pa bsal zhing shes rab skyes pa ni 'od byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of patience is complete, and one seeks learning without regard even for one's body and life. The ignorance of oneself and others is dispelled, and wisdom is born. Thus it is called the Radiant.

original: sa bzhi pa ni 'od 'phro ba can te /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa ni 'od 'phro ba can te /
translated: The fourth stage is the Brilliant.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa las ye shes me dang 'dra ba skyes pas nyon mongs pa rtsi shing lta bu bsregs pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pa las ye shes me dang 'dra ba skyes pas nyon mongs pa rtsi shing lta bu bsregs pa'i phyir 'od 'phro ba can zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of vigor is complete, and the fire of wisdom born of the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment burns up the trees of the afflictions. Thus it is called the Brilliant.

original: sa lnga pa ni shin tu sbyong dka' ba ste /
analyzed: sa lnga pa ni shin tu sbyong dka' ba ste /
translated: The fifth stage is the Hard to Conquer.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ting nge 'dzin las kyang mi nyams la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ting nge 'dzin las kyang mi nyams la /
translated: The perfection of meditation is complete, so there is no loss of the concentration of nonconceptual intuition.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa yang rgyun mi gcod la /
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa yang rgyun mi gcod la /
translated: And the benefit of sentient beings is uninterrupted.

original: gnyi ga mgo mnyam du spyod pa de shin tu dka' bas sbyang dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga mgo mnyam du spyod pa de shin tu dka' bas sbyang dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is very difficult to practice both equally, it is called difficult to master.

original: sa drug pa ni mngon du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sa drug pa ni mngon du gyur pa ste /
translated: The sixth stage is the manifest,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa'i don mngon du rtogs pas mngon du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa'i don mngon du rtogs pas mngon du gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because the perfection of wisdom is complete, and one realizes the meaning of dependent origination as free from origination and cessation.

original: sa bdun pa ni ring du song ba ste /
analyzed: sa bdun pa ni ring du song ba ste /
translated: The seventh stage is the far-reaching,

original: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas 'bad pa dang rtsol bas 'jug pa'i mtshan ma'i mthar phyin cing mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas 'bad pa dang rtsol bas 'jug pa'i mtshan ma'i mthar phyin cing mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir ring du song ba zhes bya'o //
translated: because the perfection of means is complete, one reaches the end of the sign of engagement through effort and striving, and one is free from signs.

original: sa brgyad pa ni mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa ni mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: The eighth stage is the immovable,üîΩbecause the perfection of direct intuition is complete, and one is not moved by the gross or subtle signs of effort.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub ste /
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub ste /
translated: Since the perfection of power is complete, the signless is spontaneously accomplished.

original: ye shes kyi stobs kyis mtshan ma zil gyis gnon te cung zad kyang mi 'byung bas na sa mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi stobs kyis mtshan ma zil gyis gnon te cung zad kyang mi 'byung bas na sa mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the power of gnosis overwhelms signs, not even the slightest sign arises. Therefore, this ground is called ‚ÄúImmovable.‚Äù

original: sa dgu pa ni legs pa'i blo gros te /
analyzed: sa dgu pa ni legs pa'i blo gros te /
translated: The ninth ground is called ‚ÄúExcellent Intelligence.‚Äù

original: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas chos so sor rig pa dang / don so sor rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so sor rig pa dang / spob pa so sor @247a * //üîΩrig pa ste /
analyzed: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas chos so sor rig pa dang / don so sor rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so sor rig pa dang / spob pa so sor @247a * // rig pa ste /
translated: Since the perfection of aspiration is complete, one possesses the four correct knowledges: correct knowledge of phenomena, correct knowledge of meaning, correct knowledge of expression, and correct knowledge of confidence.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ldan pas chos kyi mkhan po chen por gyur pa'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang ldan pas chos kyi mkhan po chen por gyur pa'i phyir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one becomes a great master of the Dharma, it is called ‚ÄúExcellent Intelligence.‚Äù

original: sa bcu pa ni chos kyi sprin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa bcu pa ni chos kyi sprin zhes bya ste /
translated: The tenth ground is called ‚ÄúCloud of Dharma.‚Äù

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas dper na sprin chen po las char bab na dgon pa las yang lo thog 'khrungs pa dang 'dra bar ye shes dang thugs rje sprin lta bus sems can gyi sems dgon dung lta bu la chos kyi char pa
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs pas dper na sprin chen po las char bab na dgon pa las yang lo thog 'khrungs pa dang 'dra bar ye shes dang thugs rje sprin lta bus sems can gyi sems dgon dung lta bu la chos kyi char pa
translated: The perfection of wisdom is complete, and just as when rain falls from a great cloud, crops grow in the fields, in the same way, the cloud-like wisdom and compassion of the buddhas cause the rain of Dharma to fall on the fields of sentient beings' minds and

original: phab nas lo tog dge ba 'khrungs shing 'phel bas na chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phab nas lo tog dge ba 'khrungs shing 'phel bas na chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o //
translated: the crops of virtue grow and increase.üîΩWhat are the eighteen kinds of emptiness?

original: stong pa bco brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la ni tha dad du dbyer mi rung ste /
analyzed: stong pa bco brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la ni tha dad du dbyer mi rung ste /
translated: Emptiness cannot be differentiated,

original: du mar bgrang du med mod kyi sems can rnams kyis dngos po yod par brtags pa'i yul tha dad pa rnams la dngos po med par bstan pa'i sgo nas stong pa'i rnam grangs kyang bco brgyad du phye'o //
analyzed: du mar bgrang du med mod kyi sems can rnams kyis dngos po yod par brtags pa'i yul tha dad pa rnams la dngos po med par bstan pa'i sgo nas stong pa'i rnam grangs kyang bco brgyad du phye'o //
translated: but in order to demonstrate the nonexistence of the various objects that sentient beings conceive of as existent, eighteen kinds of emptiness are distinguished.

original: de la nang stong pa nyid ni mig ces bya ba nas yid ces bya ba'i bar dag ste /
analyzed: de la nang stong pa nyid ni mig ces bya ba nas yid ces bya ba'i bar dag ste /
translated: The emptiness of the internal refers to the eyes and so on up to the mind.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug dang de'i rten lus kyi phung po lnga dag ni nang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po drug dang de'i rten lus kyi phung po lnga dag ni nang zhes bya ste /
translated: The six sense faculties such as the eyes and the five aggregates that are their basis are called ‚Äúinternal.‚Äù

original: de dag la chos dang gang zag ces bya ba ni rtag pa ther zug du gnas pa'i dngos po rdul tsam yang med pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la chos dang gang zag ces bya ba ni rtag pa ther zug du gnas pa'i dngos po rdul tsam yang med pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since there is not even an atom of a thing that is permanent and enduring, they are called ‚Äúinternal emptiness.‚Äù

original: de ltar chos gang zag gi dngos po med pa stong pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa yin par gzhan kun la yang bsgre zhing go bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos gang zag gi dngos po med pa stong pa zhes bya ba ni don dam pa yin par gzhan kun la yang bsgre zhing go bar bya'o //
translated: The absence of an entity of phenomena and persons is called ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù This should be applied to and understood in all the other [emptinesses].

original: phyi stong pa nyid ni gzugs zhes bya ba nas chos zhes bya ba'i bar du yul drug ste /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid ni gzugs zhes bya ba nas chos zhes bya ba'i bar du yul drug ste /
translated: External emptiness refers to the six objects, from form to phenomena.

original: rnam par shes pas ma zin pa blun po'i rang bzhin bems po'i rtsi shing dang nags tshal la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i yul rnams ni phyi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas ma zin pa blun po'i rang bzhin bems po'i rtsi shing dang nags tshal la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa'i yul rnams ni phyi zhes bya ste /
translated: The inanimate, stupid nature of things not conjoined with consciousness, such as plants and forests, the four great elements, and the objects of the sense faculties and consciousness, are called ‚Äúexternal.‚Äù

original: de dag la yang dngos po med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag la yang dngos po med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It should be applied that ‚Äúthere is no entity there.‚Äù

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni skye mched bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni skye mched bcu gnyis te /
translated: The emptiness of the external and the internal refers to the twelve sense spheres.

original: la la dag 'di snyam du nang dang phyi gnyis la ni dngos po med par bstan na /
analyzed: la la dag 'di snyam du nang dang phyi gnyis la ni dngos po med par bstan na /
translated: Some people may think, ‚ÄúThe nonexistence of things in the external and the internal has been taught.üîΩHowever, there is something that is the general combination of the external and the internal.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang phyi nang gnyis ka 'dus pa'i spyi la ni dngos po zhig yod do snyam du sems na yang dbang po drug dang yul drug de la dmigs shing brten pa rnam par shes pa drug tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi nang gnyis ka 'dus pa'i spyi la ni dngos po zhig yod do snyam du sems na yang dbang po drug dang yul drug de la dmigs shing brten pa rnam par shes pa drug tsam du zad de /
translated: However, there are only the six sense faculties, the six objects, and the six consciousnesses that observe and depend on them.

original: de dag la yang dngos po med do ba'i don @247b to //
analyzed: de dag la yang dngos po med do ba'i don @247b to //
translated: There is no thing in them.

original: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of emptiness refers to the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: la la dag 'di snyam du phyi dang nang dang / phyi nang gsum gyis bsdus pa'i chos thams cad ni dngos po med de stong par bstan na /
analyzed: la la dag 'di snyam du phyi dang nang dang / phyi nang gsum gyis bsdus pa'i chos thams cad ni dngos po med de stong par bstan na /
translated: Some people may think, ‚ÄúThe nonexistence of things in the external, the internal, and the external and the internal has been taught.

original: 'on kyang chos de dag thams cad stong pa'o zhes tshig tu ming btags pas stong pa zhes bya ba de nyid dngos po zhig tu yod do snyam du sems na yang stong pa'i dngos po ltag la yod de med ces pas na stong pa nyid stong pa nyid
analyzed: 'on kyang chos de dag thams cad stong pa'o zhes tshig tu ming btags pas stong pa zhes bya ba de nyid dngos po zhig tu yod do snyam du sems na yang stong pa'i dngos po ltag la yod de med ces pas na stong pa nyid stong pa nyid
translated: However, if you think that all those phenomena are empty, and that emptiness is a thing that exists, then there is an emptiness of emptiness.

original: ces bya'o // chen po stong pa nyid ni phyogs bcu ste /
analyzed: ces bya'o // chen po stong pa nyid ni phyogs bcu ste /
translated: Emptiness of the great means the ten directions.

original: lho byang shar nub kyi phyogs ji snyed pa thams cad kyi snod kyi 'jig rten gsum dang bcud kyi 'jig rten rgyud lngar skyes pa mang zhing rgya che ba de dag la dngos po yod par sems na yang de la yang dngos po med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lho byang shar nub kyi phyogs ji snyed pa thams cad kyi snod kyi 'jig rten gsum dang bcud kyi 'jig rten rgyud lngar skyes pa mang zhing rgya che ba de dag la dngos po yod par sems na yang de la yang dngos po med do zhes bya'o //
translated: If you think that the many vast worlds of the three worlds of the environment and the five types of beings of the inhabitants in all the directions of south, north, east, and west are things, then they are also said to be nonthings.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid ni mi rtag mi 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid ni mi rtag mi 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Emptiness of the ultimate means the characteristic of impermanence and noncessation.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyang mya ngan las 'das pa ni don dam pa ste de ni rtag pa'i dngos po med pas na mi rtag go //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyang mya ngan las 'das pa ni don dam pa ste de ni rtag pa'i dngos po med pas na mi rtag go //
translated: The dharmadhatu is nirvana, the ultimate, and since it is not a permanent thing, it is impermanent.

original: gtan nas ci yang med pa ma yin pas na mi 'jig ces bya ste /
analyzed: gtan nas ci yang med pa ma yin pas na mi 'jig ces bya ste /
translated: Since it is not absolutely nothing, it is said to be ‚Äúindestructible.‚Äù

original: de la dngos po yod par rtogs na yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la dngos po yod par rtogs na yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one understands that it exists as a thing, it is said that it does not exist.

original: 'dus byas stong pa nyid ni khams gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas stong pa nyid ni khams gsum ste /
translated: The emptiness of the conditioned refers to the three realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams gsum ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams gsum ni 'dus byas so //
translated: The three realms are the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: yang na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid bzhi ste /
translated: Alternatively, the conditioned refers to the four characteristics of the conditioned:

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa dang 'jig pa bzhi la bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa dang 'jig pa bzhi la bya ste /
translated: arising, enduring, changing, and disintegrating.

original: de dag la dngos po yod par rtogs na yang yod pa ma yin te med do zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la dngos po yod par rtogs na yang yod pa ma yin te med do zhes bya ba'o // 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang gnas pa las gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa ste /
translated: If one understands that they exist as things, it is said that they do not exist.üîΩThe emptiness of the unconditioned refers to that which is unborn, unceasing, and not different through transformation.

original: de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang nam mkha' ste /
translated: It is the cessation that is due to the absence of prior conditions, the cessation that is due to the absence of analysis, suchness, and space.

original: chos de bzhi ni rgyu dang rkyen gang gis kyang ma bskyed pas 'dus ma byas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos de bzhi ni rgyu dang rkyen gang gis kyang ma bskyed pas 'dus ma byas zhes bya ste /
translated: These four dharmas are called unconditioned because they are not produced by any cause or condition.

original: de ni 'dus byas kyi chos ltar dang / dang po skye ba dang / tha mar 'gag pa dang / bar du gnas pa'i dus na yang bzang ngan dang che chung du 'gyur ba lta bu med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas kyi chos ltar dang / dang po skye ba dang / tha mar 'gag pa dang / bar du gnas pa'i dus na yang bzang ngan dang che chung du 'gyur ba lta bu med pa ste /
translated: They are not like conditioned dharmas, which, in the time of their first arising, final cessation, and abiding in the interim, change for the better or worse, or increase or decrease.

original: de la dngos po yod snyam na yang dngos po med pa ste stong @248a * //üîΩngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po yod snyam na yang dngos po med pa ste stong @248a * // ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: Even though one thinks that they exist as entities, they are non-entities, or empty.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ni mtha' thams cad dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ni mtha' thams cad dang bral ba ste /
translated: The emptiness of the transcendence of extremes is free from all extremes.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' las 'das pa zhes bya ba de la dngos po yod do zhe'am /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' las 'das pa zhes bya ba de la dngos po yod do zhe'am /
translated: It is called the transcendence of the extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: yang na sngon dang da ltar dang phyi ma'i mtha' la dngos po yod par rtogs na de dag la dngos po med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sngon dang da ltar dang phyi ma'i mtha' la dngos po yod par rtogs na de dag la dngos po med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one understands that entities exist in the extremes of the past, present, and future, then one understands that they do not exist.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ni dus gsum ste /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid ni dus gsum ste /
translated: The emptiness of the absence of beginning and end refers to the three times.

original: de yang 'khor ba'i thog ma zhes bya ba dang tha ma zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de yang 'khor ba'i thog ma zhes bya ba dang tha ma zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Moreover, if one understands that what is called the beginning of samsara or the end of samsara,

original: yang na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus gsum rnams la dngos po zhig yod do bar rtogs na yang /
analyzed: yang na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus gsum rnams la dngos po zhig yod do bar rtogs na yang /
translated: or again the three times, past, future and present, are all existent things,

original: dngos po med pas stong ngo //
analyzed: dngos po med pas stong ngo //
translated: then they are empty because they are non-existent.

original: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad blang bar bya ba dang spang bar bya ba med pa ste dper na bum pa'i nang du chu sngar blugs pa las chu de pho ste bum pa stong par gyur pa dang 'dra bar don dam pa de
analyzed: dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad blang bar bya ba dang spang bar bya ba med pa ste dper na bum pa'i nang du chu sngar blugs pa las chu de pho ste bum pa stong par gyur pa dang 'dra bar don dam pa de
translated: The emptiness of the unrejectable is that all phenomena are neither to be accepted nor rejected. For example, just as when water is poured into a vase and then the water is poured out, the vase becomes empty, so too, in the case of ultimate reality,

original: la yang rdzas kyi dngos po zhig snga na yod yod pa la rdzas de bor te med par gyur nas stong par gyur pa lta bu la mi bya'i /
analyzed: la yang rdzas kyi dngos po zhig snga na yod yod pa la rdzas de bor te med par gyur nas stong par gyur pa lta bu la mi bya'i /
translated: one should not think that it is like a substance that was previously existent and then that substance was lost and became non-existent and so became empty.

original: don dam pa ni thog ma nyid nas stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pas na stong pa nyid la dor ba dang blang ba dang spang ba med pas na 'ga' zhig de la dngos po yod par rtogs na dngos po med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni thog ma nyid nas stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pas na stong pa nyid la dor ba dang blang ba dang spang ba med pas na 'ga' zhig de la dngos po yod par rtogs na dngos po med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since the ultimate has the characteristic of emptiness from the very beginning, emptiness is not something to be rejected, adopted, or abandoned. Therefore, if someone understands that something exists in emptiness, it is said, ‚ÄúIt does not exist.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis stong par ma byas pa'i chos gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis stong par ma byas pa'i chos gang yin pa ste /
translated: The emptiness of nature refers to any phenomenon that is not made empty by hearers, solitary realizers, bodhisattvas, or tathƒÅgatas, whether conditioned or unconditioned phenomena.

original: de yang gzugs nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de yang gzugs nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with form,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad ye nas stong pa nyid kyis khyab ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad ye nas stong pa nyid kyis khyab ste /
translated: all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are primordially pervaded by emptiness.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong par gnas pa de ni nyan thos la sogs pa 'phags pa rnams kyis btsal te stong par ched du byas par gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong par gnas pa de ni nyan thos la sogs pa 'phags pa rnams kyis btsal te stong par ched du byas par gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The fact that they abide as empty by nature is not something that is sought out and deliberately made empty by the noble ones, such as hearers.

original: de ye nas stong pa nyid du gnas pas na rang bzhin stong pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ye nas stong pa nyid du gnas pas na rang bzhin stong pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it has always existed as emptiness, it is called ‚Äúemptiness of nature.‚Äù

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang khams gsum dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams te /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang khams gsum dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams te /
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena refers to the aggregates, elements, sense fields, three realms, conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: de yang phung po la sogs pa phyi nang gi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gnyis las 'dir spyi'i mtshan nyid du chos thams cad mi rtag pa dang @248b sdug bsngal ba dang stod pa dang bdag med pa zhas bya ba de la dngos po med
analyzed: de yang phung po la sogs pa phyi nang gi chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid gnyis las 'dir spyi'i mtshan nyid du chos thams cad mi rtag pa dang @248b sdug bsngal ba dang stod pa dang bdag med pa zhas bya ba de la dngos po med
translated: Here, from among the two types of general and specific characteristics of inner and outer phenomena such as the aggregates, all phenomena are said to be impermanent, suffering, empty, and devoid of self.

original: pa'am / yang na don dam par chos thams cad la ngo bo nyid med pa la 'ga' zhig dngos po yod par rtogs pa de la dngos po med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'am / yang na don dam par chos thams cad la ngo bo nyid med pa la 'ga' zhig dngos po yod par rtogs pa de la dngos po med do zhes bya'o //
translated: In that regard, it is said that ‚Äúthere is no entity‚Äù because some conceive that entities exist ultimately, although all phenomena are devoid of essence.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni gzugs ni 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ni gzugs ni 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba nas /
translated: The emptiness of specific characteristics refers to form having the characteristic of disintegration, and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i bar dag ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i bar dag ste /
translated: and consciousness is characterized by cognition.

original: de la yang sa sra ba dang / chu gsher ba dang / me tsha ba dang / rlung yang ba zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de la yang sa sra ba dang / chu gsher ba dang / me tsha ba dang / rlung yang ba zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: In this regard, earth is characterized by solidity, water by fluidity, fire by heat, wind by motion, and so on up to: omniscience is characterized by direct knowledge.

original: mtshan nyid rnam gnyis las rang gi mtshan nyid de dag la dngos po yod par rtogs na yang de dag gi dngos po med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam gnyis las rang gi mtshan nyid de dag la dngos po yod par rtogs na yang de dag gi dngos po med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Of the two kinds of characteristics, this is the specific characteristic. Even though one understands that these things exist, they are said to be non-existent.

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ni dus gsum gyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ni dus gsum gyi chos rnams te /
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension refers to the phenomena of the three times.

original: de yang phyi nang gi chos rnams 'das pa'i dus dang da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus gang du yang lan 'ga' yang dngos po can du ma gyur te /
analyzed: de yang phyi nang gi chos rnams 'das pa'i dus dang da ltar dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus gang du yang lan 'ga' yang dngos po can du ma gyur te /
translated: Moreover, these outer and inner phenomena are never at any time in the past, present, or future endowed with substantial reality.

original: dngos por nam yang ma dmigs pas na mi dmigs pa stong pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos por nam yang ma dmigs pas na mi dmigs pa stong pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they are never apprehended as substantial, they are said to be empty of non-apprehension.

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te tshig dang po'i don ni
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni chos thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang gnas pa dang 'gag pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te tshig dang po'i don ni
translated: The meaning of the first phrase is

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i chos rnams ji ltar da ltar snang ba bzhin du dngos po yang dag par med pas na /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i chos rnams ji ltar da ltar snang ba bzhin du dngos po yang dag par med pas na /
translated: since phenomena such as form and sound do not exist as things in reality just as they appear to be,

original: dngos po med pa stong pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: they are called the emptiness of non things.

original: tshig gnyis pa ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i chos nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: tshig gnyis pa ni gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i chos nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The second phrase is the reality of phenomena such as form and sound.

original: chos nyid de la dngos po med pas na ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyid de la dngos po med pas na ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that reality is not a thing, it is called the emptiness of the essential nature.

original: tshig gsum pa ni gong du smos pa'i dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang ngo bo nyid med pa'i stong pa gnyis ka gcig tu bsdus pa la dngos po yod do snyam du 'ga' zhig rtogs na /
analyzed: tshig gsum pa ni gong du smos pa'i dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang ngo bo nyid med pa'i stong pa gnyis ka gcig tu bsdus pa la dngos po yod do snyam du 'ga' zhig rtogs na /
translated: The third phrase is the combination of the two, the emptiness of non things and the emptiness of the essential nature mentioned above. If someone thinks that the two are existent things,

original: de gnyis 'dus pa la yang dngos po med pas na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis 'dus pa la yang dngos po med pas na dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since there is no entity in the combination of those two, it is called ‚Äúemptiness that is the non-entityness of phenomena.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩSince all phenomena arise in dependence on many different causes and conditions, they are not entities that are permanent because they arise and cease in every moment.

original: chos thams cad rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dang gzhan tha dad pa mang po gcig la gcig brten te skyes pa ni skad cig re re la skye zhing 'gag pa'i phyir rtag pa'i dngos po yod pa yang ma yin la thams cad nas thams cad du gtan ci yang
analyzed: chos thams cad rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dang gzhan tha dad pa mang po gcig la gcig brten te skyes pa ni skad cig re re la skye zhing 'gag pa'i phyir rtag pa'i dngos po yod pa yang ma yin la thams cad nas thams cad du gtan ci yang
translated: And they are not completely and totally

original: med pa @249a * //üîΩyang ma yin pas na /
analyzed: med pa @249a * // yang ma yin pas na /
translated: nonexistent.

original: chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gnas shing 'gag pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: chos thams cad rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gnas shing 'gag pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause all phenomena abide in and cease dependent origination.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ni sa dang gnyen po'i tshul du gzhag ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ni sa dang gnyen po'i tshul du gzhag ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The factors of enlightenment are presented in the manner of levels and antidotes.

original: byang chub ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang bla na med pa'i byang chub rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang bla na med pa'i byang chub rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Enlightenment is of three types: the enlightenment of ≈õrƒÅvakas, the enlightenment of pratyekabuddhas, and unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes thob pa la bya'o //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes thob pa la bya'o //
translated: This refers to the attainment of the gnosis of exhaustion and non-arising.

original: de'i phyogs kyi chos ni de thob par bya ba rgyu dang thabs lta bu grogs su gyur pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyogs kyi chos ni de thob par bya ba rgyu dang thabs lta bu grogs su gyur pa la bya ste /
translated: The qualities that pertain to that are the causes and means for attaining that, which are like friends.

original: dngos po 'og nas 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: dngos po 'og nas 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: The entities are those that will be explained below.

original: sa ni rgyun du zhugs pa nas sa dang po la sogs pa sa bcu dag go //
analyzed: sa ni rgyun du zhugs pa nas sa dang po la sogs pa sa bcu dag go //
translated: The levels are from the level of stream-entry up to the ten levels.

original: gnyen po ni sa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa bzlog cing spong ba ste /
analyzed: gnyen po ni sa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna la sogs pa bzlog cing spong ba ste /
translated: The antidotes are the relinquishment and abandonment of stinginess and so on, which are the factors incompatible with those levels.

original: dgra dang dgra zla lta bu'i tshul la gzhag pa'i don to //
analyzed: dgra dang dgra zla lta bu'i tshul la gzhag pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are like enemies and their opponents.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ste /
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness are the establishment of mindfulness of the body, the establishment of mindfulness of feelings, the establishment of mindfulness of mind, and the establishment of mindfulness of phenomena.

original: de la dran pa ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa ni shes rab ste /
translated: Here, mindfulness is wisdom.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin ma nor bar shes pas lhag mthong dang sbyar zhing /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin ma nor bar shes pas lhag mthong dang sbyar zhing /
translated: By knowing the characteristics of phenomena just as they are, without error, it is applied to profound insight.

original: nye bar gzhag pa ni ji ltar shes rab kyis dpyad pa de nyid rtse gcig tu gzhog pas zhi gnas dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: nye bar gzhag pa ni ji ltar shes rab kyis dpyad pa de nyid rtse gcig tu gzhog pas zhi gnas dang sbyar ro //
translated: One should apply serenity to the very same investigation with wisdom, by settling the mind one-pointedly.

original: lus ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: lus ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The body is threefold:

original: nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gsum mo //
analyzed: nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gsum mo //
translated: internal, external, and both internal and external.

original: de la nang gi lus ni bdag rang gi lus so //
analyzed: de la nang gi lus ni bdag rang gi lus so //
translated: Among them, the internal body is one's own body.

original: phyi ni rnam par shes pas ma zin pa rtsi shing la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: phyi ni rnam par shes pas ma zin pa rtsi shing la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The external is the inanimate world, not conjoined with consciousness.

original: phyi nang gi lus ni bdag las ni phyi /üîΩrtsi shing sems med pa las nang ste /üîΩsems can gzhan gyi lus so //
analyzed: phyi nang gi lus ni bdag las ni phyi / rtsi shing sems med pa las nang ste / sems can gzhan gyi lus so //
translated: The internal-external body is the body of another person.üîΩFrom among those, the internal body is the internal because it is one's own body, and it is the external because it is inanimate.

original: de dag las nang gi lus la rang gi mtshan nyid 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa gzhig cing gzhom du rung ba dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba nas /
analyzed: de dag las nang gi lus la rang gi mtshan nyid 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa gzhig cing gzhom du rung ba dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba nas /
translated: The internal body has the general characteristic of impermanence and the characteristic of suffering, and so on, and the specific characteristic of being the elements and those derived from the elements, which can be destroyed and defeated.

original: spyi bo man chad rkang pa yan chad rnag dang chu ser dang bad kan la sogs pa mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid du brtags te /
analyzed: spyi bo man chad rkang pa yan chad rnag dang chu ser dang bad kan la sogs pa mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid du brtags te /
translated: From the crown of the head down to the feet, the body is examined as having the characteristics of various impurities such as pus, lymph, phlegm, and so forth.

original: phyi nang gi lus kyang de dang mthun phyi'i lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni rdul phra mo dum 'dus pa yin la /
analyzed: phyi nang gi lus kyang de dang mthun phyi'i lus kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni rdul phra mo dum 'dus pa yin la /
translated: The outer and inner body are also similar to that. The specific characteristic of the outer body is that it is a collection of minute particles.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gong ma dang 'dra bar shes rab kyis gtan la phab na rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni lus dran pa nye bar 'jog pa zhes bya'o //üîΩtshor ba ni nang gi lus la dmigs nas tshor ba rnam pa gsum byung ba ni nang gi @249b tshor ba zhes bya /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gong ma dang 'dra bar shes rab kyis gtan la phab na rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni lus dran pa nye bar 'jog pa zhes bya'o // tshor ba ni nang gi lus la dmigs nas tshor ba rnam pa gsum byung ba ni nang gi @249b tshor ba zhes bya /
translated: The general characteristic is that it is like the above. When one ascertains that with wisdom, to rest one-pointedly is called ‚Äúthe application of mindfulness to the body.‚ÄùüîΩAs for feelings, when the three types of feelings arise in dependence on the inner body, they are called ‚Äúinner feelings.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du phyi'i lus la dmigs nas byung ba phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi lus la dmigs nas byung ba phyi nang gi tshor ba zhes rnam pa gsum du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi'i lus la dmigs nas byung ba phyi'i tshor ba dang / phyi nang gi lus la dmigs nas byung ba phyi nang gi tshor ba zhes rnam pa gsum du sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, when they arise in dependence on the outer body, they are called ‚Äúouter feelings,‚Äù and when they arise in dependence on the outer and inner body, they are called ‚Äúouter and inner feelings.‚Äù

original: de yang lus dang sems la sim par byed pa ni tshor ba bde ba'o //
analyzed: de yang lus dang sems la sim par byed pa ni tshor ba bde ba'o //
translated: That which refreshes the body and mind is the feeling of pleasure.

original: lus dang sems la gdung bar byed pa ni tshor ba sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: lus dang sems la gdung bar byed pa ni tshor ba sdug bsngal lo //
translated: That which torments the body and mind is the feeling of pain.üîΩThat which neither torments nor refreshes is the feeling of indifference.

original: gdung ba dang sim pa gnyis kar mi byed pa ni tshor ba btang snyoms te de dag kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gong ma dag dang 'dra la /
analyzed: gdung ba dang sim pa gnyis kar mi byed pa ni tshor ba btang snyoms te de dag kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid ni gong ma dag dang 'dra la /
translated: Their general characteristics are the same as above.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni tshor ba gsum char yang sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni tshor ba gsum char yang sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Their individual characteristics are as follows: All three feelings have the characteristic of suffering.

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal la ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab /
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal la ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab /
translated: The feeling of pain is pervaded by the suffering of pain.

original: tshor ba bde ba la ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis khyab /
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba la ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis khyab /
translated: The feeling of pleasure is pervaded by the suffering of change.üîΩThe feeling of indifference is pervaded by the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: tshor ba btang snyoms la ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab po zhes pa rtags shing rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba btang snyoms la ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab po zhes pa rtags shing rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni tshor ba dran pa nye bar 'jog pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the one-pointed focus on the sign of this is the close placement of mindfulness of feeling.

original: sems ni nyi shu ste 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems nas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / bsdus pa'i dang /üîΩrnam par g-yeng ba'i dang / zhum pa'i dang / gzeng mthos pa'i dang / rgod pa'i dang / rgod pa med pa'i dang / zhi ba'i dang / ma zhi ba'i dang / shin tu mnyam par bzhag pa'i dang / shin tu mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dang /
analyzed: sems ni nyi shu ste 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems nas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / bsdus pa'i dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i dang / zhum pa'i dang / gzeng mthos pa'i dang / rgod pa'i dang / rgod pa med pa'i dang / zhi ba'i dang / ma zhi ba'i dang / shin tu mnyam par bzhag pa'i dang / shin tu mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dang /
translated: The mind is twenty, from a mind with attachment to a mind free from attachment, a mind with anger to a mind free from anger, a mind with delusion to a mind free from delusion, a mind with obscurations to a mind without obscurations, a distracted mind to an undistracted mind, a depressed mind to an elated mind, an agitated mind to a non-agitated mind, a pacified mind to an unpacified mind, a well-equipoised mind to a poorly-equipoised mind,

original: lam shin tu bsgoms pa'i dang / lam shin tu ma bsgoms pa'i dang / lam shin tu bsgoms pa las grol ba dang / lam shin tu bsgoms pa las grol ba ma yin pa'i sems te nyi shu'o //
analyzed: lam shin tu bsgoms pa'i dang / lam shin tu ma bsgoms pa'i dang / lam shin tu bsgoms pa las grol ba dang / lam shin tu bsgoms pa las grol ba ma yin pa'i sems te nyi shu'o //
translated: a mind that is a well-cultivated path to a mind that is a poorly-cultivated path, a mind that is liberated from a well-cultivated path to a mind that is not liberated from a well-cultivated path.

original: de dag kyang bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag kyang bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those are also subsumed in two types:

original: dpyod pa'i dus kyi sems dang / gnas pa'i dus kyi sems so //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i dus kyi sems dang / gnas pa'i dus kyi sems so //
translated: a mind at the time of analysis and a mind at the time of abiding.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bcas pa nas /üîΩgti mug dang bral ba'i bar du sems drug ni dpyod pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bcas pa nas / gti mug dang bral ba'i bar du sems drug ni dpyod pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The six thoughts from the one associated with passion up to the one free from delusion are called the thought of investigation.

original: bsdus pa'i sems man chad ni gnas pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i sems man chad ni gnas pa'i sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The thought of gathering and the following thoughts are called the thought of abiding.

original: de la dpyod pa ni las su byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la dpyod pa ni las su byed pa'o //
translated: Here, investigation is the activity.

original: gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin du 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin du 'jog pa'o //
translated: Abiding is the placement in meditative concentration.

original: sems de dag kyang phyi nang rnam pa gsum du sbyar te /
analyzed: sems de dag kyang phyi nang rnam pa gsum du sbyar te /
translated: These thoughts are also applied in three ways: internal, external, and both internal and external.

original: nang gi lus la dmigs pa'i sgo nas sems nyi shu byung ba ni nang gi sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi lus la dmigs pa'i sgo nas sems nyi shu byung ba ni nang gi sems zhes bya'o //
translated: The twenty thoughts that arise from the perspective of observing the internal body are called the internal thoughts.

original: de bzhin du phyi'i lus dang / phyi nang gi lus la dmigs pa'i sems rnam pa gsum po @250a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi'i lus dang / phyi nang gi lus la dmigs pa'i sems rnam pa gsum po @250a * //
translated: Similarly, the three types of thoughts that observe the external body and the internal and external body

original: thams cad kyang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'o zhes rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
