analyzed: thams cad kyang mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa'o zhes rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are all placed one-pointedly in the understanding that they are impermanent, painful, empty, and devoid of self. This is called the application of mindfulness to the thought.

original: chos ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos te de yang gong ma'i sems nyi shu po de dag nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang ldan pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos te de yang gong ma'i sems nyi shu po de dag nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang ldan pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Dharma refers to defiled and purified phenomena. The above twenty minds that are associated with the passions and secondary passions are called defiled.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag spong ba'i gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang byams pa dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni rnam par byang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag spong ba'i gnyen po mi gtsang ba dang byams pa dang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni rnam par byang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Those that are associated with the antidotes that eliminate those passions, such as impurity, loving-kindness, and dependent origination, are called purified.

original: chos de dag la stong pa dang bdag med par rtogs shing bsgom pa ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhe bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag la stong pa dang bdag med par rtogs shing bsgom pa ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhe bya'o //
translated: The realization and cultivation of those phenomena as empty and selfless is called the application of mindfulness to phenomena.üîΩBy cultivating those, one eliminates the four errors.

original: de dag bsgoms pas phyin ci log bzhi spong ste de yang lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi gtsang bar bsgoms pas gtsang bar lta ba spangs so //
analyzed: de dag bsgoms pas phyin ci log bzhi spong ste de yang lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi gtsang bar bsgoms pas gtsang bar lta ba spangs so //
translated: The application of mindfulness to the body, cultivated as impure, eliminates the view of purity.

original: tshor ba dran ba nye bar gzhag pa sdug bsngal bar bsgoms pas bde bar lta ba spangs so //
analyzed: tshor ba dran ba nye bar gzhag pa sdug bsngal bar bsgoms pas bde bar lta ba spangs so //
translated: By cultivating mindfulness of feeling as suffering, the view of pleasure is abandoned.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi rtag par bsgoms pas rtag par lta ba spangs so //
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi rtag par bsgoms pas rtag par lta ba spangs so //
translated: By cultivating mindfulness of mind as impermanent, the view of permanence is abandoned.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bdag med par bsgoms pas bdag yod par lta ba spangs so//
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bdag med par bsgoms pas bdag yod par lta ba spangs so//
translated: By cultivating mindfulness of phenomena as selfless, the view of self is abandoned.

original: bden pa bzhi bsgoms shing rtogs pa yang de dag nyid yin te sdug bsngal bden pa dang kun 'byung bden pa dang 'gog pa bden pa dang lam bden pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi bsgoms shing rtogs pa yang de dag nyid yin te sdug bsngal bden pa dang kun 'byung bden pa dang 'gog pa bden pa dang lam bden pa ste /
translated: The four truths are also cultivated and realized: the truth of suffering, the truth of origin, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path.

original: de bzhi dang go rims bzhin du re re sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhi dang go rims bzhin du re re sbyar ro //
translated: Each of these four is to be applied in order.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //
translated: The four right efforts are: generating aspiration in order not to generate non-virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spong ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spong ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //
translated: Generating aspiration in order to abandon non-virtuous dharmas that have arisen.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //
translated: He generates will for the production of virtuous qualities that have not yet arisen.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //
translated: He generates will for the endurance, continued existence, multiplication, and non-destruction of virtuous qualities that have already arisen.

original: gong du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs su chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la /
analyzed: gong du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i skabs su chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsgom pa na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la /
translated: In the context of the establishment of mindfulness, when one cultivates the establishment of mindfulness of dharmas, one realizes that defiled dharmas are adverse and

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos ni gnyen po yin par rtogs nas mi mthun pa spong zhing @250b gnyen po skyed par byed pa'i brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin rnam pa bzhin rnam pa bzhi 'byung ba ni yang dag par spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos ni gnyen po yin par rtogs nas mi mthun pa spong zhing @250b gnyen po skyed par byed pa'i brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin rnam pa bzhin rnam pa bzhi 'byung ba ni yang dag par spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: that purifying dharmas are remedial. Then, the four kinds of effort that are by nature the abandonment of the adverse and the production of the remedial occur. This is called right effort.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lus kyi las gsum dang ngag gi bzhi dang yid kyi gsum ste mi dge ba bcu dang / de dag skyed pa'i rgyu 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan la gnod cing rnam par smin pa yang sdug bsngal chen po bskyed pas na sdig pa zhes bya /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lus kyi las gsum dang ngag gi bzhi dang yid kyi gsum ste mi dge ba bcu dang / de dag skyed pa'i rgyu 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan la gnod cing rnam par smin pa yang sdug bsngal chen po bskyed pas na sdig pa zhes bya /
translated: The causes that give rise to them, attachment, aversion and so forth, are called negative actions because they harm both oneself and others and their fully ripened effect is the generation of great suffering.

original: dge ba dang mi mthun zhing 'phags pa rnams kyis smad pa yin pas na mi dge ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi mthun zhing 'phags pa rnams kyis smad pa yin pas na mi dge ba zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called nonvirtues because they are incompatible with virtue and are despised by the noble ones.

original: yul de dag la dmigs shing spyad pa'i sgo nas sems kyi rgyud la bag chags bsags pa ni skyes pa zhes bya /
analyzed: yul de dag la dmigs shing spyad pa'i sgo nas sems kyi rgyud la bag chags bsags pa ni skyes pa zhes bya /
translated: The accumulation of habitual tendencies in the mindstream through the practice of focusing on these objects is called the production of nonvirtue.

original: bag chags ma bsags pa ni ma skyes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bag chags ma bsags pa ni ma skyes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The nonaccumulation of habitual tendencies is called the nonproduction of nonvirtue.

original: chos de dag sems la da ltar yang ma bskyed la phyis kyang mi 'byung bar bya'o snyam du sems pa dang / chos de dag sngar sems la skyes pa rnams ni ci nas kyang rgyun gcad cing mngon du mi 'byung par spong ngo snyam du sems pa de ni 'dun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag sems la da ltar yang ma bskyed la phyis kyang mi 'byung bar bya'o snyam du sems pa dang / chos de dag sngar sems la skyes pa rnams ni ci nas kyang rgyun gcad cing mngon du mi 'byung par spong ngo snyam du sems pa de ni 'dun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The intention to not generate in the mind those dharmas that have not yet arisen, and the intention I will not let them arise in the future, and the intention I will completely cut off the stream of those dharmas that have arisen in the mind, and I will abandon them so that they do not manifest, is called will.

original: dge ba'i chos ni gong ma las bzlog pa ste dge ba bcu dang 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ni gong ma las bzlog pa ste dge ba bcu dang 'dod ma chags pa dang / zhe mi sdang ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Virtuous dharmas are the opposite of the above. They are the ten virtues, non-greed, non-hatred, and so on.

original: de dag ci'i phyir spong ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ci'i phyir spong ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called abandonments?

original: dge ba'i chos de rnams kyis kyang mi mthun pa'i chos rnams spong ba'i phyir yang dag par spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de rnams kyis kyang mi mthun pa'i chos rnams spong ba'i phyir yang dag par spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because those virtuous dharmas abandon the discordant dharmas, they are called right abandonments.

original: chos de dag sems kyi rgyud la snga na med pa las de bskyed cing mngon sum du bsgrub po snyam du sems pa dang snga na sems kyi rgyud la cung zad yod pa yang 'phel zhing rgyas par bya'o snyam du sems pa ste /
analyzed: chos de dag sems kyi rgyud la snga na med pa las de bskyed cing mngon sum du bsgrub po snyam du sems pa dang snga na sems kyi rgyud la cung zad yod pa yang 'phel zhing rgyas par bya'o snyam du sems pa ste /
translated: One thinks that those dharmas which did not exist in the mind-stream are generated and realized by direct realization. One thinks that those which existed in the mind-stream in a small way are increased and expanded.

original: de dag snga na yod pa las mi 'bri ba ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag snga na yod pa las mi 'bri ba ni gnas pa'o //
translated: Their non-decrease from what existed previously is stability.

original: yang nas yang du mngon sum du bsgrubs pas shas je che je cher 'phel ba ni phyir zhing 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang nas yang du mngon sum du bsgrubs pas shas je che je cher 'phel ba ni phyir zhing 'byung ba'o //
translated: Their increase more and more by repeated direct realization is repeated occurrence.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs sdig pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba ni nyams par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs sdig pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba ni nyams par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Their non-decrease under the influence of the opposing side, evil, is non-deterioration.

original: mi dge ba spang zhing dge ba bskyed pa de myur du mthar phyin par byed pa ni yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba spang zhing dge ba bskyed pa de myur du mthar phyin par byed pa ni yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The completion of that abandonment of non-virtue and generation of virtue is thorough completion.

original: de ltar de dag gi phyir 'di dang 'di bya'o snyam pa'i sbyor ba'i sems ni 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi phyir 'di dang 'di bya'o snyam pa'i sbyor ba'i sems ni 'dun pa ste /
translated: Thus, the mind of application which thinks, ‚ÄúFor that purpose, this and this should be done,‚Äù is aspiration.

original: brtson 'grus bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It has the characteristic of generating effort.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems @251a * //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems @251a * //
translated: the basis of supernormal power that is the concentration of aspiration and possesses the requisite of abandoning,üîΩthe basis of supernormal power that is the concentration of mind and possesses the requisite of abandoning,üîΩthe basis of supernormal power that is the concentration of perseverance and possesses the requisite of abandoning,

original: kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste /
analyzed: kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste /
translated: and the basis of supernormal power that is the concentration of investigation and possesses the requisite of abandoning.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul ni rdzu 'phrul dang / rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa ste mngon par shes pa lnga la bya /üîΩrkang pa bzhi ni de thob par byed pa'i rgyu la bya ste /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul ni rdzu 'phrul dang / rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba shes pa ste mngon par shes pa lnga la bya / rkang pa bzhi ni de thob par byed pa'i rgyu la bya ste /
translated: Supernormal power means the five higher perceptions: supernormal power, divine ear, knowledge of others' minds, knowledge of past lives and knowledge of death and rebirth.üîΩThe four bases are the causes for attaining those.

original: dkyus kyi ting nge 'dzin bzhi dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dkyus kyi ting nge 'dzin bzhi dang sbyar ro //
translated: They are applied to the four concentrations in the root text.

original: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin du 'jog pa la lhag par dga' zhing mos pa'i dbang gis rtag tu ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'i sgo nas sems rtse gcig thob pa ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin du 'jog pa la lhag par dga' zhing mos pa'i dbang gis rtag tu ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'i sgo nas sems rtse gcig thob pa ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: The concentration of aspiration is the one-pointed mind that is always engaged in concentration through the power of delighting in and aspiring to rest in the concentration of the mind.

original: de yang bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu mtho ris dang thar ba'i yon tan dag la 'dod pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu mtho ris dang thar ba'i yon tan dag la 'dod pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is by nature the desire for the qualities of higher rebirth and liberation that are the results of meditative stabilization.

original: ting nge 'dzin de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrib pa lnga yod de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrib pa lnga yod de /
translated: There are five hindrances that are counter-productive to that concentration.

original: de yang le lo dang dmigs pa brjed pa dang / zhum rgod dang 'du mi byed pa dang 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang le lo dang dmigs pa brjed pa dang / zhum rgod dang 'du mi byed pa dang 'du byed pa'o //
translated: They are laziness, forgetting the object of meditation, discouragement and wildness, non-application and application.

original: de la le lo ni dge ba la mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de la le lo ni dge ba la mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: Laziness is not engaging in virtue.

original: dang po nyan pa dang sems pa la sbyor ba'i dus na bsgribs pa'i phyir nyes pa'o //
analyzed: dang po nyan pa dang sems pa la sbyor ba'i dus na bsgribs pa'i phyir nyes pa'o //
translated: It is a fault because it obscures the time of application to listening and reflection at the beginning.

original: dmigs pa brjed pa ni bsam gtan gyi man ngag mi dran pas bsgom pa'i yul gang yin gtol med de /
analyzed: dmigs pa brjed pa ni bsam gtan gyi man ngag mi dran pas bsgom pa'i yul gang yin gtol med de /
translated: Forgetting the object of meditation is not knowing the object of meditation because one does not remember the oral instructions of meditative stabilization.

original: bsam gtan la sbyor ba'i dus na rmongs pa'i phyir nyes pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la sbyor ba'i dus na rmongs pa'i phyir nyes pa'o //
translated: It is a fault when one is preparing for meditative concentration, because one is confused.

original: zhum rgod ni bsgom pa'i yul la rmugs shing g-yengs te bsam gtan la zhugs pa'i dus na las su mi rung bas nyes pa'o //
analyzed: zhum rgod ni bsgom pa'i yul la rmugs shing g-yengs te bsam gtan la zhugs pa'i dus na las su mi rung bas nyes pa'o //
translated: Laziness and excitability are faults when one has entered meditative concentration, because they make the mind unfit for action, since they make it sluggish and distracted with regard to the object of meditation.

original: 'du mi byed pa ni zhum rgod byung na de spong zhing zhi gnas su mi glon pas na nyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'du mi byed pa ni zhum rgod byung na de spong zhing zhi gnas su mi glon pas na nyes pa'o //
translated: Non-exertion is a fault when one has entered meditative concentration, because one does not apply the antidote to laziness and excitability, and so one does not achieve serenity.

original: 'du byed drags pa ni sems mnyam par gnas pa'i dus na de las bskyod cing g-yeng bar byed pas nyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed drags pa ni sems mnyam par gnas pa'i dus na de las bskyod cing g-yeng bar byed pas nyes pa ste /
translated: Exertion is a fault when the mind is in equipoise, because it disturbs the mind and causes it to become distracted.

original: de lnga ni spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de lnga ni spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: These five are to be abandoned.

original: de spong ba'i 'du byed ni brgyad de mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms rnams so //
analyzed: de spong ba'i 'du byed ni brgyad de mos pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms rnams so //
translated: There are eight applications for abandoning them: will, striving, faith, pliancy, mindfulness, vigilance, intention, and equanimity.

original: de dag gi nyes pa ji ltar spong zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi nyes pa ji ltar spong zhe na /
translated: How do they abandon those faults?

original: 'du byed bzhis ni le lo spong ste ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'du byed bzhis ni le lo spong ste ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Four applications abandon laziness. How is that?

original: brtson 'grus kyi gnas dang @251b rten dang mtshan ma dang 'bras bu bstan pa'i sgo nas spong ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi gnas dang @251b rten dang mtshan ma dang 'bras bu bstan pa'i sgo nas spong ste /
translated: It is abandoned by teaching the basis, support, sign and result of effort.

original: de yang mos pa yod na brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir mos pa ni brtson 'grus kyi gnas so //
analyzed: de yang mos pa yod na brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir mos pa ni brtson 'grus kyi gnas so //
translated: Moreover, since effort is undertaken when there is will, will is the basis of effort.

original: brtson 'grus nyid ni rten no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus nyid ni rten no //
translated: Effort itself is the support.

original: mos pa skye ba'i rgyu ni dad pa ste dad pa yod na mos pa 'byung bas mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: mos pa skye ba'i rgyu ni dad pa ste dad pa yod na mos pa 'byung bas mtshan ma ste /
translated: Faith is the cause of the generation of will, since will occurs when there is faith. Thus, faith is the sign of effort.

original: mtshan ma dang rgyu ni don gcig go //üîΩbrtson 'grus brtsams na lus dang sems las su rung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa ste de ni brtson 'grus kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang rgyu ni don gcig go // brtson 'grus brtsams na lus dang sems las su rung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir shin tu sbyangs pa ste de ni brtson 'grus kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: Sign and cause are synonymous.üîΩSince pliancy is the fitness of body and mind when effort is undertaken, it is the result of effort.

original: de ltar lus dang sems las su rung zhing brtson 'grus kyi dbang thob na le lo'i gnas med pas de'i phyir 'du byed snga ma bzhi ni le lo'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lus dang sems las su rung zhing brtson 'grus kyi dbang thob na le lo'i gnas med pas de'i phyir 'du byed snga ma bzhi ni le lo'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: Thus, when body and mind are fit and one has attained mastery of effort, there is no basis for laziness. Therefore, the first four formative forces are the counteragents to laziness.

original: nyes pa lhag ma bzhi'i gnyen po ni 'du byed bzhi re re dang rim bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: nyes pa lhag ma bzhi'i gnyen po ni 'du byed bzhi re re dang rim bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The four applications are the antidotes to the four remaining faults.

original: dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po ni dran pa'o //üîΩzhum rgod byung na gang byung ba rtogs par byed pas /
analyzed: dmigs pa brjed pa'i gnyen po ni dran pa'o // zhum rgod byung na gang byung ba rtogs par byed pas /
translated: The antidote to forgetting the object of meditation is mindfulness.üîΩWhen laxity and excitement occur, you must recognize which one it is.

original: zhum rgod kyi gnyen po shes bzhin no //
analyzed: zhum rgod kyi gnyen po shes bzhin no //
translated: The antidote to laxity and excitement is vigilance.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i gnyen po ni sems pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i gnyen po ni sems pa ste /
translated: The antidote to non-application is application.

original: zhum rgod byung na sems pas phyir zhi gnas su glon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhum rgod byung na sems pas phyir zhi gnas su glon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When laxity and excitement occur, you must apply yourself to eliminating them.üîΩThe antidote to excessive application is equanimity, because when you are agitated, you must cultivate a non-agitated state.

original: 'du byed drags pa'i gnyen po ni btang snyoms te nam g-yo bar byed pa na mi g-yo bar bsgom pa'i phyir spong ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed drags pa'i gnyen po ni btang snyoms te nam g-yo bar byed pa na mi g-yo bar bsgom pa'i phyir spong ba'i 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: These are called the applications that eliminate because they eliminate laxity and excitement.

original: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ni tshe rabs snga ma la bsam gtan bsgoms bsgoms pa'am /
analyzed: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ni tshe rabs snga ma la bsam gtan bsgoms bsgoms pa'am /
translated: Mental concentration is the result of having cultivated meditative stabilization in previous lives.

original: yang na tshe 'di la snga nas ting nge 'dzin bsgoms bsgoms pa'i bag chags bsags te yun ring du bsgoms pa'i shugs kyis sems rtse gcig thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na tshe 'di la snga nas ting nge 'dzin bsgoms bsgoms pa'i bag chags bsags te yun ring du bsgoms pa'i shugs kyis sems rtse gcig thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, in this life, they have previously accumulated the imprints of meditative concentration, and they obtain one pointed mind through the force of having meditated for a long time.

original: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang gi tshe sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spong zhing gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams skye zhing 'phel bar bya ba rgyun mi gcod par 'bad 'bad pa las sems rtse gcig thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang gi tshe sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spong zhing gnyen po dge ba'i chos rnams skye zhing 'phel bar bya ba rgyun mi gcod par 'bad 'bad pa las sems rtse gcig thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The concentration of effort is when one obtains one pointed mind through striving to abandon nonvirtuous dharmas and to continuously increase the virtuous dharmas that are their antidotes.

original: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen las dam pa'i chos mnyan zhing bsams pa'i shes rab kyis chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang stong pa la sogs par bshig cing gtan la phab cing the tshom med par dpyod pa las sems rtse gcigüîΩthob pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen las dam pa'i chos mnyan zhing bsams pa'i shes rab kyis chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang stong pa la sogs par bshig cing gtan la phab cing the tshom med par dpyod pa las sems rtse gcigüîΩthob pa la bya'o //
translated: The concentration of analysis is when one obtains one pointed mind through analyzing the characteristics of dharmas such as impermanence and emptiness with the wisdom that comes from listening to and contemplating the sublime dharma from a virtuous friend.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni zhes bya ba ni @252a * //
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni zhes bya ba ni @252a * //
translated: The foot of miraculous power endowed with the applications of abandoning is the fourth foot of miraculous power.

original: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sbyar ba bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang re re zhing de dang 'dra bar kun la sbyar ro //
analyzed: mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sbyar ba bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang re re zhing de dang 'dra bar kun la sbyar ro //
translated: Just as it is applied to the concentration of will, so it is applied to each of the others.

original: dbang po lnga ni dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
translated: The five faculties are the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: de la ci'i phyir dbang po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir dbang po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called faculties?

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la dbang byed pas so //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la dbang byed pas so //
translated: Because they control the generation of the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation.

original: yang na yid ches pa dang / dang ba dang 'dod pa ni dad pa ste /
analyzed: yang na yid ches pa dang / dang ba dang 'dod pa ni dad pa ste /
translated: Or, faith is confidence, clarity, and longing.

original: de yod na 'khor ba las 'byung ngo snyam nas brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod na 'khor ba las 'byung ngo snyam nas brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it exists, one thinks, ‚ÄúI will emerge from cyclic existence,‚Äù and one generates the perseverance to do so.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni bslab pa gsum sgrub pa la dbang byed de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni bslab pa gsum sgrub pa la dbang byed de /
translated: Perseverance controls the accomplishment of the three trainings.

original: dran pa'i dbang pos ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la dbang byed /
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang pos ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims la dbang byed /
translated: The faculty of mindfulness controls superior morality.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos ni lhag pa'i sems la dbang byed /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos ni lhag pa'i sems la dbang byed /
translated: The faculty of meditative concentration controls superior mind.üîΩThe faculty of wisdom controls superior wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi dbang pos ni lhag pa'i shes rab la dbang byed pa dang / yang na gong ma gong ma'i dbang gis 'og ma 'og ma skye ba la dbang byed pas na dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang pos ni lhag pa'i shes rab la dbang byed pa dang / yang na gong ma gong ma'i dbang gis 'og ma 'og ma skye ba la dbang byed pas na dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, they are called faculties because they control the arising of the lower from the higher.

original: de la las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog la yid ches shing sems dang ba ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: de la las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog la yid ches shing sems dang ba ni dad pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: Among them, the faculty of faith is clear faith and mental serviceability with regard to karma, its result, the truths, and the jewels.

original: nyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i dge ba rgyun mi gcod pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: nyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i dge ba rgyun mi gcod pa ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of effort is the uninterrupted virtue of listening, reflection, and meditation, and so on.

original: nyan cing bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i don ma brjed cing gsal ba ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: nyan cing bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i don ma brjed cing gsal ba ni dran pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mindfulness is not forgetting the meaning of what one has heard, contemplated, and meditated on and being clear.

original: sems gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul la g-yeng zhing 'phro ba med pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: sems gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i yul la g-yeng zhing 'phro ba med pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of meditative concentration is the mind not distracted and scattered to objects such as form and sound.

original: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar gsal bar gtan la 'bebs pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid ma nor bar gsal bar gtan la 'bebs pa ni shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
translated: The faculty of wisdom is the unerring and clear establishment of the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: de ltar dbang du gyur kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang cung zad 'dre zhing skabs skabs su bar chad byed do //
analyzed: de ltar dbang du gyur kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang cung zad 'dre zhing skabs skabs su bar chad byed do //
translated: Even though one has become powerful in this way, one is still slightly mixed with adverse factors and sometimes experiences obstacles.

original: stobs kyi dus na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / brjed pa dang / g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin med pa rnams cung zad kyang g-yor mi snang ba'i phyir stobs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: stobs kyi dus na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / brjed pa dang / g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin med pa rnams cung zad kyang g-yor mi snang ba'i phyir stobs zhes bya ste /
translated: At the time of the powers, the adverse factors of non-faith, laziness, forgetfulness, distraction, and lack of vigilance do not appear to move at all, so they are called powers.

original: de yang dngos su na dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes @252b rab kyi stobs so //
analyzed: de yang dngos su na dad pa'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / dran pa'i stobs dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang / shes @252b rab kyi stobs so //
translated: Moreover, in actuality, they are the power of faith, the power of diligence, the power of mindfulness, the power of concentration, and the power of wisdom.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ni dbang po lnga dang mthun la /
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ni dbang po lnga dang mthun la /
translated: Their nature is in accord with the five faculties.

original: khyad par ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa'i chas dbye ste nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi yang de dag nyid la gdags te /üîΩsnang ba thob pa dang / snang ba mched pa dang / de kho na'i phyogs gcig dang / de ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa'i chas dbye ste nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi yang de dag nyid la gdags te / snang ba thob pa dang / snang ba mched pa dang / de kho na'i phyogs gcig dang / de ma thag pa ste /
translated: The four factors conducive to penetrative insight are imputed to those very five powers.üîΩThe five powers are the power of faith, the power of perseverance, the power of mindfulness, the power of concentration and the power of wisdom.

original: chos rnams la ming du btags pa rnams sgyu ma tsam du shes pa dang ming gis brjod pa'i don rnams sgyu ma tsam du shes pa'i dus na ni dbang po lnga ste /
analyzed: chos rnams la ming du btags pa rnams sgyu ma tsam du shes pa dang ming gis brjod pa'i don rnams sgyu ma tsam du shes pa'i dus na ni dbang po lnga ste /
translated: When one understands that the names imputed to phenomena are mere illusions and that the objects expressed by names are mere illusions, one has the five faculties:üîΩthe faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration and the faculty of wisdom.üîΩThese are applied to both the attainment of illumination and the increase of illumination.üîΩWhen one understands that the names imputed to phenomena are empty and that the objects expressed by names are empty, one has the five powers:üîΩthe power of faith, the power of perseverance, the power of mindfulness, the power of concentration and the power of wisdom.

original: snang ba thob pa dang snang ba mched pa gnyis dang sbyar zhing ming du btags pa'i ming rnams stong par shes pa dang / ming gis brjod pa'i don rnams stong par shes pa'i dus na ni stobs lnga ste de kho na'i phyogs gcig dang de ma thag pa gnyis dang sbyar te /
analyzed: snang ba thob pa dang snang ba mched pa gnyis dang sbyar zhing ming du btags pa'i ming rnams stong par shes pa dang / ming gis brjod pa'i don rnams stong par shes pa'i dus na ni stobs lnga ste de kho na'i phyogs gcig dang de ma thag pa gnyis dang sbyar te /
translated: These are applied to both the partial concordance with the truth and the direct realization of the truth.

original: de dag ni mthong ba'i lam la sbyor ba'i dbang dang stobs su gyur ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni mthong ba'i lam la sbyor ba'i dbang dang stobs su gyur ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: These are the characteristics of the factors of enlightenment that are the power and strength for applying oneself to the path of seeing.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: The seven factors of enlightenment are the correct mindfulness factor of enlightenment, the correct investigation of phenomena factor of enlightenment, the correct effort factor of enlightenment, the correct joy factor of enlightenment,

original: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: the correct pliancy factor of enlightenment, the correct concentration factor of enlightenment, and the correct equanimity factor of enlightenment.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: These are the factors of enlightenment.

original: rang bzhin yan lag gnas yan lag /
analyzed: rang bzhin yan lag gnas yan lag /
translated: The nature factor of enlightenment, the abiding factor of enlightenment,

original: gsum pa nges 'byung yan lag ste //
analyzed: gsum pa nges 'byung yan lag ste //
translated: the third is the renunciation factor of enlightenment,

original: bzhi pa phan yon yan lag yin //
analyzed: bzhi pa phan yon yan lag yin //
translated: the fourth is the benefit factor of enlightenment,

original: rnam gsum nyon mongs med yan lag / ces smos te /
analyzed: rnam gsum nyon mongs med yan lag / ces smos te /
translated: the three are the non-affliction factor of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sgra ni chos thams cad stong par khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sgra ni chos thams cad stong par khong du chud pa ste /
translated: The word enlightenment is the understanding that all phenomena are empty.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is nonconceptual intuition.

original: de yang chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de yang chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang sbyar te /
translated: Moreover, it is associated with the enlightenment factor of investigation of phenomena.

original: de ni gtso bo yang yin la yan lag kyang yin no //
analyzed: de ni gtso bo yang yin la yan lag kyang yin no //
translated: It is both the principal and the member.

original: gzhan drug po ni de'i grogs su gyur pas na yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan drug po ni de'i grogs su gyur pas na yan lag bdun zhes bya'o //
translated: The other six are called members because they are its assistants.

original: dran pa yang dag ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'i ye shes kyi gnas kyi yan lag yin te /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'i ye shes kyi gnas kyi yan lag yin te /
translated: Correct mindfulness is the member that is the basis of the intuition that investigates phenomena.

original: dran pa yod na de las shes rab 'byung zhing skye bas gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa yod na de las shes rab 'byung zhing skye bas gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Since when mindfulness exists, wisdom arises and grows, it is called a basis.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pas rang bzhin gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pas rang bzhin gyi yan lag ste /
translated: The investigation of phenomena is the member that is the nature because it causes the realization of the characteristics.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbrtson @253a * //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbrtson @253a * //
translated: It is the nature of intuition.üîΩVigor is the member that is the origination, because it is the origination of the realization of the special qualities of the transcendences.

original: 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste so so'i skye bo'i gnas nas nges par 'byung zhing de las 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste so so'i skye bo'i gnas nas nges par 'byung zhing de las 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vigor is the limb of renunciation, because one renounces the state of ordinary person and transcends it.

original: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
translated: Joy is the limb of benefit,

original: sa dang po mthong ba'i dga' ba des lus dang sems la phan 'dogs shing tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dang po mthong ba'i dga' ba des lus dang sems la phan 'dogs shing tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that joy of seeing the first stage benefits and satisfies body and mind.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms gsum ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms gsum ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: The three limbs of non-affliction are serenity, concentration, and equanimity.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi'o //
translated: Serenity is the basis of non-affliction.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i gnas so //
translated: Concentration is the state of non-affliction.

original: btang snyoms ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Equanimity is the intrinsic nature of non-affliction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus dang sems las su rung ba yod na /
analyzed: lus dang sems las su rung ba yod na /
translated: When body and mind are serviceable,

original: 'dod chags dang g-yeng ba la sogs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sems rtse gcig par bzhag pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir dang / mthong bas spang ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs nas de phan chad 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bar sems dag pa'i rgyun nyid du btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi dang /

original: gnas dang / ngo bo nyid gsum dang go rims bzhin du re rer sbyar la /
analyzed: gnas dang / ngo bo nyid gsum dang go rims bzhin du re rer sbyar la /
translated: Because attachment, distraction and so on do not occur, because one abandons afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing by setting the mind in one pointed equipoise and because one remains in equanimity in a continuum of a pure mind that is free of attachment and so on after abandoning afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, the basis, abode and nature of the absence of affliction are applied respectively to each of the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: gang gi tshigs bcad kyi don bsdu'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshigs bcad kyi don bsdu'o //
translated: The meaning of the verses is summarized.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni /
translated: The eightfold noble path

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: 'phags pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa thag ring du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa thag ring du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Noble means that the afflictions such as attachment that are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation are far removed.

original: de'i lam ni 'phags pa de 'thob par bya ba'i rgyu 'am sgo lta bu ste /
analyzed: de'i lam ni 'phags pa de 'thob par bya ba'i rgyu 'am sgo lta bu ste /
translated: Its path is like the cause or door for attaining that nobility.

original: dngos su na shes rab kyi bye brag yan lag brgyad de /
analyzed: dngos su na shes rab kyi bye brag yan lag brgyad de /
translated: In actuality, it is the eight branches of wisdom.

original: de yang / yongs su gcod dang go byed dang // rnam gsum gzhan yid ches par byed //
analyzed: de yang / yongs su gcod dang go byed dang // rnam gsum gzhan yid ches par byed //
translated: And it is said: The three that fully discriminate, cause understanding, and bring conviction to others.

original: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen por ni //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen por ni //
translated: The antidotes to the discordant classes

original: lam gyi yan lag de brgyad do //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag de brgyad do //üîΩzhes smos te /
translated: are the eight branches of the path.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni sa gnyis pa yan chad kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni sa gnyis pa yan chad kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rjes las thob pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Right view is the pure mundane gnosis that is acquired subsequently to the nonconceptual gnosis of the second level and above.

original: de chos kyi dbyings la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi 'di ltar mthong ngo snyam du dmigs shing gcod pas na yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de chos kyi dbyings la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi 'di ltar mthong ngo snyam du dmigs shing gcod pas na yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag go //
translated: It is the branch that fully discerns, because it discerns and sees the dharmadhatu as it is through the nonconceptual gnosis and thinks, I see it like this.

original: yang @253b dag pa'i rtog pa ni chos rnams kyi spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid ma nor bar brtags te /
analyzed: yang @253b dag pa'i rtog pa ni chos rnams kyi spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid ma nor bar brtags te /
translated: Right thought is the unmistaken investigation of the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: ji ltar rtogs pa de bzhin du yang dag pa'i ngag gis gzhan la chos ston cing 'chad pas na rtog pa dang ngag gnyis ni gzhan la go bar byed pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa de bzhin du yang dag pa'i ngag gis gzhan la chos ston cing 'chad pas na rtog pa dang ngag gnyis ni gzhan la go bar byed pa'i yan lag go //
translated: Both thought and speech are branches that cause others to understand, because, in accordance with one‚Äôs realization, one teaches and explains the Dharma to others with right speech.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag ni rgol ba dang the tshom 'dri ba'i lan ma nor bar 'brel ba'i gtam smra bas na 'di ni shes rab rnam par dag pa yin no zhes yid ches par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag ni rgol ba dang the tshom 'dri ba'i lan ma nor bar 'brel ba'i gtam smra bas na 'di ni shes rab rnam par dag pa yin no zhes yid ches par byed do //
translated: Right speech is the pure wisdom, because one speaks with connected speech that answers the questions and doubts of one‚Äôs opponents and thus inspires confidence.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las rnams cung zad kyang mi byed par spangs pas 'di ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yin no zhes yid ches par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las rnams cung zad kyang mi byed par spangs pas 'di ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yin no zhes yid ches par byed do //
translated: Right action is the pure morality of abandoning the slightest nonvirtue, such as taking life and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni yo byad bsnyungs nas zang zing mang po la mthong 'dod mi skyed mi sogs te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba ni yo byad bsnyungs nas zang zing mang po la mthong 'dod mi skyed mi sogs te /
translated: Right livelihood is the pure livelihood of not desiring or seeking many material things through begging and so on, but rather through reducing one's possessions.

original: rang gi lus dge ba spyod nus tsam gyi yo byad nyi tshe tsam zhig tshol bas na 'di ni tshod zin par 'tsho zhing yo byad bsnyungs pa yin no zhes yid ches par byed de /
analyzed: rang gi lus dge ba spyod nus tsam gyi yo byad nyi tshe tsam zhig tshol bas na 'di ni tshod zin par 'tsho zhing yo byad bsnyungs pa yin no zhes yid ches par byed de /
translated: One should have confidence that this is the livelihood of moderation and the reduction of possessions, since one seeks only the bare necessities for one's body to be able to practice virtue.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba gsum ni skyon med par gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba gsum ni skyon med par gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag go //
translated: Right speech, right action and right livelihood are the branches that inspire confidence in others.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag la nyal spang zhing /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag la nyal spang zhing /
translated: Right effort is the effort to abandon the latent states of affliction such as attachment that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pas ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhum rgod byung na rtse gcig tu glon zhing gzengs bstod de spang la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pas ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhum rgod byung na rtse gcig tu glon zhing gzengs bstod de spang la /
translated: Right mindfulness is the one pointed focus on and uplifting of the mind when the secondary mental afflictions of dullness and agitation occur.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni mngon par shes pa drug mi thob pa'i sgrib pa spangs te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni mngon par shes pa drug mi thob pa'i sgrib pa spangs te /
translated: Right concentration is the elimination of the obscurations to the attainment of the six kinds of preternatural knowledge.

original: mngon par shes pa thob par byed pas na yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gsum ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa thob par byed pas na yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gsum ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it causes the attainment of the six kinds of preternatural knowledge, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration are called the factors of elimination of counteragents.

original: tshigs su bcad pa dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They are to be applied in the order in which they are mentioned.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya /
translated: The four noble truths are stated as follows: Suffering is to be fully understood.

original: kun 'byung spang bar bya /üîΩ'gog pa mngon du bya /
analyzed: kun 'byung spang bar bya / 'gog pa mngon du bya /
translated: The origin of suffering is to be abandoned.üîΩThe cessation of suffering is to be realized.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom par bya zhes smos te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom par bya zhes smos te /
translated: The path to the cessation of suffering is to be cultivated.

original: de la 'phags pa ni gong du smos pa dang 'dra la /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa ni gong du smos pa dang 'dra la /
translated: Here, the noble ones are as mentioned above.

original: bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po de dag de kho na ltar ma nor bar nges so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i chos bzhi po de dag de kho na ltar ma nor bar nges so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The four truths are the four dharmas of suffering and so on, which are ascertained just as they are, without error.

original: de yang sdug bsngal la yongs su shes par bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten dang bcud kyi 'jig rten sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu grub zin pa 'di ni spang du mi rung bas de ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal dang stong pa dang bdag medüîΩpar shes par bya ba'o //üîΩkun 'byung @254a * //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal la yongs su shes par bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten dang bcud kyi 'jig rten sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu grub zin pa 'di ni spang du mi rung bas de ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal dang stong pa dang bdag med par shes par bya ba'o // kun 'byung @254a * //
translated: Moreover, suffering is to be fully known, but since this world of the environment and beings, which is the established result of past karma, cannot be eliminated, it is to be known as impermanent, suffering, empty, and selfless.

original: spang bar bya ba ni sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa de dag khams gsum rgyud lngar 'byung zhing sdug bsngal gyi phung po de bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ni sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pa de dag khams gsum rgyud lngar 'byung zhing sdug bsngal gyi phung po de bskyed pa ste /
translated: Origination is to be abandoned, since those past karmas and afflictions arise in the five lineages of the three realms and generate the mass of suffering.

original: rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang rab tu skye ba dang rkyen dang 'byung ba'i tshul du rig nas lam gyis spang bar bya ba yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang rab tu skye ba dang rkyen dang 'byung ba'i tshul du rig nas lam gyis spang bar bya ba yin par shes pa'o //
translated: Having understood them in the manner of cause, origination, strong generation, condition, and occurrence, they are to be abandoned by the path.üîΩCessation is to be realized, since the cessation of suffering is the supreme peace, the supreme transcendence of suffering, the supreme sublimity, and the supreme freedom.

original: 'gog pa mngon du bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba gnyis ka spangs pa phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'gog pa dang zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byungüîΩba lta bur shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba gnyis ka spangs pa phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa dang phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'gog pa dang zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung ba lta bur shes pa'o //
translated: The realization of cessation is the abandonment of both suffering and origin, which is nirvana with remainder and without remainder, which is understood as cessation, peace, excellence, and definite emergence.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom par bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam bsgom par bya ba la /
translated: The path is to be cultivated in order to bring about the cessation of suffering.

original: lam ni byang chub kyi phyogs sam yang na 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po dag ste /
analyzed: lam ni byang chub kyi phyogs sam yang na 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po dag ste /
translated: The path is the factors of enlightenment or else the eightfold noble path.

original: de dag gis sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung 'gag cing spang ste /
analyzed: de dag gis sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung 'gag cing spang ste /
translated: By means of them, suffering and origin are stopped and abandoned.

original: de yang lam dang rigs pa dang bsgrub pa dang nges par 'byung bar shes pa ste /
analyzed: de yang lam dang rigs pa dang bsgrub pa dang nges par 'byung bar shes pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the path is understood as the path, reason, achievement, and definite emergence.

original: dngos su na gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa brtsal te rnyed par byed pa dang / so so'i skye bo'i sa nas 'phags pa'i gnas su phyin par byed pas na lam mo //
analyzed: dngos su na gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa brtsal te rnyed par byed pa dang / so so'i skye bo'i sa nas 'phags pa'i gnas su phyin par byed pas na lam mo //
translated: It is the path because it is the means of seeking and finding the selflessness of persons and phenomena and of proceeding from the stage of ordinary beings to the stage of noble beings.

original: de la rtogs pa dang 'dris par byed pa ni bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rtogs pa dang 'dris par byed pa ni bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cultivation of that is called familiarization.

original: bsam gtan bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four meditations?

original: rtog dpyod dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / btang snyoms te /
analyzed: rtog dpyod dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / btang snyoms te /
translated: They are investigation, analysis, joy, pleasure, and equanimity.

original: de la bsam gtan bzhi ni gzugs kyi khams kyi gnas bzhir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi bskyod cing sems brtan po rang dbang du gnas pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan bzhi ni gzugs kyi khams kyi gnas bzhir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi bskyod cing sems brtan po rang dbang du gnas pa'i don to //
translated: The four meditations are the four abodes of the form realm. Their meaning is that the mind abides firmly under one's control, unshaken by adverse factors.

original: de la rtog dpyod ni bsam gtan dang po ste sa 'og ma 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la spod pa ni nad dang shub lta bu skyon can yin la gzugs kyi bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa ni zhi ba dang bde
analyzed: de la rtog dpyod ni bsam gtan dang po ste sa 'og ma 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la spod pa ni nad dang shub lta bu skyon can yin la gzugs kyi bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa ni zhi ba dang bde

translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of infinite space, thinking ‚Äúconsciousness is infinite,‚Äù he remains in the attainment of the sphere of infinite consciousness.üîΩHaving completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness, thinking ‚Äúthere is nothing at all,‚Äù he remains in the attainment of the sphere of nothing at all.

original: zag pa @258b zad do //
analyzed: zag pa @258b zad do //

translated: He is fearless in declaring the path that definitely leads to the perfection of all that is excellent, since it is the path of definite emergence that leads to the suchness of the perfection of all that is excellent for others' sakes.

analyzed: la la zhig gis de bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro zhes rgol yang des mi 'jigs gzhan du mi 'gyur bar nges pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de thob par nges par 'byung ba'i lam 'phags pa'i lam gyis @259a * // thob po zhes bstan na de bzhin du nges te /

analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig gis lam de ma thob po zhes rgol na yang des mi 'jigs te /

analyzed: lam de bzhin du 'gyur ba ni gnyen po bstan la mi 'jigs pa zhes bya'o //

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni ming dang tshig gis brjod cing bstan pa'i don /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni ming dang tshig gis brjod cing bstan pa'i don /

translated: The knowledge of the reality of the general characteristics is the knowledge of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self, and the knowledge of the reality of the ultimate, which is the non-arising and non-cessation of the non-dual, pure realm of the Dharma.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni sems can sna tshogs kyi skad dang brda dang sgra shes shing tshig gcig gis kyang don rnam pa bcu la sogs pa du mar go ba dang / tshig 'khrul pa dang brtad pa dang zlos bu dang /

translated: The knowledge of the reality of etymological definitions is the knowledge of the various languages, gestures, and sounds of sentient beings, and the knowledge that a single word can convey many meanings, such as the ten.üîΩIt is not a mistake, a stammer, a repetition,
