translated: It is the speech that is praised by the noble ones and is pleasing to beings.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni gzhan las dam pa'i chos mnyan zhing the tshom zhu ba dang / bdag gis kyang chos bshad cing gzhan gyi the tshom dgrol ba la sogs pa snyan cing don dang ldan pa tshangs pa'i dbyangs lta bur myur zhing rgyun mi 'chad la thags thogs med par smra nus pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni gzhan las dam pa'i chos mnyan zhing the tshom zhu ba dang / bdag gis kyang chos bshad cing gzhan gyi the tshom dgrol ba la sogs pa snyan cing don dang ldan pa tshangs pa'i dbyangs lta bur myur zhing rgyun mi 'chad la thags thogs med par smra nus pa'o //
translated: The correct analytical knowledge of eloquence is the ability to speak quickly, continuously, and without hesitation in a pleasant and meaningful voice like Brahma's voice, in order to listen to the sublime Dharma from others and to ask questions, and in order to explain the Dharma oneself and to resolve others' doubts.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i chos bco brgyad po de dag nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang so so'i skye bo rnams @259b la cung zad kyang med la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i chos bco brgyad po de dag nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang so so'i skye bo rnams @259b la cung zad kyang med la /
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are the eighteen qualities mentioned below that are not possessed in the least by sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, or ordinary beings.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la mnga' ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la mnga' ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes smos so //
translated: They are called the distinctive qualities of the Buddha because they are possessed only by the Buddha.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas las su byed pa la 'khrul pa 'byung gi /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sgo nas las su byed pa la 'khrul pa 'byung gi /
translated: Moreover, the Tathagata is without error. The Sravakas and so forth, in their physical, verbal and mental actions, are subject to error.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi phrin las yongs su dag pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi phrin las yongs su dag pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o zhes bya'o //
translated: But the Buddha's physical, verbal and mental actions are completely pure and without error.

original: ca co mi mnga' ba ni nyan thos dag nags stug por lam por te 'bod pa dang grong stong par phyin te su yod ces rmed pa dang / sngon ca co la dga' ba'i bag chags ca co la sred pa lta bu 'byung gi /
analyzed: ca co mi mnga' ba ni nyan thos dag nags stug por lam por te 'bod pa dang grong stong par phyin te su yod ces rmed pa dang / sngon ca co la dga' ba'i bag chags ca co la sred pa lta bu 'byung gi /
translated: He is without confusion. The Sravakas, in a deep forest, call out and, arriving at an empty village, ask, Who is there? and, like one who is addicted to confusion and craves confusion, they are subject to error.

original: sangs rgyas la de lta bu mi mnga' bas na ca co mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la de lta bu mi mnga' bas na ca co mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: But the Buddha is not like that, and so he is said to be without confusion.

original: bsnyel ba ni mnga' ba ni nyan thos dag 'phral la dgongs nas gzod mkhyen pa la 'jug gi sangs rgyas ni mkhyen pa thogs pa dang chags pa med pas bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //üîΩsems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba ni nyan thos dag 'phral la mnyam par 'jog cing ldang gi /
analyzed: bsnyel ba ni mnga' ba ni nyan thos dag 'phral la dgongs nas gzod mkhyen pa la 'jug gi sangs rgyas ni mkhyen pa thogs pa dang chags pa med pas bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o // sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba ni nyan thos dag 'phral la mnyam par 'jog cing ldang gi /
translated: The Buddha is said to be without forgetfulness because his knowledge is unimpeded and unattached, unlike that of the disciples, who must first reflect before they understand.

original: sangs rgyas ni 'byung 'jug gi mnga' bar spyod lam bzhi'i dus thams cad du sems mnyam par 'jog pas mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni 'byung 'jug gi mnga' bar spyod lam bzhi'i dus thams cad du sems mnyam par 'jog pas mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The Buddha is said to be without a mind that is not in meditative equipoise because his mind is always in meditative equipoise, in all four types of activity, unlike the disciples, who enter and rise from meditative equipoise.

original: tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dag 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag skyon dang yon tan du lta bas na nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams la blang dor gyi 'du shesüîΩtha dad pa 'byung gi /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dag 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag skyon dang yon tan du lta bas na nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams la blang dor gyi 'du shesüîΩtha dad pa 'byung gi /
translated: The Buddha is said to be without a different type of discernment because the disciples have a discernment of different things to be adopted or rejected, such as the afflictions and purification, since they view samsara and nirvana as having faults and good qualities, respectively.üîΩThe Buddha is said to be without a different type of aspiration because he is always focused on the welfare of sentient beings, unlike the disciples, whose aspirations are not always focused on the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas ni thugs rje chen po dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid du thugs su chud de 'khor ba stong pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas blang dor lta bu'i 'du shes tha dad pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni thugs rje chen po dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid du thugs su chud de 'khor ba stong pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas blang dor lta bu'i 'du shes tha dad pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: A buddha has great compassion and has realized nonconceptual gnosis as emptiness. Since samsara is emptiness, nirvana is emptiness, he does not have the different concepts of adopting and rejecting.

original: so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba ni /
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba ni /
translated: He does not have indifference that is not a specific discernment.

original: nyan thos dag sems can la 'dul ba'i skal ba ci yod pa yang so sor ma brtags la de dag gi don yang mi byed par 'dor bas na ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mnga'i /
analyzed: nyan thos dag sems can la 'dul ba'i skal ba ci yod pa yang so sor ma brtags la de dag gi don yang mi byed par 'dor bas na ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mnga'i /
translated: Shravakas do not specifically discern what potential there is for training sentient beings and they do not work for their welfare, so they abandon them and have indifference that is not a specific discernment.

original: sangs rgyas ni sems can 'dul ba'i skal ba ci yod brtags nas skal ba med pa don byas kyang don du mi 'gyur ba nyi tshe btang snyoms su 'jog cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni sems can 'dul ba'i skal ba ci yod brtags nas skal ba med pa don byas kyang don du mi 'gyur ba nyi tshe btang snyoms su 'jog cing /
translated: A buddha specifically discerns what potential there is for training sentient beings and he places those who have no potential for training in temporary indifference, even though he works for their welfare, but it is of no benefit.

original: skal ba can rnams la yal bar btang snyoms su mi 'jog pas so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skal ba can rnams la yal bar btang snyoms su mi 'jog pas so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He does not place those who have the potential for training in indifference, so he is said to have indifference that is not a specific discernment.

original: 'dun pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba ni nyan thos dag bla na med pa'i byang chub dang sems can thams cad kyi @260a * //
analyzed: 'dun pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba ni nyan thos dag bla na med pa'i byang chub dang sems can thams cad kyi @260a * //
translated: He is not lacking in aspiration, for the Sravakas do not have the aspiration to engage in the unsurpassed enlightenment and in the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: don la 'jug pa'i mos pa med de rang gi don dang sems can nyung shas tsam zhig gi don la mos pas 'dun pa nyams kyi /
analyzed: don la 'jug pa'i mos pa med de rang gi don dang sems can nyung shas tsam zhig gi don la mos pas 'dun pa nyams kyi /
translated: They are lacking in aspiration, because they aspire to their own welfare and to the welfare of only a few sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas ni bla na med pa dang / sems can ma lus pa'i don la mos pas 'dun pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni bla na med pa dang / sems can ma lus pa'i don la mos pas 'dun pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: But the Buddha is not lacking in aspiration, because he aspires to the unsurpassed and to the welfare of all sentient beings without exception.

original: brtson 'grus nyams pa mi mnga' ba ni sku dang thugs bsnyel ba mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus nyams pa mi mnga' ba ni sku dang thugs bsnyel ba mi 'byung ste /
translated: He is not lacking in vigor, for he does not have lapses in body or mind.

original: sems can gcig 'ba' zhig gi don du yang bskal par bshos mi gsol bar chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gcig 'ba' zhig gi don du yang bskal par bshos mi gsol bar chos ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He teaches the Dharma without taking a rest for a single moment, even for the sake of a single sentient being.

original: dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba ni sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang / dbang po la sogs pa dang / gnyen po dang / mi mthun pa'i bye brag gang la gang gis 'dul ba la sogs pa snga nas mkhyen zhing dran pa ye shes kyis zin pas nyan thos dag da ltar 'phral la dgongs pa mi 'tshal ba'i phyir dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba ni sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa dang / bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba dang / dbang po la sogs pa dang / gnyen po dang / mi mthun pa'i bye brag gang la gang gis 'dul ba la sogs pa snga nas mkhyen zhing dran pa ye shes kyis zin pas nyan thos dag da ltar 'phral la dgongs pa mi 'tshal ba'i phyir dran pa nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: His mindfulness is unimpaired: he knows in advance and remembers with his wisdom the conduct, thoughts, latent tendencies, faculties, etc. of all sentient beings, and what is needed to tame them, etc. The disciples do not know his thoughts at the present moment, so it is said that his mindfulness is unimpaired.

original: shes rab nyams pa mi mnga' ba ni sems can gyi spyod pa dang / chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong dag mkhyen zhing /
analyzed: shes rab nyams pa mi mnga' ba ni sems can gyi spyod pa dang / chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong dag mkhyen zhing /
translated: His wisdom is unimpaired: he knows the conduct of sentient beings and the 84,000 Dharma doors.

original: sems can gyi don mi zad par so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pas mdzad pa'i phyir shes rab nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mi zad par so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pas mdzad pa'i phyir shes rab nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: His wisdom is unimpaired because his activities are unimpaired, due to his inexhaustible analytical knowledges.

original: ting nge 'dzin nyams pa mi mnga' ba ni nyan thos dag 'phral la ting nge 'dzin du 'jug pas na ma zhugs pa'i tshe nyams kyi sangs rgyas ni dus thams cad du mi nyams par 'jog pas na nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nyams pa mi mnga' ba ni nyan thos dag 'phral la ting nge 'dzin du 'jug pas na ma zhugs pa'i tshe nyams kyi sangs rgyas ni dus thams cad du mi nyams par 'jog pas na nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: His concentration is never impaired: the disciples enter into concentration from time to time, so that when they are not concentrated, their concentration is impaired. But the Buddha is always concentrated, so that his concentration is said to be never impaired.

original: rnam par grol ba nyams pa mi mnga' ba ni nyan thos dag ni zhi ba phyogs gcig tu thim zhing nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam zhig nyi tshe las grol ba ni nyams pa zhes bya'i //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba nyams pa mi mnga' ba ni nyan thos dag ni zhi ba phyogs gcig tu thim zhing nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa tsam zhig nyi tshe las grol ba ni nyams pa zhes bya'i //
translated: His liberation is never impaired: the disciples are liberated by dissolving into the one-sided peace of cessation, and are only temporarily liberated from the afflictions. This is called impaired liberation.

original: sangs rgyas ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pag gnyis ka las grol te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pag gnyis ka las grol te /
translated: But the Buddha is liberated from both the afflictions and the cognizable,

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob cing 'khor ba ji srid pa de srid du sems can gyi don mdzad pas na rnam par grol ba ma nyams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob cing 'khor ba ji srid pa de srid du sems can gyi don mdzad pas na rnam par grol ba ma nyams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and he has attained nonabiding nirvana, and he acts for the sake of beings for as long as samsara lasts. Therefore his liberation is said to be never impaired.

original: lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni sangs rgyas sngon byang chub sems dpa' mdzad pa'i dus na phrin las su mdzad do 'tshal thams cad la dgongs pa snga nas gzhag ste phrin las mdzad pa de lhun
analyzed: lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni sangs rgyas sngon byang chub sems dpa' mdzad pa'i dus na phrin las su mdzad do 'tshal thams cad la dgongs pa snga nas gzhag ste phrin las mdzad pa de lhun
translated: All the Buddha‚Äôs physical actions are preceded by and follow after gnosis. When he was a bodhisattva in the past, he performed his activities with a preestablished plan.

original: gyis grub pas sangs rgyas pa'i dus na phrin las su mdzad pa thams cad nyan thos ltar 'phral la dongs mi 'tshal te /
analyzed: gyis grub pas sangs rgyas pa'i dus na phrin las su mdzad pa thams cad nyan thos ltar 'phral la dongs mi 'tshal te /
translated: At the time of buddhahood, all his activities are spontaneously accomplished.üîΩUnlike the shravakas, he does not have to think about what he is going to do.

original: ci mdzad do cog ye shes kyis snga @260b nas mkhyen bzhin du phrin las mdzad pas ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ci mdzad do cog ye shes kyis snga @260b nas mkhyen bzhin du phrin las mdzad pas ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Everything he does is preceded by and followed by gnosis.

original: ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni /
analyzed: ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni /
translated: All his verbal actions are preceded by and followed by gnosis.

original: sngar ye shes kyis sems can gyi don du gang 'gyur ba gtan la phab nas sems can gyi bsam pa dang mthun par yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i gsung 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar ye shes kyis sems can gyi don du gang 'gyur ba gtan la phab nas sems can gyi bsam pa dang mthun par yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i gsung 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, having previously determined by gnosis what would be of benefit to sentient beings, he then issues forth speech endowed with sixty branches in accordance with the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni thugs kyi phrin las te /
analyzed: yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni thugs kyi phrin las te /
translated: The activity of his mind is as follows: All his mental activities are preceded by gnosis and follow after gnosis.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang spros pa thams cad ye shes kyi sngon du spangs nas don dam pa'i rjes su zhugs shing chos kyi dbyings la yid 'jog pas na ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang spros pa thams cad ye shes kyi sngon du spangs nas don dam pa'i rjes su zhugs shing chos kyi dbyings la yid 'jog pas na ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang zhes bya'o //
translated: This means that, having previously eliminated all conceptual thoughts and elaborations by means of gnosis, he then engages in the ultimate and focuses his mind on the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa ni sngon gyi dus bskal pa grangs med pa'i mdun du chos ci 'byung ba dang / las dge sdig ci spyad pa'i lo rgyus thams cad ma 'khrul par mkhyen pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa ni sngon gyi dus bskal pa grangs med pa'i mdun du chos ci 'byung ba dang / las dge sdig ci spyad pa'i lo rgyus thams cad ma 'khrul par mkhyen pa la bya'o //
translated: The activity of his eyes is as follows: He engages in seeing with the gnosis that is unattached and unobstructed with regard to the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa gnyis kyang gong dang 'dra bar sbyar ste /üîΩma 'ongs pa'i dus na chos ci dang ci 'byung ba dang / da ltar kho na phyogs bcu thams cad na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa gnyis kyang gong dang 'dra bar sbyar ste / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na chos ci dang ci 'byung ba dang / da ltar kho na phyogs bcu thams cad na /
translated: The two, the vision of pristine wisdom that is not attached to or obstructed with regard to the future and the vision of pristine wisdom that is not attached to or obstructed with regard to the present, are to be applied in the same way as above.üîΩThe pristine wisdom that is not attached to or obstructed with regard to the future knows and realizes clearly whatever phenomena will arise in the future and whatever phenomena are arising right now in all the ten directions.

original: chos ci dang ci 'byung ba thams cad gsal bar mkhyen zhing dgongs pas na ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos ci dang ci 'byung ba thams cad gsal bar mkhyen zhing dgongs pas na ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the vision of pristine wisdom.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four fruits of the spiritual practitioner?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba la bzod pa dang / ye shes bcu drug gi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa brgyad spangs pa ni /üîΩrgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba la bzod pa dang / ye shes bcu drug gi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa brgyad spangs pa ni / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The abandonment of the eighty-eight afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing through the sixteen moments of acceptance and knowledge is called ‚Äúattaining the fruit of stream-enterer.‚Äù

original: 'dod khams kyi nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi gcig tu bsdus la dgur phye nas de'i gnyen po ye shes kyang dgur phye ste rim gyis spong ba'i drug man chad spangs pa ni lan gcig phyir 'ong pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod khams kyi nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi gcig tu bsdus la dgur phye nas de'i gnyen po ye shes kyang dgur phye ste rim gyis spong ba'i drug man chad spangs pa ni lan gcig phyir 'ong pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The four afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation are combined into one and divided into nine. The antidote to them is divided into nine knowledges. The abandonment of the first six of those is called ‚Äúattaining the fruit of once-returner.‚Äù

original: dgu po de rim gyis spangs pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgu po de rim gyis spangs pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The abandonment of those nine in stages is called ‚Äúattaining the fruit of non-returner.‚Äù

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na bsgom @261a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na bsgom @261a * //
translated: The afflictions of the form and formless realms that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation are combined into one and divided into nine.

original: pas spang bar bya ba gsum ste drug yod pa yang gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: pas spang bar bya ba gsum ste drug yod pa yang gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: The three to be abandoned by the path of cultivation are also included in one.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four concentrations and the four formless absorptions

original: brgyad pa gcig cing yang dgu dgur phye /
analyzed: brgyad pa gcig cing yang dgu dgur phye /
translated: are each divided into nine.

original: rim gyis spangs nas srid pa'i rtse mor nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i yang chung ngu ye shes chen po'i yang chen po rdo rje lta bus spangs pa'i dus na dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rim gyis spangs nas srid pa'i rtse mor nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i yang chung ngu ye shes chen po'i yang chen po rdo rje lta bus spangs pa'i dus na dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Having abandoned them in sequence, at the peak of existence, the small of the small afflictions, the great of the great of the wisdom vajra, at the time of abandonment, it is called the fruit of an arhat.

original: lan gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: lan gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: rang byang chub dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang byang chub dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Pratyekabuddha enlightenment, the knowledge of the aspects of the path, and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sngon dam pa'i chos mnyan pa'i rgyus da ltar gyi dus lta bur rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rang nyid kyis rtogs te /
analyzed: sngon dam pa'i chos mnyan pa'i rgyus da ltar gyi dus lta bur rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rang nyid kyis rtogs te /
translated: In the past, due to the cause of listening to the sublime Dharma, in the present time, one realizes the Dharma of dependent origination oneself.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la mi ltos par gang zag la bdag med par rtogs te /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la mi ltos par gang zag la bdag med par rtogs te /

translated: The superior morality is to restrain from nonvirtue, to gather virtue and to work for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: theg pa chen po ni dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang nyan thos dag gi mi gtsang ba bsgom pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ni lhag pa'i sems so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang nyan thos dag gi mi gtsang ba bsgom pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ni lhag pa'i sems so //
translated: The Mahayana is the superior mind, because it includes the samadhis of Heroic Valour, etc., and the samadhis of the Sravakas, such as the meditation on impurity, the four dhyanas, and the formless absorptions.

original: theg pa chen po ni chos dang gang zag gnyis ka la bdag med par mkhyen /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni chos dang gang zag gnyis ka la bdag med par mkhyen /
translated: The Mahayana is the superior wisdom, because it knows the selflessness of both the individual and the phenomena.

original: nyan thos dag ni gang zag bdag med par rig pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: nyan thos dag ni gang zag bdag med par rig pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: The Sravakas' knowledge of the selflessness of the individual is the superior wisdom.

original: dbang po gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three faculties?

original: yongs su ma shes pa yongs su shes pa'i dbang po dang / yongs su shes pa'i dbang po dang / yongs su shes pa rtogs pa'i dbang @263a * //üîΩpo'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa yongs su shes pa'i dbang po dang / yongs su shes pa'i dbang po dang / yongs su shes pa rtogs pa'i dbang @263a * //üîΩpo'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: The faculty of complete knowledge of what is as yet unknown, the faculty of complete knowledge, and the faculty of final complete knowledge.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lam gyi dus na dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po lnga dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / yid kyi dbang po bzhi ste /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i lam gyi dus na dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po lnga dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / yid kyi dbang po bzhi ste /
translated: At the time of the path of seeing, the five faculties of faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration and wisdom, and the four faculties of pleasure, mental pleasure, indifference and mind,

original: dgu po de dag gis mthong bas spang ba spangs pa na /
analyzed: dgu po de dag gis mthong bas spang ba spangs pa na /
translated: these nine faculties abandon the discards of seeing.

original: sngon mi shes pa kun shes pas yongs su ma shes pa yongs su shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya /üîΩbsgom pas spang ba spong ba'i dus na dbang po dgu pos mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs gsal bar bye brag phyed pa ni yongs su shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya /
analyzed: sngon mi shes pa kun shes pas yongs su ma shes pa yongs su shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya / bsgom pas spang ba spong ba'i dus na dbang po dgu pos mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs gsal bar bye brag phyed pa ni yongs su shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya /
translated: When previously unknown, the faculty of complete knowledge is called the faculty of complete knowledge of what was not previously known.üîΩAt the time of abandoning the discards of meditation, the nine faculties distinguish the discordant classes and the classes of antidotes, and this is called the faculty of complete knowledge.

original: dgra bcom pa'i dus na mthong bsgom gyi nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'i dbang po dgu ni yongs su shes pa rtogs pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i dus na mthong bsgom gyi nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs pa'i dbang po dgu ni yongs su shes pa rtogs pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: At the time of arhatship, the nine faculties that have completely abandoned the afflictions of seeing and meditation are called the faculty of complete knowledge of complete knowledge.

original: nyon mongs pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of addictions?

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are the addictions of the addictions, the addictions of action, and the addictions of life.

original: rang nyid kyang nyon mongs pa yin la /
analyzed: rang nyid kyang nyon mongs pa yin la /
translated: They are addictions because they are addictions themselves,üîΩand because they are the causes of addictions.

original: rgyu de las skyes pa yang nyon mongs par 'gyur bas na nyon mongs pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rgyu de las skyes pa yang nyon mongs par 'gyur bas na nyon mongs pa gsum ste /
translated: They are the three addictions.

original: de yang rten 'brel bcu gnyis las ma rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa dang gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rten 'brel bcu gnyis las ma rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa dang gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: In the twelve members of dependent origination, the three members of ignorance, craving, and grasping are the addictions of the addictions.

original: 'du byed dang srid pa gnyis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang srid pa gnyis ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The two members of impulse and becoming are the addictions of action.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba dang skye ba dang rga shi bdun ni tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba dang skye ba dang rga shi bdun ni tshe'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The seven members of consciousness, name-and-form, six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and old age and death are the addictions of life.

original: sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu 'khor ba'o //
translated: They are the cause and effect of the cycle of suffering.

original: kun rdzob gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of relative?

original: kun rdzob kyi rdzob dang / yang dag pa ma yin kun rdzob dang / yang dag pa'i kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi rdzob dang / yang dag pa ma yin kun rdzob dang / yang dag pa'i kun rdzob bo //
translated: The relative of the relative, the unreal relative, and the real relative.

original: de la sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang mig yor la sogs pa rang rang gi bya ba byed mi nus pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni kun rdzob kyi kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: de la sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang mig yor la sogs pa rang rang gi bya ba byed mi nus pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni kun rdzob kyi kun rdzob bo //
translated: Among these, the relative of the relative is such things as illusions, mirages, and optical illusions, which are characterized by their inability to perform the function for which they are supposed to be.

original: phyi nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos la phyin ci log tu brtags shing bsgrubs te bskyed pa rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: phyi nang gi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos la phyin ci log tu brtags shing bsgrubs te bskyed pa rnams ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rdzob bo //
translated: The unreal relative is that which is produced by false imagination and false practice with regard to inner and outer dependent arising.

original: phyi nang gi rten 'brel la yang dag par brtags te dge ba bcu la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni yang dag pa'i kun @263b rdzob bo //
analyzed: phyi nang gi rten 'brel la yang dag par brtags te dge ba bcu la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ni yang dag pa'i kun @263b rdzob bo //
translated: The real relative is the cause and effect that are produced by the ten virtues and so forth, which are correctly imagined and practiced with regard to inner and outer dependent arising.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i kun rdzob yon tan gyi sgra don gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i kun rdzob yon tan gyi sgra don gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three topics of the bodhisattva‚Äôs relative good qualities?

original: mos pa dang / sbyor ba dang / khong du chud pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mos pa dang / sbyor ba dang / khong du chud pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are interest, application, and understanding.

original: byang chub ces bya ba dang sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba'i sgra gsum dang go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba dang sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba'i sgra gsum dang go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The three terms enlightenment, hero and great hero are to be applied respectively to the four aspects of the path of joining, the ten levels and the level of buddhahood.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi la gnas pa ni byang chub ces bya ste mos pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha bzhi la gnas pa ni byang chub ces bya ste mos pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: One who abides in the four aspects of the path of joining is called a bodhisattva, since it is applied to interest.

original: sa dang po nas bcu pa man chad la gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste sbyor ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sa dang po nas bcu pa man chad la gnas pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste sbyor ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: One who abides on the first to tenth levels is called a bodhisattva hero, since it is applied to preparation.

original: sa bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyi sa'i dus na sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: At the time of the eleventh level, the level of buddhahood, one is called a great hero.

original: khong du chud pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: khong du chud pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to realization.

original: yang na sems can la ston pa dang de dag byang chub la 'god pa dang byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na sems can la ston pa dang de dag byang chub la 'god pa dang byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Alternatively, one is a bodhisattva because one teaches sentient beings, one establishes them in enlightenment and one is a hero.

original: sems can rnams la bla na med pa'i lam ston pas na byang chub ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la bla na med pa'i lam ston pas na byang chub ste /
translated: One is a bodhisattva because one teaches sentient beings the unsurpassable path.

original: sems can la ston pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems can la ston pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is applied to teaching sentient beings.

original: lam la bkod pa de dag 'bras bu thob par byed pas na byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: lam la bkod pa de dag 'bras bu thob par byed pas na byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: They are bodhisattvas because they cause those established on the path to obtain the result.

original: de dag byang chub la 'god pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag byang chub la 'god pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: They are connected with establishing them in enlightenment.

original: bdag nyid kyang byang chub chen po thob par byed pas na sems dpa' chen po ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang byang chub chen po thob par byed pas na sems dpa' chen po ste /
translated: They are great beings because they themselves obtain great enlightenment.üîΩThey are connected with the spirit of enlightenment.

original: byang chub tu sems dpa' dang sbyar te mtshan nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan par ston pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems dpa' dang sbyar te mtshan nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan par ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that they possess the qualities of the characteristics.

original: khams gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three realms?

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: dmyal ba brgyad dang / byol song dang yi dags gnyis te bcu dang / gling bzhi dang 'dod pa'i lha drug dang bcu ste spyir gnas nyi shu ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: dmyal ba brgyad dang / byol song dang yi dags gnyis te bcu dang / gling bzhi dang 'dod pa'i lha drug dang bcu ste spyir gnas nyi shu ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The desire realm consists of ten places: the eight hot hells, the cold hells, the ghost realm, and the animal realm, plus the four continents, plus the six heavenly desire realms.

original: bsam gtan dang po nas bzhi pa'i bar gnas bcu bdun ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas bzhi pa'i bar gnas bcu bdun ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: The form realm consists of seventeen places, from the first concentration to the fourth.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas 'du shes yod min med min man chad gnas bzhi ni gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched nas 'du shes yod min med min man chad gnas bzhi ni gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: The four abodes from the base of infinite space to the base of neither perception nor non-perception are the formless realm.

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags gang zhe na /
translated: What is a reason having the three modes?

original: rjes su dpag pa la yod pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yod pa dang / mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It exists in the similar class, it does not exist in the dissimilar class, and it exists in the inferential subject.

original: shes bya mngon du ma gyur kyang snol tshul gyi thog tu 'bebs pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya mngon du ma gyur kyang snol tshul gyi thog tu 'bebs pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags zhes bya ste /
translated: Even though the object of knowledge is not manifest, the three modes of a reason are called the three modes of a reason because they are the means of descending upon it.

original: de yang me dang chu mi snang yang du ba dang chu bya snang ba tsam las me dang chu yod par brtags pa ni rjes su dpag pa la yod @264a * //üîΩpa'o // tshang bang chen po na me yod par brtags pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ste /
analyzed: de yang me dang chu mi snang yang du ba dang chu bya snang ba tsam las me dang chu yod par brtags pa ni rjes su dpag pa la yod @264a * // pa'o // tshang bang chen po na me yod par brtags pa ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the existence of fire and water is inferred from the mere appearance of smoke and the appearance of water birds, even though fire and water do not appear.

original: tshang bang dang me yod par mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshang bang dang me yod par mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The existence of fire in a great house is the existence in the similar class because fire and a house are similar.

original: chu'i nang na me med par brtags pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ste /
analyzed: chu'i nang na me med par brtags pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa ste /
translated: The investigation of the absence of fire in water is the absence in the adverse factors.

original: gcig la gcig dgra ltar mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig dgra ltar mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mutually adverse like enemies.

original: sdug bsngal gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces.

original: khams gsum gyi tshor ba rnam pa gsum la sdug bsngal gsum gyis khyab pas na sdug bsngal gsum zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi tshor ba rnam pa gsum la sdug bsngal gsum gyis khyab pas na sdug bsngal gsum zhes bya ste /
translated: The three kinds of suffering are so called because the three kinds of feeling in the three realms are pervaded by the three kinds of suffering.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can rnams la tshor ba gsum char dang yang ldan mod kyi /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can rnams la tshor ba gsum char dang yang ldan mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, although beings in the desire realm possess the three kinds of feeling,

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba shas che ba sdug bsngal pa'i sdug bsngal gyis khyab bo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba shas che ba sdug bsngal pa'i sdug bsngal gyis khyab bo //
translated: they are pervaded by the suffering of suffering because the feeling of suffering predominates.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams ni bsam gtan la gnas pas phal cher tshor ba bde ba dang ldan te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams ni bsam gtan la gnas pas phal cher tshor ba bde ba dang ldan te /
translated: The gods in the form realm are mostly endowed with the feeling of pleasure because they abide in meditative concentration.

original: re zhig bde yang gtan du de na mi gnas te tsho zad nas gzhan du 'gyur bas na 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis khyab bo //
analyzed: re zhig bde yang gtan du de na mi gnas te tsho zad nas gzhan du 'gyur bas na 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis khyab bo //
translated: Although one is happy for a while, one does not remain there forever, because when the life force is exhausted, one changes to another state. Therefore, the formless realm is pervaded by the suffering of change.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni ming bzhi'i phung po skad cig ma'i rgyun la gnas pas tshor ba btang snyoms dang ldan te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni ming bzhi'i phung po skad cig ma'i rgyun la gnas pas tshor ba btang snyoms dang ldan te /
translated: In the formless realm, the four mental aggregates that are momentary streams of names are associated with the feeling of equanimity.

original: skye bos sdug bsngal du mi tshor mod kyi 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal du gzigs te /
analyzed: skye bos sdug bsngal du mi tshor mod kyi 'phags pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal du gzigs te /
translated: Although beings do not feel suffering, the ƒÅryas see it as suffering.

original: mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mdo las kyang /
translated: A s≈´tra states:

original: lag mthil spu nyag gcig gzhag pa //
analyzed: lag mthil spu nyag gcig gzhag pa //
translated: A single hair placed in the palm

original: mi rnams kyis ni mi rtogs la //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis ni mi rtogs la //
translated: is not felt by people.

original: mig tu song na de nyid kyis //
analyzed: mig tu song na de nyid kyis //
translated: But if it enters the eye, it causes

original: mi bde ba dang gnod bskyed bzhin //
analyzed: mi bde ba dang gnod bskyed bzhin //
translated: discomfort and harm.

original: byis pa dag ni lag mthil 'dra //
analyzed: byis pa dag ni lag mthil 'dra //
translated: The childish are like the palm of the hand;

original: 'du byed sdug bsngal spu mi rtogs //
analyzed: 'du byed sdug bsngal spu mi rtogs //
translated: they do not feel the hair of the suffering of formations.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni mig dang 'dra //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni mig dang 'dra //
translated: The wise are like the eye;

original: de yis shin tu yid kyang 'byung //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de yis shin tu yid kyang 'byung // zhes gsungs te /
translated: they are greatly disturbed by it.

original: byis pa dag ni mnar med pa'i phung po la yang sdug bsngal gyi blo mi 'byung gi /
analyzed: byis pa dag ni mnar med pa'i phung po la yang sdug bsngal gyi blo mi 'byung gi /
translated: The childish do not feel the suffering of the aggregates of the Avƒ´ci hell.

original: 'phags pa dag ni srid pa'i rtse mo la yang sdug bsngal gyi blo 'jug pas de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab par bstan to //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag ni srid pa'i rtse mo la yang sdug bsngal gyi blo 'jug pas de ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis khyab par bstan to //
translated: Noble beings apply the idea of suffering to the peak of existence, thus it is taught that the peak of existence is pervaded by the suffering of contaminated formations.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three incalculable eons?

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas sa dang po'i par du gcig / sa dang po nas sa brgyad pa'i bar du gcig / sa brgyad pa nas sa bcu pa'i bar du gcig go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas sa dang po'i par du gcig / sa dang po nas sa brgyad pa'i bar du gcig / sa brgyad pa nas sa bcu pa'i bar du gcig go zhes bya ba la /
translated: One incalculable eon is from the stage of resolute conduct up to the first bodhisattva level, one is from the first level up to the eighth level and one is from the eighth level up to the tenth level.

original: bskal pa'i dang po ni tshe dpag tu med pa nas @264b bri nas brgyad khrir gyur pa nas bzung ste rim gyis mi'i tshe lo bcu'i bar du mar bri ba ste /
analyzed: bskal pa'i dang po ni tshe dpag tu med pa nas @264b bri nas brgyad khrir gyur pa nas bzung ste rim gyis mi'i tshe lo bcu'i bar du mar bri ba ste /
translated: The first eon is from the time when the human lifespan is immeasurable until it decreases to eighty thousand years and then gradually decreases to ten years.

original: bar gyi bskal pa gcig go //
analyzed: bar gyi bskal pa gcig go //
translated: That is one intermediate eon.

original: de nas yang tshe lo brgyad khrir gyur la slar yang bri ba'i rim gyis tshe lo bcu par gyur pa'i bar de ni yar skye ba dang mar bri ba'i bar gyi bskal pa gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yang tshe lo brgyad khrir gyur la slar yang bri ba'i rim gyis tshe lo bcu par gyur pa'i bar de ni yar skye ba dang mar bri ba'i bar gyi bskal pa gnyis pa ste /
translated: Then the lifespan increases to eighty thousand years and again decreases to ten years. That is the second intermediate eon of increase and decrease.

original: de lta bu bco brgyad dang de'i tha ma yang tshe lo bcu nas brgyad khrir yar skye ba'i bskal pa gcig dang / dang po mar 'grib pa'i bskal pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu bco brgyad dang de'i tha ma yang tshe lo bcu nas brgyad khrir yar skye ba'i bskal pa gcig dang / dang po mar 'grib pa'i bskal pa ste /
translated: one eon of decrease from eighty thousand years to ten years,

original: de lta bu bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten 'chags so //
analyzed: de lta bu bar gyi bskal pa nyi shur 'jig rten 'chags so //
translated: twenty such intermediate eons of formation,

original: nyi shur gnas so //üîΩnyi shur 'jig go //
analyzed: nyi shur gnas so // nyi shur 'jig go //
translated: twenty such intermediate eons of endurance,üîΩtwenty such intermediate eons of destruction,

original: nyi shur stongs te /
analyzed: nyi shur stongs te /
translated: and twenty such intermediate eons of emptiness.

original: bar gyi bskal ba brgyad cu la bskal ba chen po gcig ces bya ste /
analyzed: bar gyi bskal ba brgyad cu la bskal ba chen po gcig ces bya ste /
translated: Eighty of these intermediate eons are called one great eon.

original: de lta bu bgrang ba'i mtha' las 'das pa ni bskal ba grangs med pa gcig ste /
analyzed: de lta bu bgrang ba'i mtha' las 'das pa ni bskal ba grangs med pa gcig ste /
translated: Beyond the limit of counting such eons is one incalculable eon.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang / sa brgyad man chad dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du 'od man chad du bskal pa de lta bu re re thogs par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa dang / sa brgyad man chad dang / sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du 'od man chad du bskal pa de lta bu re re thogs par go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: One incalculable eon is required for the stage of action in faith, for the first eight stages, and for the stage of Universal Light of the buddha stage.

original: gang zag gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three individuals?

original: the tshom can gyi gang zag dang / log par shes pa'i gang zag dang / mi shes pa'i gang zag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: the tshom can gyi gang zag dang / log par shes pa'i gang zag dang / mi shes pa'i gang zag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are the individual with doubt, the individual with wrong understanding, and the individual without understanding.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa yin nam 'on te ma yin snyam du sems ma nges pa ni the tshom can gyi gang zag go //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa yin nam 'on te ma yin snyam du sems ma nges pa ni the tshom can gyi gang zag go //
translated: The person who is uncertain, who thinks, ‚ÄúAre the characteristics of the Dharma impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self, or are they not?‚Äù is a person who is doubtful.

original: chos rnams rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang ba dang / bdag yod par nges par 'dzin pa ni log par shes pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: chos rnams rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang ba dang / bdag yod par nges par 'dzin pa ni log par shes pa'i gang zag go //
translated: The person who definitely grasps the dharmas as permanent, blissful, pure, and having a self is a person with wrong understanding.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa la sogs pa gang gi rgyus kyang mi shes pa ni mi shes pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa la sogs pa gang gi rgyus kyang mi shes pa ni mi shes pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: The person who does not understand the characteristics of the dharmas as impermanent, permanent, and so on, for any reason, is called a person who is ignorant.

original: ma 'dres pa'i nye bar gzhag pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i nye bar gzhag pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three unmixed applications?

original: gus par nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa dang / gus par mi nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa dang / gus pa nyan pa dang gus par mi nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa'o zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: gus par nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa dang / gus par mi nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa dang / gus pa nyan pa dang gus par mi nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa'o zhes bya ba las /
translated: They are: having an impartial mind towards those who listen respectfully, having an impartial mind towards those who do not listen respectfully, and having an impartial mind towards those who both listen respectfully and do not listen respectfully.

original: skye bo dang nyan thos dag la med kyi sangs rgyas nyi tshe la mnga' ba ni ma 'dres pa'i nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skye bo dang nyan thos dag la med kyi sangs rgyas nyi tshe la mnga' ba ni ma 'dres pa'i nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The unshared applications are not found in ordinary beings and sravakas, but are possessed only by the Buddha.üîΩThey are as follows. Even if disciples respectfully generate devotion and service and listen to the Dharma with enthusiasm, he is not particularly pleased. Thus he has an attitude of impartiality toward those who listen with devotion.üîΩEven if they are not respectful, he does not have a bad attitude or aversion toward them. Thus he has an attitude of impartiality toward those who do not listen with devotion.

original: de yang slob ma 'khor gus pa dang rim gro bskyed de 'grus par chos nyan na yang lhag par dga' ba yang med pas gus par nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa'o zhes pa med cing gyong ste rim gro chung ba dang chos @265a * //
analyzed: de yang slob ma 'khor gus pa dang rim gro bskyed de 'grus par chos nyan na yang lhag par dga' ba yang med pas gus par nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa'o zhes pa med cing gyong ste rim gro chung ba dang chos @265a * //
translated: Sometimes he is enthusiastic about devotion, service and listening to the Dharma.üîΩSometimes he is not enthusiastic.

original: nyan du mi btub na yang ngan sems dang zhe sdang mi 'byung bas na gus par mi nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: nyan du mi btub na yang ngan sems dang zhe sdang mi 'byung bas na gus par mi nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa'o //
translated: Even if they are not respectful, he does not have a bad attitude or aversion toward them. Thus he has an attitude of impartiality toward those who do not listen with devotion.

original: bar bar gus shing rim gro dang chos nyan pa la 'grus /
analyzed: bar bar gus shing rim gro dang chos nyan pa la 'grus /
translated: Sometimes he is enthusiastic about devotion, service and listening to the Dharma.üîΩSometimes he is not enthusiastic.üîΩEven if they are not respectful, he does not have a bad attitude or aversion toward them. Thus he has an attitude of impartiality toward those who do not listen with devotion.üîΩSometimes he is enthusiastic about devotion, service and listening to the Dharma.

original: bar bar mi 'grus te /
analyzed: bar bar mi 'grus te /
translated: Sometimes he is not enthusiastic.üîΩEven if they are not respectful, he does not have a bad attitude or aversion toward them. Thus he has an attitude of impartiality toward those who do not listen with devotion.üîΩSometimes he is enthusiastic about devotion, service and listening to the Dharma.üîΩSometimes he is not enthusiastic.üîΩEven if they are not respectful, he does not have a bad attitude or aversion toward them. Thus he has an attitude of impartiality toward those who do not listen with devotion.üîΩSometimes he is enthusiastic about devotion, service and listening to the Dharma.

original: rim gro dang chos nyan du yang mi btub na /
analyzed: rim gro dang chos nyan du yang mi btub na /
translated: Sometimes he is not enthusiastic.üîΩEven if they are not respectful, he does not have a bad attitude or aversion toward them. Thus he has an attitude of impartiality toward those who do not listen with devotion.üîΩSometimes he is enthusiastic about devotion, service and listening to the Dharma.

original: de la yang gus pa'i tshe dga' ba yang mi skye /
analyzed: de la yang gus pa'i tshe dga' ba yang mi skye /
translated: Sometimes he is not enthusiastic.üîΩEven if they are not respectful, he does not have a bad attitude or aversion toward them. Thus he has an attitude of impartiality toward those who do not listen with devotion.üîΩSometimes he is enthusiastic about devotion, service and listening to the Dharma.üîΩSometimes he is not enthusiastic.

original: mi gus pa la khro ba yang mi 'byung ba ni gus par nyan pa dang / gus par mi nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi gus pa la khro ba yang mi 'byung ba ni gus par nyan pa dang / gus par mi nyan pa rnams la sems snyoms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not being angry with those who show disrespect is called ‚Äúhaving an attitude of impartiality toward those who listen respectfully and those who do not.‚Äù

original: gtong ba'i khyad par gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gtong ba'i khyad par gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds of generosity that are distinctive?

original: gtong ba ni zang zing sbyin pa dang / bu smad sbyin pa dang / srog dang lus sbyin pa'o zhes pa la /
analyzed: gtong ba ni zang zing sbyin pa dang / bu smad sbyin pa dang / srog dang lus sbyin pa'o zhes pa la /
translated: Generosity is giving material things, giving one‚Äôs wife and children, and giving one‚Äôs life and body.

original: skye bo rnams ni phyug cing bdog na yang mi gces pa las bu dang gnyen rtsa tsam nyi tshe la gtong gi /
analyzed: skye bo rnams ni phyug cing bdog na yang mi gces pa las bu dang gnyen rtsa tsam nyi tshe la gtong gi /
translated: Even though people are rich and have possessions, they give only a little to their children and relatives, who are not dear to them.

original: mi bdog gam yang na bdog kyang gces pa dag gzhan la mi ster gyi /
analyzed: mi bdog gam yang na bdog kyang gces pa dag gzhan la mi ster gyi /
translated: They do not give to others, who are dear to them, if they do not have possessions, or even if they have possessions.

original: 'phags pa dag ni gces pa yang mi phongs par sems can thams cad la gtong la mi bdog na lus dang srog kyang gtong bas na gtong ba'i khyad par gsum ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag ni gces pa yang mi phongs par sems can thams cad la gtong la mi bdog na lus dang srog kyang gtong bas na gtong ba'i khyad par gsum ste /
translated: But the noble give even what is dear to them to all sentient beings, without being poor. And if they do not have it, they give their bodies and lives. Thus, there are three kinds of generosity that are distinctive.

original: 'phral gyi bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / yun gyi zong gser dngul dang gos zas dag sbyin pa ni zang zing sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phral gyi bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / yun gyi zong gser dngul dang gos zas dag sbyin pa ni zang zing sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving food and drink for the moment, and giving gold, silver, clothes, and food for a long time is giving material things.

original: bu dang chung ma dang bran dang 'khor dang las thabs rgyal srid man chad gtong ba ni bu smad sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bu dang chung ma dang bran dang 'khor dang las thabs rgyal srid man chad gtong ba ni bu smad sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving one's children, wife, servants, retinue, workers, and kingdom is the giving of one's family.

original: mgo dang rkang lag dang / sha khrag dang lus kyi srog man chad gtong ba ni srog dang lus sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mgo dang rkang lag dang / sha khrag dang lus kyi srog man chad gtong ba ni srog dang lus sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving one's head, legs, arms, flesh, blood, and even one's life is the giving of one's life and body.

original: chos kyi mdo bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi mdo bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four summaries of the Dharma?

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: They are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self.

original: de yang phyi nang gi chos thams cad kyi don tshig 'di bzhir 'dus pas na chos kyi mdo bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang phyi nang gi chos thams cad kyi don tshig 'di bzhir 'dus pas na chos kyi mdo bzhi ste /
translated: Since the meaning of all outer and inner phenomena is included in these four words, they are the four summaries of the Dharma.

original: de la mtshan nyid gsum dang yang sbyar te /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid gsum dang yang sbyar te /
translated: They are also applied to the three natures.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtag tu med pas na mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtag tu med pas na mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Since the imagined nature is always nonexistent, it is impermanent.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gzhi yin pas na sdug bsngal pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gzhi yin pas na sdug bsngal pa'o //
translated: Since the dependent nature is the basis of all suffering, it is suffering.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la ni chos su gdags pa'i dngos po med pas na stong pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid la ni chos su gdags pa'i dngos po med pas na stong pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the perfected is empty because there is no entity that can be designated as a phenomenon.

original: gang zag tu gdags pa'i dngos po med pas na bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag tu gdags pa'i dngos po med pas na bdag med pa'o //
translated: It is selfless because there is no entity that can be designated as a person.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mos pas spyod pa'i cha bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mos pas spyod pa'i cha bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four aspects of the bodhisattva's conduct of devoted interest?

original: snang ba mched pa dang / de kho na nyid gyi don la phyogs gcig pa dang / bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snang ba mched pa dang / de kho na nyid gyi don la phyogs gcig pa dang / bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are: the attainment of light, the one-sided aspect of the meaning of thatness, and uninterrupted meditative concentration.

original: de yang @265b dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga bsgom pa'i dus na gcig tu dge ba'i phyogs la lhag par mos shing gzhol te 'bad rtsol dang bcas pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i cha bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang @265b dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga bsgom pa'i dus na gcig tu dge ba'i phyogs la lhag par mos shing gzhol te 'bad rtsol dang bcas pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i cha bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, when one cultivates the five faculties and the five powers, one's devoted interest in the virtuous group of phenomena is one-sided, and one is endowed with effort.

original: de la phyi nang gi chos la ming du btags pa'i ming thams cad sgyu ma tsam du shes pa'i shes rab skyes pa ni snang ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyi nang gi chos la ming du btags pa'i ming thams cad sgyu ma tsam du shes pa'i shes rab skyes pa ni snang ba thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of light is the arising of the wisdom that knows all names designated for inner and outer phenomena to be mere illusions.

original: ming de dag gis brjod pa'i don gyi dngos po la sgyu ma tsam du med pa'i shes rab skyes pa ni snang ba mched pa'o //
analyzed: ming de dag gis brjod pa'i don gyi dngos po la sgyu ma tsam du med pa'i shes rab skyes pa ni snang ba mched pa'o //
translated: The arising of the wisdom that the entities which are the referents of those names are merely illusory is the increase of appearance.

original: chos rnams kyi ming de dag stong pa nyid du shes pa'i shes rab skyes pa ni de kho na nyid kyi don la phyogs gcig pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ming de dag stong pa nyid du shes pa'i shes rab skyes pa ni de kho na nyid kyi don la phyogs gcig pa'o //
translated: The arising of the wisdom that those names of phenomena are emptiness is the partial concordance with the meaning of thatness.

original: ming de dag gis brjod pa'i don gyi chos thams cad stong pa nyid du shes pa'i sher rab skyes pa ni de ma thag tu sa dang po gnon pas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming de dag gis brjod pa'i don gyi chos thams cad stong pa nyid du shes pa'i sher rab skyes pa ni de ma thag tu sa dang po gnon pas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of the wisdom that all phenomena which are the referents of those names are emptiness is the uninterrupted samƒÅdhi that immediately conquers the first ground.

original: nyan thos kyi cha bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi cha bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four aspects of the ≈õrƒÅvakas?

original: drod dang / spyi bo dang bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya ba'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: drod dang / spyi bo dang bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya ba'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are called heat, peak, forbearance, and the supreme mundane state.

original: cha bzhi ni gong ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: cha bzhi ni gong ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: The four aspects are the same as above.

original: dbang po dang stobs kyi dus na dge ba la mos shing 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang stobs kyi dus na dge ba la mos shing 'dun pa'o //
translated: At the time of the powers, one is devoted to and interested in virtue.

original: de yang dper na gtsub shing gis me 'byin pa na me'i snga ltas dro ba dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa bsregs pa'i ye shes me dang 'dra ba 'byung bas na drod ces bya /
analyzed: de yang dper na gtsub shing gis me 'byin pa na me'i snga ltas dro ba dang 'dra bar nyon mongs pa bsregs pa'i ye shes me dang 'dra ba 'byung bas na drod ces bya /
translated: Furthermore, just as when one produces fire by rubbing sticks together, heat is the precursor of fire, so too, since the wisdom that burns the afflictions, which is like fire, arises, it is called heat.

original: de nas dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyen po'i phyogs mthu skyes nas mi mthun pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba'i sar phyin pas na spyi bo zhes bya /
analyzed: de nas dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyen po'i phyogs mthu skyes nas mi mthun pa'i dbang du mi 'gro ba'i sar phyin pas na spyi bo zhes bya /
translated: Then, when the roots of virtue, which are the antidotes, have gained strength and one has reached the stage of not being subject to the afflictions, it is called the peak.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa'i don stong pa nyid la yid ches nas de la dga' ba skyes pa ni bzod pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa'i don stong pa nyid la yid ches nas de la dga' ba skyes pa ni bzod pa zhes bya /
translated: When one has confidence in the meaning of the selflessness of persons, which is emptiness, and one gives rise to joy in that, it is called acceptance.

original: 'di man chad 'jig rten gyi dge ba yin te mthong bsgom gyi nyon mongs pa ma spangs kyang rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa 'phags pa'i sa 'dis gnon te /
analyzed: 'di man chad 'jig rten gyi dge ba yin te mthong bsgom gyi nyon mongs pa ma spangs kyang rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa 'phags pa'i sa 'dis gnon te /
translated: From here on, it is mundane virtue. Although the afflictions of the paths of seeing and meditation have not been abandoned, one treads on the grounds of the ƒÅryas, such as the path of seeing.

original: 'jig rten pa gzhan las gtso bor gyur pas na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa gzhan las gtso bor gyur pas na 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is superior to other mundane [virtues], it is called the supreme mundane dharmas.

original: ye shes bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four types of wisdom?

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mirror-like primordial wisdom, primordial wisdom of equality, primordial wisdom of individual discernment, and primordial wisdom of accomplishing activities.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yang go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa yang go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The primordial wisdoms are the purified dharmadhatu.

original: so so'i skye bo las sangs rgyas su grub nas rnam par shes pa brgyad gnas gyur pa ni ye shes bzhi ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo las sangs rgyas su grub nas rnam par shes pa brgyad gnas gyur pa ni ye shes bzhi ste /
translated: The eight consciousnesses of ordinary beings, once they have been purified and transformed into the state of buddhahood, become the four primordial wisdoms.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dri ma dag ste gnas gyur pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes so //üîΩnyon mongs pa'i yid bdag tu lta ba'i dri ma dag @266a * //üîΩste gnas gyur pa ni bdag dang gzhan du mi 'byed de mnyam pas na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dri ma dag ste gnas gyur pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes so // nyon mongs pa'i yid bdag tu lta ba'i dri ma dag @266a * // ste gnas gyur pa ni bdag dang gzhan du mi 'byed de mnyam pas na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The all-base consciousness, once it has been purified and transformed, becomes the mirror-like primordial wisdom.üîΩThe defiled mind consciousness, once it has been purified and transformed, becomes the primordial wisdom of equality, because it is free of the stain of the view of self and is therefore impartial, not distinguishing between self and others.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma dag ste gnas gyur ba ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma dag ste gnas gyur ba ni so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The mental consciousness, once it has been purified and transformed, becomes the primordial wisdom of individual discernment.

original: mig la sogs pa sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa chos sna tshogs la tha dad par rtog pa'i dri ma dag ste gnas gyur pa ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa chos sna tshogs la tha dad par rtog pa'i dri ma dag ste gnas gyur pa ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The mirror-like wisdom is the transformation of the five sense consciousnesses of eye, etc., which have the stain of discriminating various phenomena.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa phung po lnga'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa phung po lnga'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The purity of the realm of phenomena is the emptiness of the nature of the five aggregates, such as the form aggregate, etc.

original: ye shes dam pa'i yul du gzhag go //
analyzed: ye shes dam pa'i yul du gzhag go //
translated: It is posited as the object of sublime wisdom.

original: ye shes bzhi'i las gang zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes bzhi'i las gang zhe na /
translated: What are the functions of the four wisdoms?

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi las dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi las dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi las dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi las so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi las dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi las dang / so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi las dang / bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi las so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The function of mirror-like wisdom, the function of the wisdom of equality, the function of discriminating wisdom, and the function of all-accomplishing wisdom.

original: yul tha dad par 'jug cing dmigs pa ni ye shes kyi las te /
analyzed: yul tha dad par 'jug cing dmigs pa ni ye shes kyi las te /
translated: Engaging in and observing different objects is the function of wisdom.

original: de yang chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i don chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid la dmigs pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi las so //
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i don chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid la dmigs pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi las so //
translated: Moreover, observing the emptiness of the realm of phenomena, the meaning of non-duality of all phenomena, is the function of mirror-like wisdom.

original: bdag dang gzhan du dbyer med de /üîΩbdag gi don byas pa yang sems can gyi don yin la /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du dbyer med de / bdag gi don byas pa yang sems can gyi don yin la /
translated: The nondifferentiation of self and otherüîΩis the activity of the wisdom of equality.

original: sems can gyi don byas pa yang bdag gi don yin par dmigs pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi las so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byas pa yang bdag gi don yin par dmigs pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi las so //
translated: The activity of discerning wisdom is

original: chos thams cad kyi spyi dang rang gi mtshan phyin ci ma log par gtan la 'bebs pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi las so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spyi dang rang gi mtshan phyin ci ma log par gtan la 'bebs pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyi las so //
translated: to ascertain without error the general and specific characteristics of all phenomena.üîΩThe activity of all accomplishing wisdom is

original: sems can gyi don bya ba thams cad thabs sna tshogs kyis sgrub cing sprul pa'i las byed pa ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi las so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba thams cad thabs sna tshogs kyis sgrub cing sprul pa'i las byed pa ni bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi las so //
translated: to accomplish all the aims of beings through various means and to perform emanations.

original: dgongs pa bzhi gang zhe na /üîΩmnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa dang / dus gzhan la dgongs pa dang / don gzhan la dgongs pa dang / gang zag gzhan la dgongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'phral du go ba dang don du sbyar ba tha dad kyang /
analyzed: dgongs pa bzhi gang zhe na / mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa dang / dus gzhan la dgongs pa dang / don gzhan la dgongs pa dang / gang zag gzhan la dgongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'phral du go ba dang don du sbyar ba tha dad kyang /
translated: What are the four intentions?üîΩThe intention of equality, the intention of another time, the intention of another meaning, and the intention of another person.

original: tshig gcig gis 'gal ba med par ston te /
analyzed: tshig gcig gis 'gal ba med par ston te /
translated: These are different from the immediate understanding and the ultimate meaning.

original: thabs de lta bus sems can dag 'dul bar 'gyur ba ni dgongs pa bzhi zhes bya pa ste /üîΩde yang 'das pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sh'akya thub pa gnyis chos kyi sku dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / sems can gyi don gyi phrin las mdzad pa rnams che chung mi mnga' ba'i sgo nas sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas @266b snga ma 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyang nga nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa ni mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs de lta bus sems can dag 'dul bar 'gyur ba ni dgongs pa bzhi zhes bya pa ste / de yang 'das pa'i sangs rgyas dang / sh'akya thub pa gnyis chos kyi sku dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang / sems can gyi don gyi phrin las mdzad pa rnams che chung mi mnga' ba'i sgo nas sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas @266b snga ma 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyang nga nyid yin no zhes gsungs pa ni mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The four intentions are as follows:üîΩThe intention of sameness is illustrated by the fact that the present Buddha Shakyamuni and the buddhas of the past are the same in their dharmakaya, their accumulations of merit and wisdom and their activities for beings' benefit, in that they are neither greater nor smaller.üîΩThe intention of different inclinations refers to the fact that the same thing can be perceived in different ways by different people.üîΩThe intention of other times is illustrated by the fact that the Buddha said, ‚ÄúI myself was the buddha Kashyapa.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas 'od dpag med dang spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la sogs pa sangs rgyas gcig tsam gyi mtshan brjod pa tsam gyis kyang 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang des 'phral du 'tshang rgya ba min gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'od dpag med dang spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la sogs pa sangs rgyas gcig tsam gyi mtshan brjod pa tsam gyis kyang 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang des 'phral du 'tshang rgya ba min gyi /
translated: The intention of other levels refers to the fact that the same thing can be perceived in different ways by the same person at different times.

original: rgyu de tsam la brten te bsgrubs na nam zhig 'tshang rgya ba dang / smon lam btab na de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang 'phral du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rgyu de tsam la brten te bsgrubs na nam zhig 'tshang rgya ba dang / smon lam btab na de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang 'phral du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: But it is not said that it will be just so immediately.

original: nam zhig na rgyur 'gyur bas na dus gzhan la dngos pa'o //
analyzed: nam zhig na rgyur 'gyur bas na dus gzhan la dngos pa'o //
translated: It is said that one will become a cause at some time, and so it is a thing at another time.üîΩIt is said that if one has not served as many Buddhas as there are grains of sand in the Ganges, one will not hear this Sutra.

original: sangs rgyas gang g'a snyed la bsnyen bkur ma byas na mdo sde 'di thos par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'phral du mthong ba tsam la mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gang g'a snyed la bsnyen bkur ma byas na mdo sde 'di thos par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'phral du mthong ba tsam la mi bya'o //
translated: But this should not be taken to mean that one will not hear it immediately, just by seeing it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po thob pa la bya bas na don gzhan la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po thob pa la bya bas na don gzhan la dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is said that one will not hear it until one has attained the first Bodhisattva stage.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs gang la dad cing nus pa de la bsngags te spyod du gzhug pa dang / yang na tshul khrims bsrung ba nyi tshes chog go snyam du sems pa la dge ba gzhan yang byed du gzhug pa'i phyir tshul khrims smad la sbyin pa bsngags pa la sogs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs gang la dad cing nus pa de la bsngags te spyod du gzhug pa dang / yang na tshul khrims bsrung ba nyi tshes chog go snyam du sems pa la dge ba gzhan yang byed du gzhug pa'i phyir tshul khrims smad la sbyin pa bsngags pa la sogs te /
translated: Or else, if one thinks that it is sufficient to merely guard morality, one should have that person practice other virtues.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa kun la sbyor ba ni gang zag gzhan la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa kun la sbyor ba ni gang zag gzhan la dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention of others refers to the application of all the perfections.

original: ldem por dgongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ldem por dgongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is indirect intention?

original: gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa dang / mtshan nyid la ldem por dgongs pa dang / gnyen po la ldem por dgongs pa dang / bsgyur ba la ldem por dgongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshig nges pa ma yin yang drang du rung ba tsam la dgongs nas gzhan dag bkri ba'i thabs su gsungs pa ni ldem por dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa dang / mtshan nyid la ldem por dgongs pa dang / gnyen po la ldem por dgongs pa dang / bsgyur ba la ldem por dgongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshig nges pa ma yin yang drang du rung ba tsam la dgongs nas gzhan dag bkri ba'i thabs su gsungs pa ni ldem por dgongs pa ste /
translated: It is the teaching of a method to lead others, intending merely to guide those who are not ready for the definitive meaning.

original: mu stegs pa dag bdag yod dam med ces 'di na /
analyzed: mu stegs pa dag bdag yod dam med ces 'di na /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas ask, ‚ÄúDoes the self exist or not?‚Äù

original: sems can gyi rgyun skad cig ma 'am rdzus te skye ba'i sems can dag yod pa tsam la brten nas bdag yod do zhes bya ba dang / nyan thos dag chos kyi dngos po yod dam med ces 'dri na /
analyzed: sems can gyi rgyun skad cig ma 'am rdzus te skye ba'i sems can dag yod pa tsam la brten nas bdag yod do zhes bya ba dang / nyan thos dag chos kyi dngos po yod dam med ces 'dri na /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas ask, ‚ÄúDo the entities of phenomena exist or not?‚Äù
