original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod do zhes skye bo rnams theg pa chen po dang / bstan pa 'di la gzung cing mi skrag par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa ni gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag yod do zhes skye bo rnams theg pa chen po dang / bstan pa 'di la gzung cing mi skrag par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa ni gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha taught in order to attract beings to the MahƒÅyƒÅna and to the teaching, so that they would not be afraid of it.

original: chos thams cad dngos po yod dam med ces 'dri na /üîΩmtshan nyid gsum la dmigs nas med par 'dod pa la ni kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la bsams nas med ces @267a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po yod dam med ces 'dri na /üîΩmtshan nyid gsum la dmigs nas med par 'dod pa la ni kun du brtags pa'i mtshan nyid la bsams nas med ces @267a * //
translated: When asked, ‚ÄúDo all phenomena exist or not?‚ÄùüîΩThe Buddha taught that the imputed nature does not exist.

original: bstan te / yod par 'dod pa la ni gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis la dgongs nas yod ces bstan pa ni mtshan nyid de la ldem por dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bstan te / yod par 'dod pa la ni gzhan dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis la dgongs nas yod ces bstan pa ni mtshan nyid de la ldem por dgongs pa'o //
translated: The existence of the dependent and the real natures is taught with the intention of the existence of the perfected nature.

original: sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi gnyen por chos kyi sgo mo yang brgyad khri bzhi stong gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong gi gnyen por chos kyi sgo mo yang brgyad khri bzhi stong gsungs te /
translated: The teaching of the eighty-four thousand gateways of Dharma as antidotes to the eighty-four thousand afflictive propensities of sentient beings

original: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi gtsang ba la sems pa gsungs pa ni gnyen po la ldem por dgongs pa'o //üîΩpha bsad / ma bsad /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por mi gtsang ba la sems pa gsungs pa ni gnyen po la ldem por dgongs pa'o // pha bsad / ma bsad /
translated: is an indirect teaching of antidotes, such as the teaching of the contemplation of impurity as an antidote to desire.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas /
translated: The statement, If one kills one's father, kills one's mother,

original: dgra bcom pa bsad /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa bsad /
translated: kills an arhat,üîΩsplits the Sa·πÖgha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung na bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya'o zhes gsungs pa de dngos su sgra bzhin du bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung na bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya'o zhes gsungs pa de dngos su sgra bzhin du bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: or maliciously draws blood from a tathƒÅgata, one will attain unsurpassed enlightenment, is not to be taken literally.

original: ma rig pa'i dngos po med par shes pa ni ma bsad pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dngos po med par shes pa ni ma bsad pa'o //
translated: The killing of one's mother is the understanding that the entity of ignorance does not exist.

original: zhe sdang gi dngos po med par shes pa ni pa bsad pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi dngos po med par shes pa ni pa bsad pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that the object of hatred does not exist is the killing of a monk.

original: phung po lnga stong par bshig ste dngos po med pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen no //
analyzed: phung po lnga stong par bshig ste dngos po med pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen no //
translated: The knowledge that the five aggregates are empty and destroyed and do not exist is the schism of the order.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bag chags dang bcas pa dngos po med par shes pa ni dgra bcom pa bsad pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bag chags dang bcas pa dngos po med par shes pa ni dgra bcom pa bsad pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that the store-consciousness together with its propensities does not exist is the killing of an arhat.

original: chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid du shes rab kyis rtogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la khrag phyung ba zhes ming bsgyur ba dang / yang na snying po med la snying por rtog //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid du shes rab kyis rtogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la khrag phyung ba zhes ming bsgyur ba dang / yang na snying po med la snying por rtog //
translated: The realization by wisdom of the emptiness of the dharma-element is called ‚Äúshedding the blood of the Tathagata,‚Äù or ‚Äúthe misapprehension of the core of the insubstantial.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log la rab gnas shing //
analyzed: phyin ci log la rab gnas shing //
translated: The Bodhisattva who is established in the perverted,

original: nyon mongs kyis ni snyon smongs na //
analyzed: nyon mongs kyis ni snyon smongs na //
translated: who is obscured by the afflictions,

original: byang chub dam pa thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub dam pa thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs te /
translated: attains the supreme enlightenment.

original: mi g-yeng bar bsgom pa dang phyin ci log las bzlog par gnas pa dang / dka' ba sna tshogs kyis bka' thub spyad pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: mi g-yeng bar bsgom pa dang phyin ci log las bzlog par gnas pa dang / dka' ba sna tshogs kyis bka' thub spyad pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: This is to be applied in order to the meditation without distraction, the establishment in the opposite of the perverted, and the practice of the austerities through various hardships.

original: de lta bur spyad na 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba'i ming bsgyur ba ni bsgyur ba la ldem por dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur spyad na 'tshang rgya'o zhes bya ba'i ming bsgyur ba ni bsgyur ba la ldem por dgongs pa'o //
translated: The transformation of the name if one practices in that way, one will attain buddhahood is the indirect intention regarding transformation.

original: rigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four principles?

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / tshad ma'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / tshad ma'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The principle of dependence, the principle of efficacy, the principle of logical possibility, and the principle of reality.

original: 'jig rten na chos rnams kyi tshul ji ltar srid pa bzhin du 'byung ba ni rigs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na chos rnams kyi tshul ji ltar srid pa bzhin du 'byung ba ni rigs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The way things are in the world is called a principle, since it occurs as it is possible.

original: de yang mig gi rnam par shes pa rang 'byung mi nus kyi /
analyzed: de yang mig gi rnam par shes pa rang 'byung mi nus kyi /
translated: Further, eye consciousness cannot arise by itself.üîΩIt is reasonable that it arises in dependence on the eye faculty and the object form.

original: mig gi dbang po dang yul gzugs gnyis la ltos nas 'byung bar rigs pa de bzhin du gzhan yang sbyar te /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang yul gzugs gnyis la ltos nas 'byung bar rigs pa de bzhin du gzhan yang sbyar te /
translated: The same applies to the others.

original: myu gu ni sa bon la ltos nas 'byung ba dang ma rig pa la ltos nas 'du byed 'byung ba la sogs pa ni ltos pa'i @267b rigs pa'o //
analyzed: myu gu ni sa bon la ltos nas 'byung ba dang ma rig pa la ltos nas 'du byed 'byung ba la sogs pa ni ltos pa'i @267b rigs pa'o //
translated: The principle of dependence is that a sprout arises in dependence on a seed and that formations arise in dependence on ignorance and so on.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa de byung nas gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba byed kyi /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa de byung nas gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba byed kyi /
translated: When that eye consciousness arises, it performs the action of seeing form.

original: sgra la mi nyan pa dang mig gi dbang pos kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed kyi /
analyzed: sgra la mi nyan pa dang mig gi dbang pos kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed kyi /
translated: The eye faculty produces eye consciousness, but not the ear consciousness, etc.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan mi skyed de /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan mi skyed de /
translated: The ear faculty produces ear consciousness, but not the eye consciousness, etc.

original: de bzhin du kun la sbyar te /üîΩnas kyi sa bon gyis nas nyid skyed kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun la sbyar te / nas kyi sa bon gyis nas nyid skyed kyi /
translated: The same applies to all the other faculties.üîΩThe seed of rice produces rice, but not other plants such as barley.

original: bra sran lta bu gzhan mi skyed pa dag ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa'o //
analyzed: bra sran lta bu gzhan mi skyed pa dag ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa'o //
translated: This is the principle of the performance of function.

original: 'thad pa sgrub pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: 'thad pa sgrub pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called the principle of proof of validity.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang / mngon sum dang lung gi tshad ma nges par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang / mngon sum dang lung gi tshad ma nges par gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is the establishment of the valid cognition of inference, direct perception, and scriptural testimony.

original: de la rjes su dpag pa ni du ba las mer shes pa dang / chu bya las chur shes pa dag go //
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa ni du ba las mer shes pa dang / chu bya las chur shes pa dag go //
translated: Among them, inference is, for example, knowing fire from smoke and knowing water from water fowl.

original: mngon sum ni rnam par shes pa drug gis mthong ba dang / rnal 'byor ba'i sems kyis mthong ba dag go //
analyzed: mngon sum ni rnam par shes pa drug gis mthong ba dang / rnal 'byor ba'i sems kyis mthong ba dag go //
translated: Direct perception is seeing with the six consciousnesses and seeing with the mind of a yogin.

original: lung ni mi slu ba'i tshig sangs rgyas kyi bka' lung zhal nas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: lung ni mi slu ba'i tshig sangs rgyas kyi bka' lung zhal nas gsungs pa ste /
translated: Scriptural testimony is the words of the Buddha, the infallible speech of the one who has spoken from his own experience.

original: de dag ni tshad ma'i rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni tshad ma'i rigs pa'o //
translated: These are the principles of valid cognition.

original: chu thur du 'bab pa dang nyi ma shar phyogs nas 'char ba dang / sa srab pa dang / chu gsher ba dang / me tsha ba dang / rlung yang ba la sogs pa ste stong pa dang bdag med pa lta bu spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid ye nas de ltar gnas pa dag ni chos nyid kyi rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chu thur du 'bab pa dang nyi ma shar phyogs nas 'char ba dang / sa srab pa dang / chu gsher ba dang / me tsha ba dang / rlung yang ba la sogs pa ste stong pa dang bdag med pa lta bu spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid ye nas de ltar gnas pa dag ni chos nyid kyi rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The downward flow of water, the rising of the sun in the east, the thinness of the earth, the fluidity of water, the heat of fire, the lightness of wind, and so on, as well as the universal and specific characteristics of emptiness and selflessness, which have always existed in that way, are called the reasoning of reality.

original: mkhyen pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: mkhyen pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four knowledges?

original: khams mkhyen pa dang / rang bzhin mkhyen pa dang / bsam par khyen pa dang / bag la nyal mkhyen pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: khams mkhyen pa dang / rang bzhin mkhyen pa dang / bsam par khyen pa dang / bag la nyal mkhyen pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are the knowledge of the elements, the knowledge of natures, the knowledge of intentions, and the knowledge of latent tendencies.

original: de la theg pa che chung rigs tha dad pa gang dang gang yin pa thugs su chud pa ni khams mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: de la theg pa che chung rigs tha dad pa gang dang gang yin pa thugs su chud pa ni khams mkhyen pa ste /
translated: Among them, the knowledge of the elements is the realization of the different vehicles of the Great and Lesser Vehicles.

original: khams dang / rigs dang / sa bon zhes bya ba kun don gcig go //
analyzed: khams dang / rigs dang / sa bon zhes bya ba kun don gcig go //
translated: The elements, natures, and seeds are all of the same meaning.

original: sems can dbang po rnon po dang / dbang po rtul po dang / dbang po 'bring po dag gi bye brag thugs su chud pa ni rang bzhin mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dbang po rnon po dang / dbang po rtul po dang / dbang po 'bring po dag gi bye brag thugs su chud pa ni rang bzhin mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the nature of beings consists of the knowledge of the differences of sharp, middling, and dull faculties.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bcu dag la sogs pa gang dang gang dag la dag la ba thugs su chud pa ni bsam pa mkhyen pa'o //üîΩdge ba dang mi dge ba'i sa bon dad pa dang brtson 'grus sam /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bcu dag la sogs pa gang dang gang dag la dag la ba thugs su chud pa ni bsam pa mkhyen pa'o // dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sa bon dad pa dang brtson 'grus sam /
translated: The knowledge of aspirations consists of the knowledge of the various aspirations of beings, such as the six perfections of generosity and so on, the ten perfections and so forth.üîΩThe knowledge of latent states consists of the knowledge of the greater or lesser seeds of virtue and nonvirtue, such as faith and diligence,

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i shas che chung ci yod pa thugs su chung ba ni bag la nyal mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i shas che chung ci yod pa thugs su chung ba ni bag la nyal mkhyen pa'o //
translated: or attachment and aversion, and so on.

original: skye gnas bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye gnas bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four birth processes?

original: mngal nas skye ba dang / sgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngal nas skye ba dang / sgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are birth from a womb, birth from an egg, birth from heat and moisture, and spontaneous birth.

original: de la mi dang phyugs lug dang / @268a * //
analyzed: de la mi dang phyugs lug dang / @268a * //
translated: Among them, humans, cattle, sheep,

original: gcan gzan la sogs pa ni phal cher mngal nas skye ba'o //
analyzed: gcan gzan la sogs pa ni phal cher mngal nas skye ba'o //
translated: wild animals and so on are mostly born from a womb.

original: bya dang nya dang sbal lcong dang rtsangs pa la sogs pa ni sgo nga las skye ba'o //
analyzed: bya dang nya dang sbal lcong dang rtsangs pa la sogs pa ni sgo nga las skye ba'o //
translated: Birds, fish, frogs, lizards, etc. are born from eggs.

original: 'bu srin dag ni drod gsher las skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'bu srin dag ni drod gsher las skye ba'o //
translated: Worms are born from heat and moisture.

original: mtho ris kyi lha rnams dang 'dre srin yi dags dmyal ba dag ni rdzus te skye ba'o //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi lha rnams dang 'dre srin yi dags dmyal ba dag ni rdzus te skye ba'o //
translated: Gods of the higher realms, demons, hungry ghosts, and hell beings are born spontaneously.

original: mtha' bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtha' bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four extremes?

original: yod pa'i mtha' dang / med pa'i mtha' dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa'i mtha' dang / yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa'i mtha'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod pa'i mtha' dang / med pa'i mtha' dang / yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa'i mtha' dang / yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa'i mtha'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The extreme of existence, the extreme of non-existence, the extreme of both existence and non-existence, and the extreme of neither existence nor non-existence.

original: phyi nang gi chos thams cad ni rdul dang mun pa snying stobs gsum las gyur pa yin pas yod pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi nang gi chos thams cad ni rdul dang mun pa snying stobs gsum las gyur pa yin pas yod pa yin te /
translated: All outer and inner phenomena arise from the three: rajas, tamas, and sattva. Therefore, they exist.

original: phyi rol gyi chos la sbyar na yang me tog la sogs pa sdug cing mdzes pa thams cad ni snying stobs shas che la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi chos la sbyar na yang me tog la sogs pa sdug cing mdzes pa thams cad ni snying stobs shas che la /
translated: When applied to outer phenomena, all that is beautiful and attractive, such as flowers, is predominantly sattva.

original: tsher ma dang ngam grog la sogs pa mi mdzes pa thams cad ni mun pa shas che'o //
analyzed: tsher ma dang ngam grog la sogs pa mi mdzes pa thams cad ni mun pa shas che'o //
translated: All that is unattractive, such as thorns and ravines, is predominantly tamas.

original: 'bru 'bras dang kha zas la sogs pa dag ni rdul las gyur ba'i shas che ba yin te yod do zhes zer ba ni yod pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'bru 'bras dang kha zas la sogs pa dag ni rdul las gyur ba'i shas che ba yin te yod do zhes zer ba ni yod pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The extreme of existence is to say that grains, rice, food, etc. exist, since they are composed of particles.

original: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dag las dang 'bras bu dang tshe snga phyi la sogs pa ci yang med do zhes zer ba ni med pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dag las dang 'bras bu dang tshe snga phyi la sogs pa ci yang med do zhes zer ba ni med pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The extreme of non-existence is to say that there is no karma, no effect, no past or future life, etc.

original: bdag rtag pa ni yod la yul dang dbang po la sogs pa 'byung ba'i grong khyer ni med do zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: bdag rtag pa ni yod la yul dang dbang po la sogs pa 'byung ba'i grong khyer ni med do zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The extreme of both existence and non-existence is to say that the self is permanent but that the city of the elements, sense faculties, etc. does not exist.

original: yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The extreme of neither existence nor non-existence is to say that the self is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: grangs can dag dper na gser gyi kha dog ni gar yang mi 'gyur te med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: grangs can dag dper na gser gyi kha dog ni gar yang mi 'gyur te med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that, for example, the color of gold does not change at all, but it is not nonexistent.

original: mgar bas brdungs na dbyibs gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur bas na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mgar bas brdungs na dbyibs gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur bas na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: When it is beaten by a goldsmith, it changes into one shape or another, so it is not existent.

original: de bzhin du bdag rtag pa de yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ba ni yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag rtag pa de yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ba ni yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa'i mtha'o //
translated: In the same way, that permanent self is like that.

original: rton pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rton pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four reliances?

original: don la rton par bya'i tshig 'bru la rton par mi bya'o //
analyzed: don la rton par bya'i tshig 'bru la rton par mi bya'o //
translated: One should rely on the meaning, not on the words.

original: chos la rton par bya'i gang zag la rton par mi bya'o //üîΩye shes la rton par bya'i rnam par shes pa la rton par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos la rton par bya'i gang zag la rton par mi bya'o // ye shes la rton par bya'i rnam par shes pa la rton par mi bya'o //
translated: One should rely on the teaching, not on the person.

original: nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton par bya'i //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton par bya'i //
translated: One should rely on the ultimate teaching, not on the interpretable teaching.üîΩOne should rely on the sutra of explicit meaning, not on the sutra of implicit meaning.

original: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la rton par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la nyams su blang zhing de dang mi 'bral bar brten cing 'dris par byed pa ni rton pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la rton par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la nyams su blang zhing de dang mi 'bral bar brten cing 'dris par byed pa ni rton pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Relying means to practice and not to be separated from it.

original: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi tshul byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nan tan du byed pa'i 'bras bu sems kyi sbyor ba skad cig @268b gis 'khor gsum yongs su dag cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du byed pa ni don te
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi tshul byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams nan tan du byed pa'i 'bras bu sems kyi sbyor ba skad cig @268b gis 'khor gsum yongs su dag cing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon du byed pa ni don te
translated: The meaning is the result of the practice of the factors of enlightenment, the transcendent way, which is the mental application that in one instant, by means of the three knowledges, purifies the three sectors and realizes the knowledge of a Omniscient One.

original: / de la rten par bya ba'o //
analyzed: / de la rten par bya ba'o //
translated: One should rely on that.

original: tshig 'bru ste /
analyzed: tshig 'bru ste /
translated: Words are the means of expression, the means of teaching.

original: 'jig rten gyi bya ba mang po la 'jug pa dang / yang na chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong gi bar du slob cing 'chad pa'i tshig dang yi ge'i rjes su 'brang ba dag ni don chung ngu yin pas de dag la ni rton par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bya ba mang po la 'jug pa dang / yang na chos kyi sgo mo brgyad khri bzhi stong gi bar du slob cing 'chad pa'i tshig dang yi ge'i rjes su 'brang ba dag ni don chung ngu yin pas de dag la ni rton par mi bya'o //
translated: The pursuit of many worldly activities and the study and teaching of the eighty-four thousand classes of Dharma that follow words and letters are of little meaning and therefore should not be relied upon.

original: rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul phyin ci ma log cing ma 'dres pa 'am /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul phyin ci ma log cing ma 'dres pa 'am /
translated: The unerring and unmixed teachings on the phenomena of complete purification and of the afflictions, in terms of their causes and effects,

original: don gyi mtshan nyid ma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa nges par ston pa'i gang zag ni su ci 'dra yang rung ste ;
analyzed: don gyi mtshan nyid ma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa nges par ston pa'i gang zag ni su ci 'dra yang rung ste ;
translated: or the teachings on the unarisen and unborn characteristics of the meaning, should be relied upon, regardless of who teaches them.

original: chos dang mi 'gal na brten par bya'i //
analyzed: chos dang mi 'gal na brten par bya'i //
translated: If they are not in contradiction with the Dharma, they should be relied upon.

original: gang zag ma brtags pa tam tom can chos dang mi mthun pa'i spyod pa can yin na rgyal po'i bu yang rung ste nye bar mi brten pa ni chos la rton par bya'i //
analyzed: gang zag ma brtags pa tam tom can chos dang mi mthun pa'i spyod pa can yin na rgyal po'i bu yang rung ste nye bar mi brten pa ni chos la rton par bya'i //
translated: If the person is not to be examined, and if he or she is a chatterbox whose conduct is not in accord with the Dharma, then even if it is the son of a king, one should not rely upon him.

original: gang zag la rton par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag la rton par mi bya'o //
translated: One should rely upon the Dharma and not upon the person.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid don dam par skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa chos dang gang zag bdag med par mkhyen pa ni ye shes te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid don dam par skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa chos dang gang zag bdag med par mkhyen pa ni ye shes te /
translated: Wisdom is the knowledge that the ultimate nature of all phenomena is that they are unborn and unceasing, and that there is no self in either phenomena or individuals.

original: de la brten zhing 'dris par byed la /
analyzed: de la brten zhing 'dris par byed la /
translated: One should rely on that and become familiar with it.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang dri la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la sogs pa'i rjes su song pa ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /üîΩde la ma chags mi gnas rten par mi byed pa ni ye shes la rton par bya'i //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang dri la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la sogs pa'i rjes su song pa ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste / de la ma chags mi gnas rten par mi byed pa ni ye shes la rton par bya'i //
translated: Consciousness is that which pursues the five sense objects such as form, sound, smell, and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa la rton par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la rton par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should rely on wisdom and not be attached to, dwell on, or rely on consciousness.

original: chos gang bstan pas zab cing rgya che ba'i don khong du chud par byed pa ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos gang bstan pas zab cing rgya che ba'i don khong du chud par byed pa ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde zhes bya ste /
translated: A sutra that teaches the profound and vast meaning is called a sutra of definitive meaning.üîΩOne should rely on that and become familiar with it.

original: de la brten zhing 'dris par byed kyi 'khor bas skyo ba dang kun rdzob la 'jug pa la sogs pa ston pa na drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde ste /
analyzed: de la brten zhing 'dris par byed kyi 'khor bas skyo ba dang kun rdzob la 'jug pa la sogs pa ston pa na drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde ste /
translated: A sutra that teaches such things as being weary of samsara and engaging with the conventional is a sutra of provisional meaning.

original: de dag la brten zhing 'dris par mi byed pa ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la brten zhing 'dris par mi byed pa ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde la rton par bya'o //
translated: One should rely on the sutras of definitive meaning, not on the sutras of interpretable meaning.

original: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la rton par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la rton par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should rely on the sutras of interpretable meaning, not on the sutras of definitive meaning.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four means of gathering?

original: sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are generosity, affectionate speech, beneficent conduct, and sameness of purpose.

original: za ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa lus kyi longs spyod ci dgos pas mgu bar byed pa ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: za ba dang bgo ba la sogs pa lus kyi longs spyod ci dgos pas mgu bar byed pa ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: Generosity is the pleasing of others by giving them whatever they need, such as food, clothing, etc.

original: sems mgu bar byas kyi 'og tu dam pa'i chos bstan zhing bshad de mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la 'dzud pa ni snyan par smra ba'o //üîΩtshig tu smra bar ma zad kyi bdag nyid smra ba dang mthun par nyams su len pa @269a * //
analyzed: sems mgu bar byas kyi 'og tu dam pa'i chos bstan zhing bshad de mi dge ba las bzlog cing dge ba la 'dzud pa ni snyan par smra ba'o // tshig tu smra bar ma zad kyi bdag nyid smra ba dang mthun par nyams su len pa @269a * //
translated: Affectionate speech is the teaching and explaining of the holy Dharma to those whose minds have been pleased, turning them away from non-virtue and setting them in virtue.

original: ni don spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ni don spyod pa'o //
translated: Beneficent conduct is the practice by oneself of what one has taught to others, not just the teaching.üîΩSameness of purpose is the performance of the four means of gathering oneself and the urging of others to perform them, with the thought, ‚ÄúI and others should perform these four means of gathering.‚Äù

original: gzhan la ji skad chos bstan pa de bzhin du bdag nyid kyang de dang mthun par byed la gzhan la yang byed du 'jug pa ni don mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ji skad chos bstan pa de bzhin du bdag nyid kyang de dang mthun par byed la gzhan la yang byed du 'jug pa ni don mthun pa'o //
translated: The common aim is to practice oneself and to make others practice the same Dharma that one teaches to others.

original: 'dus ma byas bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four unconditioned things?

original: so sor brtags te 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang ; nam mkha' dang de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so sor brtags te 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dang ; nam mkha' dang de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four unconditioned things are: 1) cessation due to deliberation, 2) cessation not due to deliberation, 3) space, 4) suchness.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi mtshan nyid gang gis kyang ma bskyed pas na 'dus ma byas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi mtshan nyid gang gis kyang ma bskyed pas na 'dus ma byas zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called unconditioned because they are not produced by causes and conditions.üîΩThe cessation due to deliberation is the non-entry of the five sense-objects, form, etc. into the five sense-faculties, eye, etc. when one has the idea: This is impermanent, This is suffering, This is empty, This is non-self.

original: de yang khams gsum pa'i chos 'di dag ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la ma chags mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de yang khams gsum pa'i chos 'di dag ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la ma chags mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: When one has the idea: The five sense-objects are impermanent, suffering, empty, non-self, one does not enter into the five sense-objects, form, etc.

original: de la ma zhugs na bag chags mi sogs shing 'bras bu mi 'byung ba ni so sor brtags te 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ma zhugs na bag chags mi sogs shing 'bras bu mi 'byung ba ni so sor brtags te 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one does not enter into them, the latent tendencies do not accumulate and the fruit does not arise. This is called cessation due to deliberation.

original: gzugs lta bu la rtog cing yengs pa'i dus na sgra dang dri la sogs pa byung yang de dag la ma brtags te /
analyzed: gzugs lta bu la rtog cing yengs pa'i dus na sgra dang dri la sogs pa byung yang de dag la ma brtags te /
translated: When one is distracted by conceptualizing form, etc., sound, smell, etc. arise, but they are not investigated.

original: 'das pas bag chags mi sogs shing 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'das pas bag chags mi sogs shing 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Since they are past, they do not accumulate propensities and do not produce results.

original: de bzhin du sgra la yengs pa ni gzugs la ma brtags pa la sogs pa ni shes rab kyis dpyad pa med pas so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la yengs pa ni gzugs la ma brtags pa la sogs pa ni shes rab kyis dpyad pa med pas so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, when one is distracted by sound, form, etc. are not investigated. Since there is no analysis by wisdom, it is called non-analytical cessation.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu lta bur skye 'byung med la gzhan gyis go 'byed pa ni nam mkha'/
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu lta bur skye 'byung med la gzhan gyis go 'byed pa ni nam mkha'/
translated: Space is the non-obstruction of the arising and origination of things, like cause and effect, by other things.

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu lta bu med pa ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu lta bu med pa ni de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The reality of phenomena, which is devoid of cause and effect, like cause and effect, is called thusness.

original: lung bstan pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: lung bstan pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of predictions?

original: mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa dang / rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa dang / dris nas lung bstan pa dang / gzhag pa'i lung bstan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa dang / rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa dang / dris nas lung bstan pa dang / gzhag pa'i lung bstan pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are: the prediction of identity, the prediction of analysis, the prediction of questioning, and the prediction of placement.

original: gzhan gyis dris pa'i lan nges par sbyin pa ni lung bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dris pa'i lan nges par sbyin pa ni lung bstan pa ste /
translated: Definitely giving an answer to questions asked by others is prediction.üîΩIf one asks, Do these sentient beings die or not?

original: de yang sems can 'di dag 'chi 'am mi 'chi zhes 'dri na sems can du gyur phan chad mi 'chi ba med de 'chi'o zhes bstan pa ni mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sems can 'di dag 'chi 'am mi 'chi zhes 'dri na sems can du gyur phan chad mi 'chi ba med de 'chi'o zhes bstan pa ni mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa'o //
translated: and one replies, As long as they are sentient beings, they do not not die, they will die, this is a prediction of one part.

original: sems can 'di dag skye 'am mi skye zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag skye 'am mi skye zhes 'dri na /
translated: If one asks, Are these sentient beings born or not?

original: nyon mongs pa zad na ni las kyi dbang gis khams gsum du mi skye ba yang yod do zhes bstan pa ni rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad na ni las kyi dbang gis khams gsum du mi skye ba yang yod do zhes bstan pa ni rnam par phye ste lung bstan pa'o //
translated: and one replies, If they exhaust their afflictions, they are not born in the three realms through the power of karma, this is a prediction of a distinction.

original: mi 'di dag mchog yin nam ma yin zhes 'dri na lha la ltos nas sam /
analyzed: mi 'di dag mchog yin nam ma yin zhes 'dri na lha la ltos nas sam /
translated: If one asks, Are these humans superior or not?

original: 'dre la ltos nas 'dri zhes dris nas lha la ltos nas zhes zer na mchog ma yin la 'dre la ltos nas zhes zer na mchog yin no zhes bstan pa ni dris nas lung @269b bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dre la ltos nas 'dri zhes dris nas lha la ltos nas zhes zer na mchog ma yin la 'dre la ltos nas zhes zer na mchog yin no zhes bstan pa ni dris nas lung @269b bstan pa'o //
translated: and one replies, If one asks in relation to gods or ghosts, and one replies, In relation to gods, they are not superior, but in relation to ghosts, they are superior, this is a prediction of a question.

original: sems can la bdag yod dam med ces 'dri na yod ces bstan du ni rang bzhin grub pa med la /
analyzed: sems can la bdag yod dam med ces 'dri na yod ces bstan du ni rang bzhin grub pa med la /
translated: If one asks sentient beings, ‚ÄúDo you have a self or not? ‚Äù one should not teach that they have a self, because they do not intrinsically exist.

original: med ces bstan du ni da ltar mngon sum du snang zhing 'dug pas ci yang mi bstan par gzhag pa ni gzhag pa'i lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: med ces bstan du ni da ltar mngon sum du snang zhing 'dug pas ci yang mi bstan par gzhag pa ni gzhag pa'i lung bstan pa'o //
translated: One should not teach that they do not have a self, because they appear and exist in the present.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five topics of knowledge?üîΩThey are inner science, scientific knowledge of the causes, the science of grammar, the science of healing, and the science of worldly crafts and occupations.

original: nang rig pa dang / rgyu rig pa dang / sgra rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / bzo rig pa'o zhes bya ba la shes rab kyis shes par bya ba'i yul mdor bsdu na lnga yod pas na rig pa'i gnas lnga'o //
analyzed: nang rig pa dang / rgyu rig pa dang / sgra rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / bzo rig pa'o zhes bya ba la shes rab kyis shes par bya ba'i yul mdor bsdu na lnga yod pas na rig pa'i gnas lnga'o //
translated: The five topics of knowledge are so called because there are five objects to be known by wisdom.

original: de yang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis shes pa ni nang rig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis shes pa ni nang rig pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the twelve branches of excellent speech is inner science.

original: tar ka 'am //
analyzed: tar ka 'am //
translated: Or, it is the science of grammar.

original: yang na phyi nang gi rten 'brel rgyu dang rkyen gang dang gang las 'bras bu ci dang ci 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan la mkhas pa ni rgyu rig pa'o //
analyzed: yang na phyi nang gi rten 'brel rgyu dang rkyen gang dang gang las 'bras bu ci dang ci 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan la mkhas pa ni rgyu rig pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the science of the causes, the inner and outer dependently arisen connections, from which whatever results arise.

original: by'a ka ra na'i skad la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: by'a ka ra na'i skad la mkhas pa ste /
translated: It is the science of the language of the treatises.

original: tshig gcig la don rnam pa bcur 'dren pa lta bu dag ni sgra rig pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig la don rnam pa bcur 'dren pa lta bu dag ni sgra rig pa'o //
translated: The science of grammar is the knowledge of the meaning of a single word having ten aspects, such as the meaning of the word itself.

original: lus kyi nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi lta bu'i gnyen po gang la gang phan pa'i sman dpyad la mkhas pa ni gso ba rig pa'o ;
analyzed: lus kyi nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi lta bu'i gnyen po gang la gang phan pa'i sman dpyad la mkhas pa ni gso ba rig pa'o ;
translated: The science of medicine is the knowledge of the various medical treatments that are the antidotes to the four hundred and four diseases of the body.

original: / bzo dang 'phong rtsal la sogs pa las su bya'o cog thabs sna tshogs la mkhas pa ni bzo rig pa'o //üîΩbstan bcos las kyang /
analyzed: / bzo dang 'phong rtsal la sogs pa las su bya'o cog thabs sna tshogs la mkhas pa ni bzo rig pa'o // bstan bcos las kyang /
translated: The science of arts and crafts is the knowledge of the various methods of all the activities of arts and crafts, such as metalwork and tailoring.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga dag la brtson par ma byas par /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga dag la brtson par ma byas par /
translated: A treatise on the five sciences says:üîΩEven the supreme ƒÅrya will not become omniscient

original: 'phags mchog gis kyang thams cad mkhyen nyid mi 'gyur te /üîΩde bas gzhan gang tshar gcod rjes su gzung phyir ram //

analyzed: rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / bstod pa dang / ma bstod pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bde ba dang / mi bde ba'o //
translated: They are gain and loss, fame and disgrace, praise and blame, pleasure and pain.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa 'phags pa rnams kyi dgongs pa ni ri rab dang 'dra bar rkyen gang gis kyang mi g-yo mi 'khrugs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa 'phags pa rnams kyi dgongs pa ni ri rab dang 'dra bar rkyen gang gis kyang mi g-yo mi 'khrugs pa yin gyi /
translated: The transcendent, noble intention is like Mount Meru, unshaken and unperturbed by any circumstance.

original: skye bo byis pa chung du 'dra ba rnams kyi sems ni 'dod pa'i rlung gis rtsi mchog bzhin du g-yengs te /
analyzed: skye bo byis pa chung du 'dra ba rnams kyi sems ni 'dod pa'i rlung gis rtsi mchog bzhin du g-yengs te /
translated: The minds of childish beings, however, are like the finest incense, scattered by the winds of desire.

original: phan yon dang nyes dmigs phran tshegs tsam gyi rkyen gyis kyang dga' ba dang mi dga' bar 'gyur ba'i bye brag la ni 'jig rten gyi chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phan yon dang nyes dmigs phran tshegs tsam gyi rkyen gyis kyang dga' ba dang mi dga' bar 'gyur ba'i bye brag la ni 'jig rten gyi chos zhes bya'o //
translated: They are delighted or displeased by the slightest benefit or harm, and this is called ‚Äúworldly dharmas.‚Äù

original: de la lhung bzed dam chos gos la sogs pa zang zing cung zad thob pas dga' bar gyur pa ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la lhung bzed dam chos gos la sogs pa zang zing cung zad thob pas dga' bar gyur pa ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGain‚Äù is to be delighted by obtaining a few material things, such as a begging bowl or Dharma robes.

original: zang zing de dag ma thob ste mi dga' ba ni ma rnyed pa'o //üîΩyon tan mngon sum du brjod pas dga' @278a * //
analyzed: zang zing de dag ma thob ste mi dga' ba ni ma rnyed pa'o // yon tan mngon sum du brjod pas dga' @278a * //
translated: ‚ÄúNo gain‚Äù is to be displeased by not obtaining those material things.

original: ba ni bstod pa'o //
analyzed: ba ni bstod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPraise‚Äù is to be delighted by someone speaking about one‚Äôs good qualities.

original: mngon sum du skyon brjod de sems la 'khrug pa ni ma bstod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du skyon brjod de sems la 'khrug pa ni ma bstod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo praise‚Äù is to be upset by someone speaking about one‚Äôs faults.

original: lkog tu yon tan brjod pa thos te dga' ba ni grags pa'o //
analyzed: lkog tu yon tan brjod pa thos te dga' ba ni grags pa'o //
translated: The fame is the joy one feels when one hears of the good qualities of others.

original: lkog tu skyon brjod pa thos te mi dga' ba ni ma grags pa'o //üîΩlus dang sems la dben pa nyams su myong ste /
analyzed: lkog tu skyon brjod pa thos te mi dga' ba ni ma grags pa'o // lus dang sems la dben pa nyams su myong ste /
translated: The disrepute is the displeasure one feels when one hears of the faults of others.

original: dga' ba ni bde ba'o //üîΩlus dang sems la gnod pa myong ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ni bde ba'o // lus dang sems la gnod pa myong ste /
translated: The pleasure is the experience of physical and mental comfort.

original: mi dga' ba ni mi bde ba ste /
analyzed: mi dga' ba ni mi bde ba ste /
translated: The displeasure is the experience of physical and mental discomfort.

original: chos brgyad po 'di dag gis mi gos par skye bo rnams kyis kyang btang snyoms su gnas par ci nus su bslab bo //
analyzed: chos brgyad po 'di dag gis mi gos par skye bo rnams kyis kyang btang snyoms su gnas par ci nus su bslab bo //
translated: One should train oneself to the best of one's ability to remain indifferent to all these eight worldly concerns, without being affected by them.

original: dgod pa bzhi'i ming la /
analyzed: dgod pa bzhi'i ming la /
translated: The four kinds of joy

original: theg pa la dgod pa dang / bde ba la dgod pa dang / rigs pa la dgod pa dang / chos la dgod pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa la dgod pa dang / bde ba la dgod pa dang / rigs pa la dgod pa dang / chos la dgod pa'o //
translated: The joy of the vehicle, the joy of happiness, the joy of reasoning, and the joy of Dharma.

original: de la dge ba bcu dang / bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag ni lha dang mi'i theg pa dang bden pa bzhi dang / rten 'brel bcu gnyis dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dag ni 'phags pa'i theg pa ste /
analyzed: de la dge ba bcu dang / bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag ni lha dang mi'i theg pa dang bden pa bzhi dang / rten 'brel bcu gnyis dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dag ni 'phags pa'i theg pa ste /
translated: The ten virtues and the concentrations and meditative absorptions are the joy of the vehicle of gods and humans. The four truths, the twelve links of dependent origination, and the levels and transcendent perfections are the joy of the noble vehicle.

original: theg pa de dag ston pa ni theg pa la dgod pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa de dag ston pa ni theg pa la dgod pa'o //
translated: To teach those vehicles is to establish in the vehicle.

original: chos thams cad skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa ni bden pa gcig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa ni bden pa gcig go //
translated: The non-arising and non-cessation of all phenomena is the one truth.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa ni bden pa gnyis so //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa ni bden pa gnyis so //
translated: The conventional and the ultimate are the two truths.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ni bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ni bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: Suffering, origination, cessation, and the path are the four truths.

original: de dag ston pa ni bden pa la 'god pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ston pa ni bden pa la 'god pa'o //
translated: To teach those is to establish in the truths.

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa dag ston pa ni rigs pa la dgod pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa dag ston pa ni rigs pa la dgod pa'o //
translated: To teach the reasoning of dependence, the reasoning of efficacy, the reasoning of logical possibility, and the reasoning of reality is to establish in reasoning.

original: gsung rab bcu gnyis 'jig rten du gzhag ste sde snod gsum du sdud cing ston pa ni chos la dgod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsung rab bcu gnyis 'jig rten du gzhag ste sde snod gsum du sdud cing ston pa ni chos la dgod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: To establish the twelve branches of scripture in the world, to collect them into the three baskets, and to teach them is called to establish in the Dharma.

original: nor bdun gyi ming la /
analyzed: nor bdun gyi ming la /
translated: The seven riches are:

original: dad pa'i nor dang / tshul khrims kyi nor dang / brtson 'grus kyi nor dang / khrel yod pa'i nor dang / thos pa'i nor dang / gtong ba'i nor dang / shes pa'i nor ro //
analyzed: dad pa'i nor dang / tshul khrims kyi nor dang / brtson 'grus kyi nor dang / khrel yod pa'i nor dang / thos pa'i nor dang / gtong ba'i nor dang / shes pa'i nor ro //
translated: The wealth of faith, the wealth of morality, the wealth of effort, the wealth of conscience, the wealth of shame, the wealth of learning, the wealth of generosity, and the wealth of wisdom.

original: de la las dang 'bras bu dang bde ba dang dkon mchog yod pa dang yon tan can du yid ches pa ni tshul khrims kyi rgyu ste ;
analyzed: de la las dang 'bras bu dang bde ba dang dkon mchog yod pa dang yon tan can du yid ches pa ni tshul khrims kyi rgyu ste ;
translated: Among these, confidence in karma and its effects, in happiness, in the Jewels, and in those who have good qualities is the cause of morality.

original: dad pa'i nor ro //
analyzed: dad pa'i nor ro //
translated: This is the wealth of faith.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdig pa mi dge ba spangs pa ni thar pa dang mtho ris su skye ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa sdig pa mi dge ba spangs pa ni thar pa dang mtho ris su skye ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: Abandoning evil and nonvirtue such as killing is the cause of being born in the higher realms and of liberation.

original: tshul khrims kyi nor ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi nor ro //
translated: This is the wealth of morality.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa rgyun mi gcod pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'phel pa'i rgu ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang sems pa dang bsgom pa rgyun mi gcod pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'phel pa'i rgu ste /
translated: Not interrupting listening to, reflecting on, and meditating on the excellent teaching is the cause of increasing the collections of merit and wisdom.

original: brtson @278b 'grus kyi nor ro //
analyzed: brtson @278b 'grus kyi nor ro //
translated: This is the wealth of effort.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos la bag byed cing 'dzin pa ni nyes pa mi 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos la bag byed cing 'dzin pa ni nyes pa mi 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: Being careful and restrained with regard to evil and nonvirtue is the cause of not committing faults.

original: khrel yod pa'i nor ro //
analyzed: khrel yod pa'i nor ro //
translated: This is the wealth of conscience.

original: dam pa'i chos la chog par mi 'dzin zhing mang du nyan pa ni bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab 'phel pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la chog par mi 'dzin zhing mang du nyan pa ni bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab 'phel pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Not being satisfied with the holy Dharma and listening to many teachings is the cause for increasing the wisdom of reflection and meditation.

original: thos pa'i nor ro //
analyzed: thos pa'i nor ro //
translated: This is the wealth of listening.

original: phyi nang gi dngos po ci bdog pa gzhan la sbyin pa ni longs spyod chen po 'byor ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: phyi nang gi dngos po ci bdog pa gzhan la sbyin pa ni longs spyod chen po 'byor ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: Giving to others whatever one has, both inner and outer things, is the cause for obtaining great wealth.

original: gtong ba'i nor ro //
analyzed: gtong ba'i nor ro //
translated: This is the wealth of giving.

original: bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis chos kyi don rtogs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis chos kyi don rtogs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The realization of the meaning of the Dharma through the wisdom of reflection and meditation is the cause for attaining nirvana.

original: shes pa'i nor ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i nor ro //
translated: This is the wealth of knowledge.

original: ci'i phyir nor zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nor zhe na /
translated: Why are they called wealth?

original: dgos pa thams cad mi 'byor pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa thams cad mi 'byor pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not lacking in any necessary means.üîΩIn the nine abodes of sentient beings, those with different bodies and different perceptions are the beings of the first dhyana who have just attained it, and the beings of the desire realm, including the gods.

original: sems can gyi gnas dgu la lus tha dad cing 'du shes kyang tha dad pa ni bsam gtan dang po thob ma thag pa bkol te bsam gtan dang po pa rnams dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can lha man chad ril ni lus kyang mi 'dra la /
analyzed: sems can gyi gnas dgu la lus tha dad cing 'du shes kyang tha dad pa ni bsam gtan dang po thob ma thag pa bkol te bsam gtan dang po pa rnams dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can lha man chad ril ni lus kyang mi 'dra la /
translated: Their bodies are not the same,

original: 'du shes kyang so sor mi 'dra bas /
analyzed: 'du shes kyang so sor mi 'dra bas /
translated: and their perceptions are also different.

original: lus tha dad cing 'du shes kyang tha dad ces bya'o //
analyzed: lus tha dad cing 'du shes kyang tha dad ces bya'o //
translated: Those who have different bodies and different perceptions are humans, some ghosts and all animals and hell beings.üîΩThose who have different bodies but the same ideation are Brahma and his retinue who arose in the first absorption previously and have different bodies, colors and shapes.

original: lus tha dad la 'du shes gcig pa ni bsam gtan dang por sngar skyes pa'i tshangs pa rnams ni lus dang kha dog che zhing bzang la tshangs pa phyi ma 'di dag ngas bskyed do snyam du sems la /
analyzed: lus tha dad la 'du shes gcig pa ni bsam gtan dang por sngar skyes pa'i tshangs pa rnams ni lus dang kha dog che zhing bzang la tshangs pa phyi ma 'di dag ngas bskyed do snyam du sems la /
translated: They think, I generated these Brahmas.

original: bsam tan dang po thob ma thag pa'i tshangs pa ni lus dang kha dog de bas ngan la /
analyzed: bsam tan dang po thob ma thag pa'i tshangs pa ni lus dang kha dog de bas ngan la /
translated: Brahmas who newly attain the first absorption have inferior bodies and colors.üîΩThey think, We were generated by Mahabrahma.

original: bdag cag ni tshangs pa chen pos bskyed do snyam du sems pas na lus tha dad la 'du shes gcig pa zhes bya'o //üîΩlus gcig la 'du shes tha dad pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa yan chad /
analyzed: bdag cag ni tshangs pa chen pos bskyed do snyam du sems pas na lus tha dad la 'du shes gcig pa zhes bya'o // lus gcig la 'du shes tha dad pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa yan chad /
translated: Therefore they are called those who have different bodies but the same ideation.üîΩThose who have the same body but different ideations are gods of the third absorption and below who abide in the second absorption and above.

original: gsum pa man chad la gnas pa'i lha rnams lus ni 'dra ste tshad gcig la /
analyzed: gsum pa man chad la gnas pa'i lha rnams lus ni 'dra ste tshad gcig la /
translated: Their bodies are similar and the same size.

original: 'du shes ni kha cig bde ba la gnas /
analyzed: 'du shes ni kha cig bde ba la gnas /
translated: Some gods abide in pleasure and some abide in equanimity.

original: kha cig btang snyoms la gnas pas lus gcig la 'du shes tha dad ces bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig btang snyoms la gnas pas lus gcig la 'du shes tha dad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore they are called those who have the same body but different ideations.üîΩThose who have the same body and the same ideation are gods of the fourth absorption.

original: lus gcig la 'du shes kyang gcig pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pa rnams kyi lus ni tshad kyang gcig la /
analyzed: lus gcig la 'du shes kyang gcig pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pa rnams kyi lus ni tshad kyang gcig la /
translated: In the fourth absorption, the bodies and ideation of beings are the same.

original: 'du shes kyang tshor ba btang snyoms dang ldan par 'dra ba'i phyir ro //üîΩnam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni /
analyzed: 'du shes kyang tshor ba btang snyoms dang ldan par 'dra ba'i phyir ro // nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni /
translated: The bodies of beings who abide in the fourth absorption are the same size.

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' tsam du zad la nam mkha' ni mtha' yas so snyam du sems pa'o //üîΩrnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas pa de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa de yang mtha' yas so snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' tsam du zad la nam mkha' ni mtha' yas so snyam du sems pa'o // rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas pa de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa de yang mtha' yas so snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: The base of infinite space is the ideation that all phenomena are merely space and that space is infinite.üîΩThe base of infinite consciousness is the ideation that consciousness is infinite because it focuses on all phenomena that are infinite like space.

original: @279a * // ci yang med pa'i skye mched ni chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas la de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mtha' yas na /
analyzed: @279a * // ci yang med pa'i skye mched ni chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas la de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa yang mtha' yas na /
translated: The base of nothingness is the ideation that consciousness is infinite because it focuses on all phenomena that are infinite like space.

original: de las ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan ci yod ces brtags na ci yang yod par ma mthong nas ci yang med do snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan ci yod ces brtags na ci yang yod par ma mthong nas ci yang med do snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: If one examines what other phenomena there are apart from that, one does not see that there is anything at all.üîΩThe sentient beings of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception think that all phenomena are exhausted in space, that there is nothing at all. That perception is also like a disease and a pain.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi sems can ni chos thams cad nam mkha' tsam du zad de ci yang med do snyam du sems pa'i 'du shes de yang nad dang zug rngu lta bu yin pas spang ngo zhes je phra je phrar bkag nas shin tu
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi sems can ni chos thams cad nam mkha' tsam du zad de ci yang med do snyam du sems pa'i 'du shes de yang nad dang zug rngu lta bu yin pas spang ngo zhes je phra je phrar bkag nas shin tu
translated: Having stopped that in a more and more subtle way,

original: phra bar gyur pa dang / 'du shes de gtan med par gyur na yang mi rung ngo snyam nas shin tu cha phra ba de tsam la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phra bar gyur pa dang / 'du shes de gtan med par gyur na yang mi rung ngo snyam nas shin tu cha phra ba de tsam la gnas pa'o //
translated: one thinks that it would not be right for that perception to be completely non-existent, and so one abides in that extremely subtle state.

original: rigs lnga la /
analyzed: rigs lnga la /
translated: The five families are as follows:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rigs ni bden pa bzhi mnyan zhing bsgoms pa'i bag chags rgyud la yod pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i rigs ni bden pa bzhi mnyan zhing bsgoms pa'i bag chags rgyud la yod pa'o //
translated: The family of the ≈õrƒÅvaka vehicle is the habitual tendency in the continuum of being to listen to and meditate on the four truths.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs ni rten cing 'brel ba mnyen zhing bsgoms pa'i bag chags yod pa'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i rigs ni rten cing 'brel ba mnyen zhing bsgoms pa'i bag chags yod pa'o //
translated: The family of the pratyekabuddha vehicle is the habitual tendency to listen to and meditate on dependent origination.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa'i rigs ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa mnyan zhing bsgoms pa'i bag chags yod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i theg pa'i rigs ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa mnyan zhing bsgoms pa'i bag chags yod pa'o //
translated: The family of the vehicle of the TathƒÅgatas is the instinct for listening to and cultivating the stages and perfections.

original: ma nges pa'i rigs ni theg pa che chung gsum char gyi chos mnyan zhing bsgoms pa'i bag chags 'dren mar yod pas gcig tu ma nges te /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i rigs ni theg pa che chung gsum char gyi chos mnyan zhing bsgoms pa'i bag chags 'dren mar yod pas gcig tu ma nges te /
translated: The undetermined family is the instinct for listening to and cultivating the teachings of the three vehicles, which is not fixed as one or the other.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang yang rung ste su snga ba'i phyogs la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang yang rung ste su snga ba'i phyogs la 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is the family that enters whichever vehicle it encounters first, whether the Great or Lesser Vehicle.

original: rigs med pa ni theg pa che chung gang gi chos la yang mnyan zhing bsgoms pa'i bag chags med pas yun ring por dge ba dang phrad pa'i skal ba med de ngan song na 'khyam pa'o //üîΩlam bzhi la /
analyzed: rigs med pa ni theg pa che chung gang gi chos la yang mnyan zhing bsgoms pa'i bag chags med pas yun ring por dge ba dang phrad pa'i skal ba med de ngan song na 'khyam pa'o // lam bzhi la /
translated: The rootless family is the family that lacks the instinct for listening to and cultivating the teachings of either the Great or Lesser Vehicle. For a long time it lacks the good fortune to encounter virtue. It wanders in evil destinies.

original: mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i lam dang / mngon par shes pa myur la dka' ba'i lam dang / mngon par shes pa bul la sla ba'i lam dang / mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i lam dang / mngon par shes pa myur la dka' ba'i lam dang / mngon par shes pa bul la sla ba'i lam dang / mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam mo //
translated: The four paths are: the path that is difficult and slow in higher knowledge; the path that is easy and slow in higher knowledge; the path that is difficult and quick in higher knowledge; and the path that is easy and quick in higher knowledge.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po la 'jug par byed pa'i mi lcogs pa med pas bsam gtan khyad par can ni lhag mthong gi shas che ste dka' ba dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ni zhi gnas kyi shas che ste dka' bas de dag la gang zag dbang po rtul po zhugs pa ni mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i lam zhes bya'o //üîΩmi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi po de la dbang po rnon po zhugs na ni mngon par shes @279b pa myur la dka' ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po la 'jug par byed pa'i mi lcogs pa med pas bsam gtan khyad par can ni lhag mthong gi shas che ste dka' ba dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ni zhi gnas kyi shas che ste dka' bas de dag la gang zag dbang po rtul po zhugs pa ni mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i lam zhes bya'o // mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi po de la dbang po rnon po zhugs na ni mngon par shes @279b pa myur la dka' ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: The special meditative stabilization of the preparatory stage of the first meditative stabilization is predominantly insight, since it is difficult to enter and it is difficult to enter it with dull intellectual faculty.üîΩThe four formless meditative attainments are predominantly serenity, since they are difficult to enter and it is difficult to enter them with dull intellectual faculty.üîΩThe person who enters those is said to be on the path of slow clear knowledge and slow faculty.

original: bsam gtan bzhi po de la dbang po rtul po zhugs na ni mngon par shes pa bul la sla ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po de la dbang po rtul po zhugs na ni mngon par shes pa bul la sla ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: If a person of sharp intellectual faculty enters those, the preparatory stage of the first meditative stabilization, the special meditative stabilization, and the four formless meditative attainments, it is said to be the path of slow clear knowledge and sharp faculty.üîΩIf a person of dull intellectual faculty enters those four meditative stabilizations, it is said to be the path of slow clear knowledge and slow faculty.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi po de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi cha mnyam pas na de la dbang po rnon po zhugs na ni mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi po de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi cha mnyam pas na de la dbang po rnon po zhugs na ni mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: The four dhyanas of the form realm are the balance of serenity and insight. Therefore, when those of sharp faculties enter them, they are called the easy path with quick higher perception.

original: bsrung ba med pa bzhi la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa bzhi la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The four fearlessnesses are the completely pure conduct of the Tathagata's physical actions.

original: sku'i phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa ni sku'i phrin las 'gro sdod 'dug nyal gang ci mdzad pa yang srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i nyis dmigs cung zad kyang mi 'byung bas gzhan gyis dpyas shing smad pa'i dogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku'i phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa ni sku'i phrin las 'gro sdod 'dug nyal gang ci mdzad pa yang srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i nyis dmigs cung zad kyang mi 'byung bas gzhan gyis dpyas shing smad pa'i dogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The completely pure physical actions of the Tathagata are the physical actions of going, staying, sitting and lying down. Even when he does these, he does not have the slightest fault of taking life and so on, and so he does not have the slightest fear of being criticized and reviled by others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi phrin las kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi phrin las kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The four correct knowledges are the completely pure conduct of the Tathagata's verbal actions.

original: gsung gi phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa ni ngag gi nyes pa brdzun la sogs pa bzhi spangs pas dam pa'i chos 'chad pa la sogs pa na tshig gi skyon gzhan gyis dpyas su dogs pa cung zad kyang mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa ni ngag gi nyes pa brdzun la sogs pa bzhi spangs pas dam pa'i chos 'chad pa la sogs pa na tshig gi skyon gzhan gyis dpyas su dogs pa cung zad kyang mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: The absence of any impure activity of speech is due to the avoidance of the four faults of speech lying, etc. and so when the Tathagata expounds the holy Dharma, etc. he is not at all concerned that others might find fault with his words.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi phrin las kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi phrin las kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The conduct of the Tathagata's activity of mind is pure.

original: thugs kyi phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa ni yid kyi nyes pa gsum spangs pas dam pa'i chos dang sems can gyi don la dgongs pas na gzhan gyis tshor du dogs pa'i 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa ni yid kyi nyes pa gsum spangs pas dam pa'i chos dang sems can gyi don la dgongs pas na gzhan gyis tshor du dogs pa'i 'khrul pa mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: The absence of any impure activity of mind is due to the avoidance of the three faults of mind and so, since he is intent on the holy Dharma and on the welfare of beings, he is free from the error of being concerned that others might find fault with him.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshor ba yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshor ba yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The Tathagata's feelings are pure.

original: 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pa med pa ni tshul 'chos shing sgyu gsog gis 'tsho ba spangs shing shes rab kyis chos bzhin du 'tsho bas na gzhan gyis tshor du dogs shing bcab dgos pa'i skyon mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag pa med pa ni tshul 'chos shing sgyu gsog gis 'tsho ba spangs shing shes rab kyis chos bzhin du 'tsho bas na gzhan gyis tshor du dogs shing bcab dgos pa'i skyon mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas have no impure livelihood because they have given up the hypocrisy and deceit of a wrong livelihood and they live in accordance with the Dharma through their wisdom. They are therefore free from the fault of having to be on their guard and hide things from others.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la /
translated: The eighteen distinctive qualities of the bodhisattvas

original: ma bstan pa'i sbyin pa can rnams /
analyzed: ma bstan pa'i sbyin pa can rnams /
translated: The generosity of those who have not been taught

original: ma bstan pa'i tshul khrims can rnams /üîΩma bstan pa'i bzod pa can rnams /
analyzed: ma bstan pa'i tshul khrims can rnams / ma bstan pa'i bzod pa can rnams /
translated: The discipline of those who have not been taughtüîΩThe patience of those who have not been taught

original: ma bstan pa'i brtson 'grus can rnams /üîΩma bstan pa'i bsam gtan can rnams /
analyzed: ma bstan pa'i brtson 'grus can rnams / ma bstan pa'i bsam gtan can rnams /
translated: The diligence of those who have not been taughtüîΩThe concentration of those who have not been taught

original: ma bstan pa'i shes rab can rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma bstan pa'i shes rab can rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The wisdom of those who have not been taught

original: so so'i skye bo rnams la ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rang bzhin dang / yon tan dang / 'bras bu rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan zhing bskul na sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug gi /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams la ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rang bzhin dang / yon tan dang / 'bras bu rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan zhing bskul na sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug gi /
translated: Ordinary beings, when they are taught by spiritual masters about the nature, qualities and results of the six transcendent perfections, will engage in generosity and the other transcendent perfections.

original: byang chub @280a * //
analyzed: byang chub @280a * //
translated: enlightenmentüîΩ

original: sems dpa' rnams ni sngon pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod spyod pa'i bag chags dang goms pa'i shugs yod pas gtan tshigs kyis ma bstan ma bskul kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa la rang bzhin gyis 'jug go zhes bya bar kun la sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems dpa' rnams ni sngon pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod spyod pa'i bag chags dang goms pa'i shugs yod pas gtan tshigs kyis ma bstan ma bskul kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa la rang bzhin gyis 'jug go zhes bya bar kun la sbyar ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas, having previously practiced the transcendent perfections, have the habitual tendency to do so and the momentum of their practice, so they engage naturally in generosity and the other transcendent perfections without having to be told to do so or to be urged to do so.

original: de la sbyin pa'i rang bzhin ni phyi nang gi dngos po gzhan la gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i rang bzhin ni phyi nang gi dngos po gzhan la gtong ba'o //
translated: The nature of generosity is to give away outer and inner things to others.

original: yon tan ni bsod nams sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni bsod nams sogs pa'o //
translated: Its good quality is the accumulation of merit.

original: 'bras bu ni bde 'gro mtho ris dang sangs rgyas thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni bde 'gro mtho ris dang sangs rgyas thob pa'o //
translated: Its result is rebirth in the higher realms of the happy states and the attainment of buddhahood.

original: tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin ni sdig pa mi dge ba la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin ni sdig pa mi dge ba la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: The nature of discipline is to refrain from negative actions and nonvirtue.

original: yon tan ni bsod nams 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni bsod nams 'phel ba'o //
translated: Its good quality is the increase of merit.

original: 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'da' ba dang bde 'gror skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni mya ngan las 'da' ba dang bde 'gror skye ba'o //
translated: Its result is the attainment of nirvana and rebirth in the higher realms.

original: bzod pa'i rang bzhin ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang sems mi khro ba'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i rang bzhin ni gzhan gyis gnod pa byas kyang sems mi khro ba'o //
translated: The nature of patience is to refrain from getting angry with others even when they harm you.

original: yon tan dang 'bras bu ni gong ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: yon tan dang 'bras bu ni gong ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: Its good quality and result are the same as those of generosity.

original: khyad par du cha lugs sdug cing mdzes la 'khor mang du 'du ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par du cha lugs sdug cing mdzes la 'khor mang du 'du ba'o //
translated: In particular, one has an attractive and beautiful appearance and attracts many followers.

original: brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin ni mi dge ba spong zhing dge ba sgrub pa'i rgyun mi gcod pa'o ;
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin ni mi dge ba spong zhing dge ba sgrub pa'i rgyun mi gcod pa'o ;
translated: The nature of diligence is to be uninterrupted in abandoning nonvirtue and accomplishing virtue.

original: / yon tan ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / yon tan ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gnyis sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities are the accumulation of both the merit and wisdom collections.

original: 'bras bu ni bsam pa thams cad mthar phyin cing sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni bsam pa thams cad mthar phyin cing sangs rgyas su 'grub pa'o //
translated: The result is that all intentions are fulfilled and one attains buddhahood.

original: bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin ni dmigs pa sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi rang bzhin ni dmigs pa sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: The nature of concentration is to focus the mind one-pointedly on an object of meditation.

original: yon tan ni shes rab dang ye shes kyi tshogs sogs pa'o//
analyzed: yon tan ni shes rab dang ye shes kyi tshogs sogs pa'o//
translated: The qualities are the accumulation of the wisdom and gnosis collections.

original: 'bras bu ni tshe rabs thams cad du sems bde zhing lus la nad med pa dang mthar 'tshang rgya ba'o //üîΩshes rab kyi rang bzhin ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni tshe rabs thams cad du sems bde zhing lus la nad med pa dang mthar 'tshang rgya ba'o // shes rab kyi rang bzhin ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The result is that in all one‚Äôs lives the mind is happy, the body is healthy, and ultimately one attains buddhahood.üîΩThe nature of wisdom is to be skilled in the general and specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: yon tan ni ye shes kyi tshogs sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni ye shes kyi tshogs sogs pa'o //
translated: The qualities are the accumulation of the wisdom collection.

original: 'bras bu ni tshe rabs thams cad du rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas shing 'tshang rgya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni tshe rabs thams cad du rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas shing 'tshang rgya ba'o //
translated: The result is that in all one's lives one becomes learned in all the sciences and one attains buddhahood.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos pos sems can rnams sdud pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos pos sems can rnams sdud pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Attracting beings through the means of attraction.

original: gang zag ser sna can ni sbyin pas bsdus te dge ba la 'god /
analyzed: gang zag ser sna can ni sbyin pas bsdus te dge ba la 'god /
translated: One attracts stingy persons through generosity and establishes them in virtue.

original: zhe sdang can ni byams pas bsdus te dge ba la 'god //
analyzed: zhe sdang can ni byams pas bsdus te dge ba la 'god //
translated: One attracts those who are hateful through loving kindness and establishes them in virtue.

original: nga rgyal can ni sems dang mi 'gal bar don mthun pas bsdus /
analyzed: nga rgyal can ni sems dang mi 'gal bar don mthun pas bsdus /
translated: One attracts those who are proud through being consistent with their minds and attracting them through being in accord with their aims.

original: le lo can rnams ni las kyi grogs byas te don spyad pas bsdus nas dge ba la 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: le lo can rnams ni las kyi grogs byas te don spyad pas bsdus nas dge ba la 'dzud pa'o //
translated: One attracts those who are lazy by being a companion in their work and attracting them through being in accord with their activities and then one establishes them in virtue.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i cho ga shes pa ni dge ba phran tshegs chung ngu yan chad kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te bla na med pa'i byang chub chen por bsngos pas bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med par 'phel @280b ba'o ;
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i cho ga shes pa ni dge ba phran tshegs chung ngu yan chad kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te bla na med pa'i byang chub chen por bsngos pas bsod nams kyi tshogs dpag tu med par 'phel @280b ba'o ;
translated: One who knows the ritual of dedication dedicates even the smallest virtues to great, unsurpassed enlightenment, making them common to all sentient beings.

original: / thabs mkhas pas sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa'i dbang gis theg pa mchog gis 'byung ba ston pa zhes bya ba la snying rje dang shes rab ldan pa ni thabs mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / thabs mkhas pas sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa'i dbang gis theg pa mchog gis 'byung ba ston pa zhes bya ba la snying rje dang shes rab ldan pa ni thabs mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He who possesses compassion and wisdom is called skillful in means.
